And while the hotel itself and the room were spotless, the restrooms in the cocktail lounge downstairs were really not clean (we visited the lounge only once, briefly,  while waiting for our taxi to the airport).

This was my 2nd stay at the Bryant Park Hotel, and we will definitely return on our next trip.

title: Très bien
text:
Hôtel très bien situé en plein cœur de Manhattan. Face à Bryant Park 

Les chambres sont propres, le service est de qualité et les personnes agréables. Nous avons passé un séjour très agréable au sein de cet hôtel. Idéalement situé et proche des principaux spots de NYC. Station de métro à 100 mètres de l’hôtel

title: Highly recommend the Bryant Park!
text: We’ve just left the Bryant Park hotel after a fabulous week in NY. The Bryant is in a perfect location overlooking the park with lots of coffee shops and an ice cream booth. Our room was definitely larger than I expected from a central city hotel. . The duty manager, John Castillo, looked after us very well and I’m now planning a return trip with our daughter. Highly recommend

title: Really enjoyable stay
text: The hotel staff are all extremely helpful, friendly and welcoming, in particular Jo and John on the front desk. It's a great location for both work and pleasure in New York with easy access to Central Park and restaurants / bars nearby.

title: Big Rooms Big Service
text: Being a boutique hotel owner myself I can appreciate excellent service!  From the moment we walked in the door we were greeted and looked after by the lovely front desk agent Jo.  She went above and beyond to make sure our stay was nothing less than perfect and her enthusiasm was contagious!  Our room (606) was a very generous size and the bathroom for New York was huge.  The hotel  location is excellent and walkable uptown to downtown and cannot say enough about Bryant Park.  We spent our last night enjoying a concert and perfect weather and was a great end to summer 2022.   Same time next year:)

title: Oasis in New York
text:
This hotel is an oasis of calm amidst the hustle and bustle of NYC. Great location in midtown for exploring the city and worth booking a room with the park view.
Having the park on the doorstep was an added bonus- great for just chilling after a busy day on the streets. Easy walking to Broadway and eateries. 
All the staff were friendly and polite - from the team in the cocktail bar (great playlist guys!!!), to Jasmine, our housekeeper, who kept the room spotless. The reception team of Jo and Scott deserve a special mention for their help - a real entertaining double act!!
Would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent Location, Service and Architecture
text:
I booked the Bryant Park hotel for its location,  history and architecture, the building the former American Radiator Building served as a model for the design of the Park Hotel on Nanjing Road, Shanghai, designed by the famous László Hudec. Story has it the Park Hotel inspired the young I.M. Pei to become an architect. 
Bryant Park Hotel did not disappoint, except that the bar was closed the two days I was there, the beauty of this building for those that enjoy Art Deco is unsurpassed as is the location close the the NY Public Library and MOMA as well as Bryant Park itself. 
The room was elegant, high ceilinged and comfortable, I thought the bed could have been better, did not think it was up to 5 Star Standard, but that is just my opinion. 
The front desk people were superb, Veronica, Shannen, Zaaul, Joe and John, they were professional and I enjoyed bantering with them.  I shall return, they were saying that more improvements are coming and I'm looking forward to my next visit.

title: Great hotel, amazing service, fantastic location
text:
I stayed at the hotel for 9 nights at the end of August 22, with my 21-year-old son.
I love this hotel. I booked a standard room but when we arrived I asked to upgrade to a room with two beds.
We got a huge room, two luxurious beds, a dining area, and a large shower with a bathtub, that was perfect and worth every dollar. 
The service at the hotel was fantastic, the staff was attentive and kind and helped me with every issue during my stay. Everyone at the front desk was amazing, especially Veronica Calero, John Castillo, John C, and Dwight Izaaul. 
The location of the hotel is dreamy – right on Bryant park, subway under the hotel, and everything is nearby, only a 5-10 minute walk.
I have been to New York many times, this was one of the most indulgent. I'll definitely will return to stay at this hotel in the future, thank you for a wonderful stay, highly recommended.

title: Best hotel & location for a New York experience
text: We stayed for 4 nights when we arrived in NYC then booked a further 5 nights after we came back from Washington as we had such a good experience. Great location, staff very attentive and excellent friendly, attentive staff with an Impressive attention to detail. Efficient service & support in every area. Also the concierge staff were very helpful. Will go back  again definitely

title: An oasis in midtown Manhattan
text: Great location. The park is your front yard and has so much to offer. It’s a great place for breakfast.Large rooms with park views and well stocked minibars. There are super friendly people on the front desk, Jo, Zaoul and John (sic). Will be our NY go to in the future.

title: Decent Stay, Good Staff
text:
Overall a good experience, especially for NYC. 
Removed a star for cleanliness & valet situation.

I stayed during the end of August 2022 and they had discontinued valet, apparently due to COVID. This was disappointing as it was one of the reasons I picked the hotel. They should note this on the website. I was pretty tired from the drive and moving a kid into college and didn't want to spend time finding parking so I decided to self park at their suggested garage for $45 a night with the hotel discount.  Other hotels in the area are doing valet as the garage was nearly full with hotel vehicles.

As far as cleanliness, just a few surfaces and areas looked as if they were overlooked. The bed isn't overly comfortable if you are on the heavy side.

title:
Bryant Park Hotel
An unforgettable ecperience!!!👍👏
text:
Hotel maravilloso!! Vistas fantasticas! Posicion centrica inmejorable en corazon de la ciudad!!
Restaurante increible!! The best japanese restaurant in town
El personal del hotel es muy profesional, amable, atento y siempre disponible con una sonrisa!!
Una experiencia inolvidable!
 gracias a Veronica Calero
Roy , Shannon, Dwight

title: Family 2022
text:
We called the Bryant Park at 5:00 AM  from PDX, heading to NYC.  It was a  last minute call to see if things had remained after the pandemic.  Johnathan Castillo answered the front desk reception phone!   To my delight he remembered my voice and warmly greeted me!  

We booked a room at The Bryant Park,  the room was perfect, light and bright and clean.  4 big picture window open out to the park and city scape.  As remembered,  the linens were crisp and the bed was perfect.  
Everything was thought through, the black out shades pulled down at night create the darkest coolest sleeping space.  

This hotel offers luxury accommodations, expert customer service and great location, next to The Bryant Park, Grand Central Station, and the New York Public Library.  

Up in the AM for free coffee service, what a nice touch.  
A perfect start to a fun family weekend.

title: Outstanding!
text:
This is my favorite hotel of all the hotels I've stayed in in NYC over four decades. It truly is outstanding on so many counts. We've stayed three times now and have grown to recognize some of the staff who are so pleasant.
Scott, at the front desk, is exceptional—welcoming, professional, and helpful. He always goes the extra mile to make our stay comfortable. All the staff are wonderful—John, Dwight and others at the front desk, Ray at the main entrance, Tenzen in housekeeping. 
The rooms are nice sized by NYC standards, and the suites with balconies are spacious and comfortable. Bathrooms are delightfully spacious. We've experienced our share of teeny hotel bathrooms in Manhattan and the Bryant Park Hotel bathrooms were a pleasant surprise the first time we stayed. We've had rooms overlooking the vibrant Bryant Park which is nice to look out onto but also to enjoy food, drink, people watching and various activities (I did two Gotham Writers' free classes in the Bryant Park outdoor reading room). Yoga in the park and movies in the park seem to be very popular. 
The bar in the hotel basement, Celan, is beautifully furnished and well stocked—a great place to meet friends over a drink. The restaurant Koi serves wonderful Japanese and Japanese-fusion food as well as delectable cocktails. 
The hotel is a short walk from restaurants, cafes, shops, Times Square, Grand Central Station, Broadway, Rockefeller Center.
Just writing about the Bryant Park Hotel makes me wish I was back there. I hope I can visit again soon. Rates are reasonable given the location, space, and service. 
Thank you to Scott and the team for yet another brilliant stay!

title: Great location, value, and rooms!
text: We were thrilled with this hotel - just a couple of blocks from Times Square, yet a world away.  Our room was quiet at all hours and unusually large for Manhattan, with a king bed, loveseat and table and a full bath with separate tub and shower.  Everything was clean, comfortable, and well-appointed, and the staff were warm and helpful.  It's right across the street from Bryant Park, a lovely green space with tables and chairs,  surrounded by cafes, perfect for strolling and picnicking.  They also offered a very good deal on overnight parking at a nearby garage.  We would most definitely stay here again!

title: Wonderful!
text: After our visit at your hotel to see our grandson we can honestly say that we will not go anywhere else.  Very friendly and helpful staff that went above and beyond.  Wonderful location, wonderful amenities and wonderful people.

title: Gets better every time!
text: Bryant  Park Hotel never disappoints! This visit was our best yet! Jon checked us in and was fantastic!! We had the most beautiful room complete with a balcony! Everyone is so friendly and kind! We checked out with Jo and she was phenomenal too. There is no where else we would stay in the city!

title: The staff is the best around
text: Jo who works at the front desk/concierge made my trip. I was there on business and she was just outstanding and funny and kind. I will stay there again and again due to her and the attention to detail and customer service they provide.

title: Best Place to Stay During US Open
text:
The rooms are spacious and clean.
The staff are professional and accommodating.
You have beautiful view of Bryant park. 
It is walking distance from all my favorite stores.
The subway station that goes to Flushing is right across the street.

title: Repetiría sin dudar, pero con tapones para oídos
text:
Para poder disfrutar de un gran viaje, hospedarte en un buen hotel es imprescindible. Y así ha sido aquí.
La ubicación es inmejorable, cerca de Times Square, Empire State, Rockefeller center, Quinta Avenida, ... con paradas de metro justo al lado, y el por supuesto parque que te ofrece desconexión, tranquilidad y entretenimiento a todas horas y que se convierte en la perfecta bienvenida antes de entrar al hotel.
El edificio donde se encuentra el hotel tiene mucha personalidad e historia, que también es un punto interesante.
El personal es inmejorable: atentos, resolutivos, educados y empáticos. Especialmente Zaaul, Rey y por supuesto John, quien nos facilitó mucho la estancia.
Y en lo importante, las habitaciones son cómodas, con ventanas al exterior, luminosas, bien aclimatadas, con muchas facilidades (secador, plancha, paraguas, caja fuerte,...) . El baño muy amplio y cómodo, la ducha maravillosa, y los productos de baño buenísimos. La limpieza es impecable. El pequeño desayuno (muffins y café) que ofrecen en la entrada es un buen detalle para empezar el día, al igual que el agua fría que tienen siempre durante el resto del día.
El único fallo es la insonorización del dormitorio. La primera noche pensamos que era por la actividad del parque (que también es un factor los días de conciertos), pero la ubicación la pagas en este aspecto: tráfico, obras y demás ruidos que para mí y mi marido, supuso imposible dormir sin tapones para los oídos. Teniendo en cuenta el precio, también esperaba una cama más grande (era de 150cm).
Por todo lo demás, perfecto. Repetiría sin dudar.

title: Most Amazing People Work Here
text: I recently got engaged in NYC and planned a surprise in this hotel. I spoke to John and he was very friendly and made it his mission to make sure everything went well that day. He did just that, he went above and beyond and everything went perfect, John even check in with us after the proposal and congratulated us both. Very great staff and location make this hotel the best stay in the city.

title: Great Locationaand Service
text: This hotel is in a great location across the street from all the incredible activity in Bryant Park.  It's close to many great restaurants (including KOI which is in the hotel) and shopping in midtown Manhattan with easy access to several subway lines.  The decor is clean and contemporary.  John C. at the front desk is amazing and made my stay perfect!  The complimentary muffins and coffee in the morning were delicious.  The only downside for me was the lack of room service.  Overall a very solid choice, especially for the price.

title: I love this hotel!!
text:
Recently, I stayed this hotel for a full week.
It is little old-style, but well-managed and carefully desinged for guest' convenience.

I chose this hotel due to the location.
Location is great but the hotel and the service are even better.
As I booked a superior room, I didn't expect much.
As I had expected I was assigned a room backside(not park side), but it was not bad at all.
My room with a terrace was spacious and quiet away from the park noise. I loved the room.

What more suprising is the elevator.
During my stay I used the elevator almost a hundred times. However, I mostly waited for less than 10 seconds.
And I share the elevator with others only twice.
I mean I always use the elevator alone right away!!
I don't know how it works...:)

Anyway this is an amazing hotel and I strongly recommend.
Staffs are helpful and friendly.
Location, room, service, staff...everything was so perfect.
I appreciate Veronica for her kindness and having me the room.

THANKS ALL!!

title: Way Above Expectations
text: First of all, I do not give 5 stars, at least not usually. So believe me when I say, this was the best hotel stay I have had in recent memory. My husband and I were able to check in early, (a treat indeed), we were greeted with kind people and big smiles. These kind people remembered us, laughed with us and even looked at pictures of my grandchildren. The room was beautiful, the beds comfortable, the view was amazing and the location was easily accessible to anything we needed. In fact, we walked to most places. John and Shannon were especially delightful and made our trip so enjoyable. I gladly recommend Braynt Park Hotel to anyone who is staying in NYC!

title: Bryant Park Hotel Will Not Disappoint!
text: My husband and I stayed in the Bryant Park Suite for my wedding weekend/night and everything was AMAZING! The staff & entire experience was everything we hoped for and so much more. I can’t wait to go back!

title: Beautiful Hotel so Glad we Chose it
text: Honestly couldn’t rate this hotel high enough what a lovely time my Husband and I had on our first ever trip to New York and actually USA. ( We are from the Uk ) From checking in with help from the very charming and friendly Dwight to checking out with the equally charming and friendly Scott. Our room was magnificent overlooking beautiful Bryant Park and a super spacious luxurious bathroom with gorgeous products. We had beautiful cocktails in Celon Bar in the basement and muffins and coffee in the lobby every morning. I asked for a fridge in our room so that we could have drinks and it was there on our arrival which was a massive bonus in the New York summer heat. Well done Bryant Park Hotel you certainly deliver and we hope to visit you again in the future 🇬🇧✈️🇺🇸👩🏻‍🤝‍👨🏼

title: Hospedagem maravilhosa
text:
Banheiro é muito bom! Banho bom, tem roupão, chinelo, sabonete cheiroso. Cama boa! Localização excelente! Agua, café e muffins disponiveis para toros os hospedes. Vista linda para o Bryant Park! 
Adorei o hotel! Atendimento da Sharren e John. 

John era muito simpático, querido e atencioso!!

title: Beautiful hotel, first-class service and amazing location
text: Bryant Park Hotel is a gem located in the heart of Manhattan.  You are only a few steps away from a vibrant park and once you enter the hotel, you are transported to a world of luxury and peacefulness. We were greeted at the desk by a wonderful Director named John Castillo who was gracious and extremely welcoming.  He made our stay truly memorable.  The rooms are spacious and bright with a very nice bathroom and a well-stocked minibar. And there is fine dining right inside the hotel. I can’t wait to return.

title: Best service
text: We stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel for our wedding and the service was excellent!! They displayed our welcome sign, handed out welcome bags for our guests and even surprised me with chocolates and a photo collage! In our room, they provide tall chairs for makeup, an extra fridge, and a steamer. I would strongly recommend the hotel. The service from start to finish was A+.

title: Bom hotel, preço justo pela entrega
text:
Hotel de boa qualidade no centro de Manhattan. Considerando a região, é um hotel bom se levar em consideração todos os concorrentes.

Acredito que im ponto que precisa melhorar seria oferecer café dentro da diária. Na ocasião não me foi oferecido café.

title: Luxury at a fair price and a fantastic location, this is my favourite hotel in NYC
text:
Real  class is everywhere in this hotel. 
My room was spacious and light with many windows and a fantastic view across the park and the public library. 
Luxurious bathroom with all the little creature comforts. 
Housekeeping is immaculate. 
There is complimentary breakfast by the elevators in the morning and later fresh lemony water all day. 
Concierge advice is efficient and reliable. 
Location is fantastic, so close to everything in Manhattan. 
Many excellent restaurants nearby: Koi right next to the hotel, Pecora Bianca a few meters away and Cafe China round the cor er. 
My tip: get coffee and a croissant from the two bakeries in the same street and have your breakfast in Bryant Park, it’s a lively but still quiet place to start your day in NYC

Whoever is running this hotel is doing Eve thing right and has a great team to work with.
After many times in NYC I have finally found the perfect place to stay

title: Great boutique hotel in midtown NYC
text: If traveling to NYC, I highly recommend the Bryant Park Hotel in central Manhattan!  From the moment we arrived to the moment we departed the service was friendly and efficient.  The room was clean, comfortable and well-equipped.  We particularly appreciated the fact that slippers and cozy robes were provided — something many hotels no longer do.  The mini-bar was also well-stocked.  The bed was particularly comfortable, and we liked the nice large bathroom with a shower (that had great water-pressure) and a nice large soaking tub.  The soaps & shampoos provided were good quality.  The location of the hotel is fabulous — right across from Bryant Park, which has lovely cafes and fun things to do, and the NYC Central Library.  Transportation options (buses/subway)around the hotel are plentiful, making it easy to get anywhere.  The hotel does have a fun cocktail lounge and Asian-themed restaurant attached.  One small downside, is that the hotel does not have a breakfast cafe, but they do offer complimentary coffee and muffins in the morning. (They also have iced water available in the entry hallway the rest of the day.).  But there are ample breakfast options around the hotel.

title: Location and Wonderful Staff
text:
Came to midtown for opera in Bryant Park 8/12, hotel is across the street from the park and easy walking  distance to many places of interest but far enough away from Times Square to avoid the touristy types and associated urban denizens. Staff are super accommodating and cordial, rooms minimalist but with subtle flair.
Upgrading to a park view room is well worth the extra cost, especially if your lady ifs into flashing you at the southeast entrance!

title: Art Deco hotel
text: Σε πολύ κεντρικό σημείο αλλά και πολύ όμορφο αφού μπροστά στο ξενοδοχείο βρίσκεται το ομώνυμο πάρκο. Το κτήριο με τους 25+ ορόφους σε στυλ Art Deco  χτισμένο το 1930. Εσωτερικό σε ζεστό κόκκινο χρώμα όπου απέναντι από τη ρεσεψιόν υπάρχει ένα πολύ καλό σούσι εστιατόριο το ΚΟΙ.  Οι υπάλληλοι στη ρεσεψιόν πολύ θερμοί και οι κύριες και οι κύριοι  έτοιμοι να απαντήσουν σε οποία απορία . Ευχαριστώ τον Zaaul και το συνάδελφο του στην είσοδο για την βοήθεια. Το δωμάτιο basic από διακόσμηση αλλά πολύ καθαρό και επίσης το μπάνιο πολύ άνετο και καθαρό. Σεντόνια και πετσέτες αλλάζουν κάθε μέρα εκτός αν τους ενημερώσεις να μην αλλάξουν.  Πρωινό αν και λέει στο booking πως παρέχουν δεν είναι ακριβώς πρωινό. Καφές φίλτρου και κέικ σε ένα πάγκο στην ρεσεψιόν. Τέλος σχέση ποιότητας τοποθεσίας και τιμής πολύ καλή. Εκεί θα μείνω όταν πάω ξανά NY.

title: GREAT LOCATION AMAZING STAFF.
text: My husband i stayed during June for 6 nights with our girls 19 and 9. It was a wonderful stay great location close to everything. "Zaaul" at the front desk went above and beyond to make our stay memorable and comfortable. We will definitely come back any time we visit NYC

title: Lovely stay at Bryant park
text: One of the most comfortable and lovely stay. Looked after Scott and his team. Scott made sure all our needs were looked after. Did not feel that it was my first visit. The entire team Scott , Bob and everyone made us feel very welcome. Scott was helpful from the word go till we checked out. Would recommend this hotel for the excellent location, lovely staff and super comfortable rooms.

title: Absolutely great, as usual.
text:
We booked for 5 nights. Our junior suite was clean, nu tingle/ tangles, bright and absolutely great. 
The front desk personal was super friendly and helpful. 
The bed was soft and rally comfortable. And we loved the neighborhood. 
Thanks for your hospitality!

title: Great location
text: Perfect location adjacent to Bryant Park and walking distance from pretty much everything midtown- Empire State Building , Rockefeller Center, theaters, time square, etc.  The hotel was modern and clean- free breakfast coffee and muffins for us going each day. Great AC during the heatwave. Cold lemon water in the lobby each day. Surprisingly quiet at night so we slept great. I traveled with my 10 y/o son and he loved it, but he was the only kid we saw there.

title: Best hotel stay ever!
text: Veronica and Ray went above and beyond during my family’s stay at the hotel. We had three different rooms for the family and everyone was so impressed. The entire stay was pleasant, rooms were clean, service was excellent, and we would recommend staying here to anyone!

title: Location, location, location
text: The best thing about this hotel is the location, perfect for exploring everything NY has to offer, either by foot or on the Subway which is only 2mins from the hotel. Staff friendly. Rooms quite basic but clean and a good size. The breakfast included in the price is complimentary coffee and muffins each morning but plenty of other places nearby to get a good breakfast. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Very good accomodations, location and staff
text: We were very pleased by the size and commodity of the rooms. It is very well located at the center of new york and has a gym and a sauna. The staff was also very helpful, especially Levi, who went out of his way to make our stay an amazing experience.

title: Very special visit.
text:
Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights this month. Had a wonderful time. Both Dwayne and Scott were exceptional hosts and the room was just perfect. We looked over the park which was very special. The bed was perfect and the bathroom exquisite. Couldn't fault this hotel at all. Every person we met who worked there was friendly. Can't wait to go back. 
Thankyou Bryant Park Hotel

title: Gem of a hotel in Manhattan 👌🏻
text: We are in love with the staff at the Bryant Park Hotel.  They make their guests feel special and well attended to.  We especially enjoyed Veronica, Scott and Zaaul.  They couldn’t be more helpful.  We had a really good experience here a few months back and decided to come back.  It was even better this time.  Our accommodations were pristine and sleek.  We had plenty of room, a beautiful view of Bryant Park and best of all, a gigantic bathtub! The location is very convenient and we can’t wait to come back again as soon as we can.  This is how time away from home should be.

title: Great choice
text: We stayed here five nights and had a fabulous corner suite. The views over Bryant Park and the midtown skyline were amazing, and you can't beat the location. The king bed was very comfortable. The bathroom has very modern fixtures, great water pressure, fluffy towels. All staff members were  ready to help at any time, and John was especially kind and accommodating.

title: Good View of Park but Tired
text:
Great location for my meetings and pleasant view from the front of the hotel of the Park.  The hotel itself is a bit tired and quirky.  I think it was going for a contemporary look originally and the corridor to the room was bright and white.
The room was a little tight but adequate for a one night stay and the bathroom was surprisingly spacious with a tub and walk in shower.   WiFi , TV and other amenities were normal.  Staff were friendly  and the bar in the cellar was welcoming.  The breakfast was mediocre and the table tops felt sticky.  No tablecloths.  
Overall it was fine but not somewhere I would go back to with so many fine hotels nearby.

title: An amazing hotel to stay in. Located near to lots of tourist attractions, seconds from the subway.
text: Scott and Veronica need a big shout out for all the advice and knowledge they shared with us - Dwight too! They are first class ambassadors for the hotel. The whole team are great and very welcoming. We recommend this hotel to everyone seeking a relaxed atmosphere, with great rooms too.

title: Best time ever
text:
I stayed here for 5 days while visiting relatives in the city. Best experience ever. Staff was more than amazing, clean hotel, very friendly. Thanks John Castillo, Dwight, Veronica. Miss u all already. 1705 was my room. I can't wait to come back again and hopefully will be able to stay in my favorite 1705 room. Beautiful park views and very spacious. You all made me feel very special. Thank you all so very much. ❤️

Elliott Talavera
😍😍😍

title: good time
text:
Everyone was nice and great. The only down side is that no one was there to open the havy front door of the building.
We have 2 kids and a large stroller. It was difficult to go in and out.
ZAAUL was great with us. Very good person.

title: A faire et à refaire !!!
text:
Accueil parfait… 
Chambre spacieuse…
Literie au top…
Très grande SDB avec douche et baignoire…
Et pour couronner le tout… une terrasse !!!
Localisation idéale pour visiter NYC…
Un énorme merci à Veronica pour l’organisation… nous reviendrons !

Je recommande fortement !!!

title: Excellent service
text: We stayed 5 days at Bryant Park hotel. We arrived at midday and we were given our room. Through out our stay John Zaaul looked after all our requests and made our stay memorable. We have been to NYC many times but this may be the best hotel we have stayed so far. The rooms are bigger, close to the subway and many other places we visited. Would have been nice if there was a kettle in the room but there loads of cafe's around the hotel.

title: super guest friendly and effecient !
text:
Because the shading effect of the curtains was not good, I woke up at 5:30 the first morning. After I told the front desk, Mr. John Castillo and Mr. Chris Zaavl helped me find another room with perfect shading, and they helped me move my bagge. The second morning, Mr. John asked if I slept well and when I woke up.  

They really care about guests' feelings and solve problems in the shortest time. I appreciate very much!

Moreover, they provide the kettle to my room so that I can drink my favorite tee.

title: Superb stay with outstanding service
text: This hotel is a gem in a great location overlooking the beautiful Bryant Park, giving you easy access to all the spots. The hotel design is chic and rooms feel modern and spacious. Most importantly the staff is outstanding, they make a genuine effort to make your stay as comfortable as possible with kindness, dedication and utmost professionalism, I want to take this opportunity to thank each one I interacted with, Zaaul, Jon, Ray, Jefferson, Scott and Tenzin, thank you so much again for an amazing stay, plan to come back and make Bryant Park Hotel my pied a terre in the city. Also a very special thanks to the room service that discovered my phone in the locker--I completely forgot I it put there-- and made every effort to return it to me, thank you!

title: The staff was user friendly and always available.  The ambiance and cleanliness was great!
text:
The front desk manager or he might have been THE manager was great to work with.  His goal appeared to be to make us happy and help us with any questions we had.
They were great with giving us help on finding places we wanted to visit.

title: La mejor ubicación
text:
Hotel céntrico. Cerca de todo. 
Elegante. Habitaciones amplias. Limpio. Luminoso. Lindo! Estadía impecable! 
Lo mejor : la atención en el front desk de John C. y de Verónica Ray. Dos genios! Hacen que uno quiera volver siempre al Bryant Park Hotel .

title: La mejor estadía
text:
La mejor ubicación de Nueva York. 
Calidad , Cerca de todo.
La atención súper cálida. 
En el Front desk, tuvimos la suerte de conocer a John C.
Ojalá siempre que vengamos esté él !!! Muy solidario y resuelve todo lo que necesitamos. 
Un genio! Sin palabras.
Muchas gracias por todo!

title: Estadia excelente
text:
La ubicacion y el servicio es excelente
Habitacion muy limpia y una vista al park divina
Cerca de todas las atracciones de la ciudad.
En el front desk, nos atendio John  C, muy amanle y resolvio todas nuestras inquietudes.
Felicitaciones al hotel y a su personal

title: Luxurious, spacious room with fab views
text:
Luxurious, spacious room with fab view. Front. Desk staff were wonderful. Having the amenity of Bryant park on the doorstep is total bonus. Everything was clean and well maintained
Didn’t use the restaurant or cocktail bar, so cannot comment on these

title: Their staff is just excellent!
text:
The staff was just over the top excellent and accommodating!! Veronica was just the best! We had a wedding and my husband had to run out she help me out on my shoes and zip up my dress! Saved my day!!!
The bell hop can’t remember his name was also just amazing with storing our bags even after we checked out! Love this hotel! Perfect location too!

title: MANHATTAN, and still just a few steps into the PARK
text:
Clea room, spacious bath room, great cocktail bar in the cellar, friendly staff, walking distance to SUMMIT
One Vanderbilt, Grand Central Terminal, 5th Ave, 6th Ave, Times Square, Rockefeller Center etc., and of course to the BRYANT PARK. This is the most beautiful part: You get out of the hotel, and there is … a PARK!!!

title: Great service
text: Filmed two corporate interviews at Bryant Park Hotel. Barrymore in sales and Chris Torres are multitaskers who could not have been more helpful, accommodating and pleasant to deal with. Definitely recommend The Bryant Park Hotel and these two employees specifically for their professionalism and service, but the entire staff was also wonderful to work with. Everything ran smoothly.

title: Biked the Empire State Trail to the Bryant Park Hotel
text:
My wife and I do long distance (500 - 1500) mile trips on our bicycles, completely self-supported. The trips can be challenging and we like to reward ourselves at the end with a stay in a nice hotel. We spent ten days biking from Buffalo to Albany and down the Hudson Valley to Manhattan and rode right into Times Square and then to Bryant Park and walked our bikes into the lobby of the Bryant Park Hotel. Scott and Zaaul were at the desk and a bit surprised when we walked in, all kitted up, with helmets and wheeling our bikes with panniers. We started talking and we told them we’d ridden there and they were asking us questions, including, finally, did we actually have a reservation at the hotel? We said yes and told them this was our reward. Scott said “we’ve never seen that before!” and then told us he was going to upgrade our room. We took the elevator up to the room on the ninth floor overlooking the park and were amazed at the size and beautiful view. They’d given us an early check in and we showered quickly and actually made it to the last matinee of “Girl from the North Country” (we are Dylan fans from Minnesota.) The day was one of the highlights of my life, to be honest.

The rest of our stay was delightful and John made checkout and getting our bikes ready to walk to Penn Station easy. 

The hotel is in a great location for Broadway and we walked down to the Village a couple times, as well. Highly recommend this hotel and can’t wait to get back!

title: One Night Perfect Stay
text: Each staff member treated us well, and gave us an unsolicited upgrade to a great room overlooking the park.  For a change, being in the room was a good thing.  It was quiet, clean, and comfortable.  This will be our first pick going forward as we love this part of the city.  Close to the action without being insanely close.

title: Back to Big Apple three nights before Italy trip
text:
We had join trip with son from California so we planned to meet and relax before that. We love Bryant Park and this is a perfect location to branch out mid-town Manhattan for three nights! Service desk (Veronica) was very helpful and accommodating. It’s clean and the view we had from the window was nice. 
When remodeling finished (2 months) it will be even better which it will be in full service mode and all polished up to enjoy!

title: Perfect NYC Stay!
text: As a native New Yorker staying as a tourist in my own city, I can be very particular. This property has the most amazing views, a classic design, beautifully appointed accommodations and an incredibly attentive and smiling staff. Seeing NYC back to life with daytime views of Bryant Park filled with happy people and activity and nighttime spectacular views of the city in action. Great walkable location to so much of NYCs best restaurants and attractions. If you can treat yourself, upgrade to one of the balcony rooms. It is like having your own private NYC rooftop. Just magical.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Chambre spacieuse et confortable, excellente litterie, accueil très agréable, bon café et muffins servis le matin. Vue magnifique sur le parc. Service du personnel parfait, tres disponible. Parfait lieu de villègiature  pour un sejour à New york !

title: A true gem among NYC hotels
text: This is as close as you could get to a 5-star hotel without paying for one. We used to live and work  in the City for 20+ years and are not easily impressed. From all the staff to luxury accommodations, everything was just wonderful. We’ll be back!

title: MUY RECOMENDABLE
text:
Lo que nos encantó:
La ubicación es increíble. El Bryant park es hermoso para desayunar, almorzar, estar al aire libre. Siempre hay o Jazz, o clase de yoga, un área de lectura con libros, o algún evento. Es un oasis en medio de midtown, que a veces es demasiado abrumadora por la cantidad de gente, pero está cerca de todo. Nos hicieron un upgrade y nos alojaron en una suite ESPECTACULAR en el piso 21 con living, kichinette con anafe y heladera, baño y además un toilette. El baño era gigante, con bañera y ducha, pantuflas, secador de cabello, batas y todo lo necesario. Muy luminoso todo. Las vistas INCREIBLES. La atención del personal siempre fue muy cordial y atenta. Hicieron la limpieza todos los días. Está rodeado de muy buenos lugares para desayunar o almorzar. Hay varias opciones muy cerca. Mucha gente compra algo y se sienta en mesas y sillas del parque.
Lo que menos nos gustó tanto:
El hotel no tiene Lobby no hay sillones ni lugar de estar, solo un mostrador. Cuando entramos nos pareció muy decadente, antiguo, el ascensor pequeño con luces rojas.... pero después nos acostumbramos y la habitación y la ubicación nos hicieron adorar el hotel. En la habitación no había cafetera ni calentador de agua, que me parece fundamental. El restaurante era demasiado formal para el desayuno y el ingreso era mas bien cerrado. Todas las mañanas ponían una mesita al lado de los ascensores, es una especie de pasillo, con termo de café americano y muffins (a veces no había) de 7 a 10hs con leche, azúcar, vasos descartables como para llevar a la habitación o al parque. Aunque estábamos en un piso 21, se oían los ruidos de las sirenas o algo extremo. Había tapones para los oídos en el baño.... no eran necesarios. Estuvimos muy tranquilos. Sin lugar a dudas nos volveríamos a alojar.

title: Another perfect stay
text: Another wonderful stay in a marvelous room, for work and play. Thank you so much for having us! As known, perfect location and friendly, supportive, and committed staff. Free coffee and assorted pastries in the morning, even on weekends.

title: The best place to stay in the city
text: A beautiful place to stay! All the staff were so kind and welcoming.  Paul was so helpful when booking our room and making sure we felt right at home.  Would recommend this room to anyone wanting to stay in a clean, comfortable, and beautiful  hotel in the city!! Will be booking again in the future!!

title: Home away from home for NYC
text: I feel bad that I failed to take the time, until now, to write a review from my October stay for my mom's 84th Birthday!  We loved our room (we upgraded a bit, as we needed two beds) and the view, we hope it will be our home away from home for future NYC visits!  The front desk staff (Scott if memory serves me correctly)/valet went over and above the night of my mom's special birthday dinner to get us transportation... Due to my underestimating how long it would take to get to the restaurant and Uber cancellations, etc.   And, they helped with every other question/need we had!  Next time we are in NYC, we see ourselves returning without hesitation!!

title: Localização, localização e localização
text: A localização do hotel é sensacional, de frente para o Bryant Park. 150m para a 5ª avenida, 300m para a Times Square, várias linhas de metrô ao redor e 200m de uma excelente Whole Foods (que funciona como ponto de entrega da Amazon, outra ótima razão para ficar nesse hotel). Quarto padrão era de bom tamanho e o banheiro com espaço muito acima do normal de NY. Staff muito atencioso e prestativo. Ficamos apenas por uma noite devido a atraso de voo, mas voltaríamos tranquilamente para uma hospedagem de mais dias.

title: Way too noisy
City vibe
text: This is the only place we stay in the city, staff awesome, location awesome, rooms are great, walk to all the shops, restaurant’s, broadway, you name it, it’s here, and Christmas time is magical, the ice skating rink, the lights, the Christmas tree, just beautiful

title: Great location and wonderful staff
text: Just returned from a 4 day trip to NYC with my2 adult  daughters, celebrating Mother's Day and birthdays. The Bryant Park Hotel was wonderful! Great location - close to everything and very accommodating staff. To stay within our budget we opted for one room for all 3 of us. This is a problem in NYC as most hotels  have very small rooms and standard size beds. In addition there is not usually room for a sofa bed or roll-away. I reserved the room months ago and called to confirm all was well before we left. I spoke with John who asked me a few questions about our trip and once he realized all 3 of us were sharing the room he upgraded us to a bigger room with2  King size beds!!! Unbelievable - of course he could not promise the room would be available but said he would put it in the notes so if it was we would get it. Not only did we get the room, it was the junior suite, early check in and champagne was also waiting our arrival.  We could not have been more pleased and we highly  recommend the Bryant Park Hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Terrific Escape
text: I had such an wonderful experience at this hotel. Normally I would stay at the Marriott on Times Square but decided to stay some where different and found this hotel (The Bryant Park Hotel). As soon as you come in you are greeted warmly by the bellman (Zaul) and at check-in.  I had the pleasure checking in With Anthony as he made it memorable he provided my wife and I drink voucher for celon Bar. This pleased my wife and such an Amazing bar. This need a Six star Such friendly and amazing Staff.

title: The Bryan Park Hotel checks all the boxes to experience an excellent visit.
text:
Excellent experience for me at the Bryant Park Hotel. Upon arrival I received a very friendly, professional and prompt welcome. The room was neat, clean, very fresh and overall very much above my expectations for New York City. Excellent location. 
Excellent hotel. 
Definitely my hotel of choice for future visits.

title: Stellar staff at my home away from home
text: I have spent over 60 nights at BHP over the last year and since day 1 was treated as a highly valued guest.  The hotel checks all of the boxes with spacious, well-appointed rooms, lovely views of the park, and a great on property bar (Celon) and restaurant (Koi). Ultimately, it's the personal touches and the way the staff looks after me that sets them apart.  Shout out to Scott, John, Veronica, Zauul, Anthony, Dwight, Mark, Lon, and Barrymore. They have made me feel so welcome.

title: Great hotel, great location
text:
The Bryant Park is a comfortable, modern and stylish place, located across from a six acre park including the New York Public Library. Broadway, Times Square and the entertainment district are brief walks or short cab rides away.

The rates were good for what you'd expect, given that we booked a spur-of-the-moment weekend trip only a few days ahead, late in April. We had a clean, modern room with a great panoramic view overlooking the park. 

Housekeeping responded promptly to requests late in the evening and were friendly.

The entire staff was helpful and a joy to deal with, especially Veronica, Scott, Jon and Zaaul.  

We hope to return to the city soon, and will definitely book at Bryant Park. Highly recommend.

title: Great home base location to explore NYC!
text: Great midtown location very much centrally located and easily accessible to many subway lines and plenty of attractions are within walking distance.  Plus the rooms are very big especially for NYC standards.  I was very pleasantly surprised.  I had a park facing room and was even upgraded to a junior suite and it was fantastic with a huge bathroom!  I see a few complaints about the 'breakfast' offered which is just muffins and coffee but really, you are in the middle of the city and plenty of options all around so that was not a big concern.  The restaurant on site, Koi, is also very good.

title: My Home Away From Home
text: I'm a Philadelphia girl whose heart beats faster and happier when I'm in NYC. It's my favorite city to visit, and The Bryant Park Hotel is my favorite hotel. There are many reasons why my husband and I love to stay there. As soon as we enter the lobby, we are always greeted by name. John at the reception desk couldn't be more charming and helpful. His genuinely enthusiastic welcome and warm smile always get our vacation off to a happy start. Our suite on our last visit overlooked Bryant Park and was bright and lovely. The housekeeping service has always been excellent with a generous supply of towels, toiletries, and complimentary slippers. Each morning at 6:45 in the lobby, there are complimentary muffins and coffee -- a convenient way to start the day without leaving the hotel. At every visit we try to have at least one meal  at Koi, the fabulous Japanese restaurant in the hotel where the sushi is always fresh, delicious, and beautifully plated. Another wonderful feature of the hotel is the excellent location -- a short walk to shops and theaters and right across the street from Bryant Park where it's fun to sit and relax with a snack amid the lovely spring flowers. I always enjoy staying in The Bryant Park Hotel. It's truly become my home away from home.

title: NYC at it's BEST!!!
text: Old New York glamour!! Travel back in time to when New York City's charm was in full swing. Art deco fabulousness is hiding in plain sight in this perfect location. (Across street from Bryant Park & the NY Public Library). Most incredible service & hospitality. Zaaul & Veronica are available at every moment with outstanding service. They will make you feel right at home with their kindness & warm welcome. Rooms are renovated, charming, enchanting & clean clean clean.  I am a highly satisfied native New Yorker. Will definitely be back soon!

title: Fabulous customer service
text: Great hotel, and even better customer service. John C at the reception was just the best, over and beyond the call of duty - thank you for a really special and memorable stay for my daughter's 18th birthday!

title: Great experience in midtown Manhattan
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at Bryant Park Hotel in late April.  We were there for 6 nights and found the hotel a great option for anyone wanting to explore Manhattan and New York in general.  The hotel is really well located for exploring and seeing Manhattan and beyond.
The staff were really friendly and couldn't be more helpful whenever we asked them for advice or assistance.  John and Veronica at reception were always smiling, chatty and a pleasure to deal with. Our Junior Suite on the 10th floor was really nice, with a comfortable bed, spacious bathroom (the power shower is amazing!) and fantastic views across Bryant Park.
If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel to use as a base for business or pleasure in Manhattan, you can't go wrong with the Bryant Park Hotel.  Just be aware that you're in midtown Manhattan in the city that never sleeps, so take some ear plugs if you want a quiet nights sleep!  Also, if you like cocktails or spirits, as with every else in Manhattan, the measures served are considerably bigger than at home in the UK, so be warned!

title: Heart of it All
text:
I haven't visited Manhattan for almost 2 years for reasons we are all aware of. So when I decided to head in for a weekend get away I choose The Bryant Park Hotel for location.  What a location!!  Walkable to Penn Station, right on Bryant Park and 2 blocks from Grand Central. Really walkable to almost everywhere.
   I was very impressed with the staff, attentive, friendly and helpful.  My room was amazing! Large, well light so clean and very spacious.  The bed was awesome and the shower to die for.  One of those showers that you want to spend the day in. Felt like I was at the Spa.  I had a great view of the park and enjoyed the convenience of crossing the street to the park to enjoy the shops and places to eat. 
  The complementary muffins and coffee were a bonus.  I will go back again. I didn't get to try the sushi restaurant that I heard was top notch.  Great hotel, quiet rooms fantastic staff, comfortable, clean and well located

title: We will never stay on Times Square again, it’s so much better here!
text: Top class place to stay and the nicest staff in any hotel we’ve ever stayed especially John C. We’ll be back in August if not sooner. Book a room with view of Bryant Park. We were on 8th floor but might go higher the next time. NY Library and all 5th Avenue and Times Square delights within 5 minutes walk from here.

title: Gem in midtown
text: We stayed here to celebrate a milestone anniversary earlier this month and loved our experience here. The room was large, clean, well appointed and comfortable with a beautiful view of Bryant Park. I couldn’t believe how quiet it was in the middle of Manhattan.  Veronica was especially accommodating of a special request. . Great service in helping us with our luggage when leaving. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Amazing Hotel Experience
text:
My first trip back to NYC since before the Covid pandemic and my 3 night stay at The Bryant Park Hotel was amazing!! I loved it!! My room on the 17th Floor was very comfortable and spacious and very quiet. I slept like a baby and the snacks in the fridge were great!! The fitness center on the 5th Floor was perfect and the bar Celon had great cocktails and super service. Its central location on 40th Street made walking everywhere (Including Times Square for 2 Broadway shows) very easy.

John was wonderful and made me feel like a VIP GUEST at the hotel. I will definitely be returning to the Bryant Park Hotel very soon. Thank you!!

title: Fantastic Location
text: Check-in was effortless and John was friendly and accommodating. He truly made us feel like VIPs. Our room was spacious, clean and had a million dollar view overlooking the park. Rooms were equipped with robes, slippers, and luxurious towels. Being across the park,  it was quiet at night and bustling during the day. Fantastic midtown location. Highly recommend this great hotel.

title: Average at best and not worth the price tag
text: Overall a subpar experience for the city this hotel is in and the price that we paid. The hotel oozes IKEA, duct tape and the ambiance of a shady liquor store. While the front desk staff were nice, the decor was extremely lacking and basic to an extreme - nothing like the photos. The AC did not work and on cool days made the room feel like a furnace. The front desk in the photos is not the front desk, it’s actually a random desk in the middle of the entry hallway that you have to walk around to get to the elevators. They also threw an invalid charge on our departure bill and despite querying it have not removed it. The $600 per night price tag did not reflect the quality or service we expected.

title: Was great to be back to our home away from home
text: Before Covid, this was the spot we spent 8 or so weekends a year for Broadway visits. We have multiple stays canceled due to Covid. When we arrived back in mid April at the Bryant Park Hotel, it was like walking into a hug. The entire staff is courteous and John is especially brilliant. So glad Covid didn't close the Bryant Park Hotel and we look forward to visiting again in a month or two.

title: Good location - cool building
text: Good location at Bryant Park, central but quiet. Hotel is in the iconic American Radiator Building. Relatively spacious room for New York. Liked the updated bathroom.  Very friendly staff. They got some free muffins and coffee for breakfast if you don’t have time in the morning. The Koi downstairs is an excellent Sushi restaurant. Hotel is good but not super special. I would consider coming back.

title: Magnifique hôtel en plein centre ville, absolument conseillé
text:
Hôtel parfaitement situé au cœur de midtown, vraiment pratique pour visiter la ville. 
Les chambres sont meublées avec goût,  simples mais chaleureuses et très bien équipées. Si vous en avez la possibilité, choisissez une deluxe située dans un etage élevé et demandez pour la 2003. Non seulement elle est super lumineuse grâce à sa position d’angle avec 3 fenêtres, mais en plus elle jouit d’une magnifique terrasse avec vue imprenable sur la ville. Honnêtement ça vaut la visite que pour ça!

title: John is the best!
text: We were greeted by John at our early 10 am arrival from Florida, expecting to drop off our luggage until it was check in time at 3pm. John however had a room ready for us. Not just a regular room but he took notice that it was my birthday weekend and upgraded our stay to a fabulous suite on the 18th floor. This was the first time we received such a generous upgrade anywhere and it truly set the tone for a wonderful stay. The room was equipped with everything we requested; extra towels, robes and slippers were all ready for us. This was my second time staying at this hotel and I wouldn’t hesitate to book it again any chance I get. We had a busy trip planned but can truly say that any staff members we encountered with were nothing but courteous and kind. Suites are spacious, clean (wood floors) and the views of Bryant park are just fantastic. Huge thanks to John again!

title: Hotel junto al Bryant Park
text:
El hotel está ubicado frente al Parque. Las habitaciones son cómodas, luminosas y con un excelente servicio de limpieza.
El personal del hotel muy amable.
Especialmente John y Zaaul que estuvieron  atentos a ayudarnos haciendo nuestra estadía más grata aún.

title: Special anniversary at the Bryant Park Hotel
text:
We will definitely return to stay at the hotel,it was a great trip and you guys went above and beyond.Especially Veronica,she was fantastic. Thanks for making our trip smooth and fun. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. We asked the cleaning staff for a few things and they couldn’t have been more helpful and kind.
Thank you for making our wedding anniversary so special. Veronica is a rock star.

title: Can't wait to return
text: If you're looking for a hotel with an exceptional location, spacious and modern rooms, a great shower, and excellent value for money, look no further. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, and the morning coffee and muffins a lovely little perk. I can't imagine staying anywhere else on our next trip to NYC. This is a true gem of a hotel.

title: Great service and teams!!!
text: I had a great experience again at Bryant park.  It was my first visit post COVID.  There were some new faces this time but the mgmt - John and Scott - took exceptional care of me.  I extended my trip 2 times and they were very accommodating everytime.   Them along with Dwight at the front desk and the super charming bellman ( whose name I forget) truly made my visit wonderful

title: Wonderful overnight stay
text: We were looking for a nice hotel to celebrate our anniversary and we found it.  Veronica, John and the rest of the staff were so welcoming, pleasant and helpful with recommendations.  Our room was spacious, clean and had a great view of Bryant Park.  Location is great walking distance to subways, restaurants and all there is to do midtown.  Was happy to be back in the city I love and we will definitely be back to this fabulous hotel.

title: Nowhere else but BRYANT PARK
text: Prior to COVID, Bryant Park has always been my home while in NYC. Once you discovered this magnificent well located hotel, its amazing rooms - with stunning views of the park and the City - some with increible terrasse and above all the very dedicated staff that would do anything possible to make your stay memorable, you have no choice but to keep on coming back. After 2 years without coming to NY, I came back to Bryant Park Hotel and as always, never ever disappointed. Love you all there and see you again soon.

title: Clean, great location, decent sized room
text:
Very clean and well-appointed hotel.  Great walking to Bryant Park, NYPL, Koreatown, subways, and a lot of French cafe-type places in that area. 
Bed was comfortable. Room had luggage rack, umbrella, closets, two robes, extra blanket, desk, radio, TV, dimmable lights, plus toiletries. 
Our room had a walk - in shower, accessible to wheelchair or walker.  Lots of grab bars in the bathroom, which was handy to use as a towel drying bar.  We were there for 4 nights and there was no housekeeping during that time, so the towel drying options were useful.  
There was a minibar we didn’t use. 
There’s typical NYC street noise and very noisy when other guests were slamming doors but there were ear plugs available. 
Staff was polite - really good customer service. 
Big shout out to Veronica at front desk for your help and thank you to Concierge John - he was very helpful in booking/confirming our room plus recommending restaurants in the area.

title: Wonderful Staff & Best tubs in the city!
text: I love staying at the BPH.  The warm welcome Veronica & the rest of the team at check in provide sets up the perfect visit.  The housekeeping staff make you feel like nothing is too much trouble!  Comfortable beds, and in case the sounds of the city aren't your thing there are even white noise machines in the rooms.  My favorite part beyond the staff is the marvelous soaking bathtubs.  Walk your feet off and then return to unwind in the best tub in the city!  I can't recommend Bryant Park Hotel highly enough.  Incredibly convenient too.

title: Only positives were the location and view (if you have a park view room)
text:
We stayed here in November 2021 as part of our honeymoon. We opted to stay at another NYC hotel for our actual wedding night, but then transferred to the Bryant Park Hotel for the remainder of our stay (5 nights total). The location is nice and the view we had of Bryant Park was excellent, but beyond that, there was nothing special about this place that would make me come back again...especially considering the price.

Over the five nights we stayed, we had two interactions with staff, neither of which went well. After first checking in and getting into our room, we called the front desk for some extra hangers. We were told that they would be sent right up...five days later, still no hangers. When we were checking out, we left our bags as we had a later flight. We also pre-arranged a car service to take us to the airport at a specific time. When we returned to the hotel at the alotted time, there was no ride. We waited almost half an hour, while being told numerous times that it was running late and it was almost here and that traffic was bad. Well, it was quite evident that they had forgotten to make the arrangements because after waiting all the time, we were told our cab had arrived? No idea what happened to the SUV we had arranged. Why would it take half an hour for a cab to arrive, I could've walked outside and simply flagged on down (which is obviously what they did).

The lobby was not very inviting. They have a front desk/reception area to the left when you walk in the main doors; however, there is also a secondary 'security' desk as soon as you walk in, which is the only desk that seems to be used (the other reception area never seemed to be used). They boast about having 24 hour security, well the one night we walked in, the person sitting at the desk was full out asleep in the chair (it was about 1am) and we simply walked by him to the elevators.

All in all, won't be returning to this hotel. Rooms were very modern and spacious, but not worth the price they charge. They also boast about having muffins and coffee available in the lobby...which they did, but neither of which looked very inviting (small table with a handful of muffins and a coffee dispenser.

title: Great stay, perfect location, amazing staff
text: Just had a great birthday weekend with my family, easy arrival, great rooms and view of Bryant Park. Every staff member helpful and friendly and went above and beyond. Had  an amazing dinner at Koi, (Asian fusion) where every plate was outstanding. Bar downstairs is beautiful as well. Can’t go wrong here

title: i loved this hotel and  location
text: Great staff and lovely room. The location can't be beat for midtown.  Room was large for NYC with decent view.  Very clean and bathroom was well done.  Shower was larger and new.   Bryant Park is directly across the street

title: Zuviel Szene… zuwenig Leistung
text:
Das Hôtel ist in die Jahre gekommen und man nimmt den Servicegedanken auch nur selten wahr. Die Lage ist klasse, die Zimmer etwas abgenutzt und in den meisten Fällen das Personal zurückhaltend mit etwas zu viel Arroganz.
Auch das Koi hat nachgelassen und lebt davon, dass es Szenetreff ist. Man sitzt Schulter an Schulter mit anderen Gästen. In Corona Zeiten nicht immer witzig. Dafür ist die Nummer nicht günstig.

title: Amazing Service!! Amazing Stay!!!
text: The Bryant Park Hotel, is conveniently located near Times Square.  What makes this place extraordinary is the level of service. Our first interaction was with the manager John and to say not only was he pleasant the weekend before a major holiday but he was also extremely resourceful in telling us exactly where we should go for our meals. The room was clean and tidy and spacious for being in the center of Manhattan. I recommend everything about this hotel. I will say it is a little bit more expensive than the average hotel however you get dividends received in the amount of service and just overall politeness and location of this particular staff and hotel. I’d highly recommend if you are coming to New York City that this is where you should stay.

title: Zona pittoresca
text:
L'hotel si trova a Bryant park, in una zona davvero da film, molto pittoresca, dietro alla biblioteca. 
Le camere non sono spaziose, ma pulite e arredate in stile minimal e moderno.
La reception ha spazi ridotti ed il personale non è particolarmente cordiale, ma poco importa.

title: A perfect NYC hotel experience
text: I’m not a man of many words, so please pardon my brief review. We have stayed at this hotel several times over the years and have been not only satisfied, but impressed, with every visit. The park-view junior suite is our favorite, although there are more luxurious options. The facility is immaculate. The staff is impeccable. Tight security, also — while not being imposing. Everything you could ever want in the line of restaurants, shopping, theater, etc. is within walking distance. This is our go-to NYC hotel, as you can probably tell.

title: Great views and location, large rooms and fairly priced
text:
My wife and I were very happy with our stay at the Bryant Park Hotel in November 2021.  We booked a Junior Suite and had amazing views from the 19th floor.  The room was very large by Manhattan standards with a king sized bed, terrace and a large bathroom with separate bathtub and shower.  The location is great -- walking distance from Broadway, the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center and other midtown attractions, but not too close to Times Square, which we wanted to avoid.  It's particularly good to visit when the Bryant Park Winter Village is open.  

We found the bed to be comfortable, however even on the 19th floor, there was a significant amount of outside noise until around midnight.  There's also a lot of light from surrounding office buildings, so don't expect it to be too dark and quiet at night. It wasn't an issue for us (and they also provide a white noise machine), but keep that in mind if you're not a good sleeper.

I've seen several reviews mention the small dark elevators and while they're not huge, they really didn't make me anxious (and I don't love elevators).  The onsite Japanese restaurant, Koi, is very good, but expensive.  If you're looking for a more bargain priced meal, especially for breakfast or lunch, you should check out the Red Flame Diner on 44th street between 5th and 6th Ave.

There aren't a lot of amenities, but you don't come to Manhattan to stay in your hotel and the room was fairly priced considering the size and location. I'd definitely stay here again.

title: Wonderful Stay at Bryant in NYC
text: My wife and I were looking for a great boutique hotel in NYC and we found it in The Bryant Park.  Outstanding staff - kind, available, very interested in each guest.  We had a very comfortable corner room with beautiful views. Outstanding location - the Bryant Park area is a peaceful oasis in the city and yet only a short walk from Times Square and theaters.  The area is particularly nice in Nov/Dec with pop up shops, lights, and rink in the park.  Recommend dinner at Koi New York at the hotel - and when walking around the city don't forget to grab a slice at Joe's Pizza in Time Square.  We will certainly look to stay at the Bryant Park Hotel in the future.

title: NYC weekend getaway
text:
Excellent hotel and staff close to Times Square. 
Our room was equipped with everything we needed plus garment bags, slippers, Robes, fabric travel bags etc.  coffee was a quick hop down the elevator.  
We had an amazing sushi restaurant and night club on site and we’re a 5 minute walk to Times Square.  The staff were so polite and helpful and saved us $500 USD on our Covid tests by pointing us in the right direction to free same day tests to get back to Canada. I’d stay here again for my next NY trip.

title: Family Vist to NY
text: The staff was very professional, helpful and welcoming.  Location of this hotel is perfect for visiting NY.   Our suite was huge and loved the view of the Bryant Park.  Our son was with us, and when checking in, the desk clerk recognized he would be sleeping on the day bed.  Without me even saying anything a staff member met us at our hotel door and made up the bed for him.  This  is now my go to hotel when visiting NY.

title: Not 9.2
text: Disappointing: did not match Tripadvisor ranking.  Inflexible staff, mechanical faults in bathroom, bad breakfast (muffins were cheap sugar bombs and coffee had only bad non diary creamer).  The location is convenient though

title: No front desk in midnight
text:
My booked junior suite near midnight and came in found out front desk staff is off work and only a security guy in the reception, he’s friendly and trying to check us in but obviously it’s not his profession so it took about 30 minutes for him to find our booking in the system and give us the key.
The room is spacious and the suite is facing Bryant park so the view is nice.

title: Perfect NYC location
text: The Bryant Park Hotel is a wonderful place to stay - we've been twice during the pandemic and they have done a great job under touch circumstances. So nice to feel warmly welcomed and cared for with covid-safe protocols in place. Gorgeous room each time with views of the skyline and Bryant Park, huge bathroom, nice touches like warm robes. Great location for walking everywhere.

title: Location, location, location!
text:
Pros:  Location on south side of Bryant Park, offering lovely view if one's room faces it.  The view  - and proximity to the park and all things midtown - is pretty exceptional for NYC, meeting if not exceeding our high expectations.  Renovated hallways & rooms.  Spa-like bathroom: large shower with fixed & handheld shower heads, quality tiling, large soaking tub & well-lit vanity.  CLEAN!  Coffee & muffins available in the morning near reception.  Well-themed cocktail lounge named Celon within hotel. 
Cons:  Bed mattress could have been more supportive. 
FYI:  1) Very modern, minimalistic decor within rooms.  2) Obviously like all hotels at this time, some service aspects (e.g., reception area that is utilized) are adapted, but this did not impact our experience.

title: Charming little hotel, with a great location
text:
My wife and I live in Connecticut, and decided to celebrate our anniversary by spending a couple of days in the City.  We chose the Bryant Park Hotel for a number of reasons - its proximity to Grand Central Terminal, the subway within the same block, its view of Bryant Park - our favourite park in the City, and (rather obscurely), the location's association with Nicola Tesla.
This is a rather nice location - a small skyscraper, built in the Twenties, and nicely renovated. We splurged a bit, for a room overlooking the park, and were not disappointed.
Because of the Pandemic, a number of services weren't available - no mini-bar in the room, and no room service food, but this wasn't unexpected, and didn't bother us; rather than have the complimentary coffee and muffins in the foyer, we walked half a block and had breakfast in the nearby Pain Quotidien.
The nearest subway station was half a block away, and the walk to GCT was just a couple of blocks. Location, location, location.
I've given them only four stars, because of the pandemic restrictions, but when we come back, post Covid, who knows.

title: Very disappointed!!!! Don't stay here.  NYC has so many great hotels and this isn't one of them.
text:
Very disappointed in the service and suite.  Front desk clerk was beyond rude and not at all helpful or friendly.
the suite was in need of an update, or at least a fresh coat of paint.  the mismatched leather furniture had stains on it ( I am pretty sure the substance would be revealed had we had a black light ) - the table had water ring stains and the walls were kind of banged up.  the windows were filthy. Keep in mind, this was a suite and by far not the least expensive room in the building. No one ever answered the phone. I had to go to the lobby to get an iron and ironing board. Upon arrival i was told that they do not provide an iron or ironing board in any room. ( still baffled about that one ) The fridge was empty and smelled moldy. there is no room service.  the elevators are beyond small and they are dark and creepy.

title: A True NYC Gem
text:
I’ve visited New York City often and I regret this was my first stay at this Boutique Hotel.  It is truly a Diamond in a city that has a lot of Cubic Zirconia hotels.

 The quality of service, friendliness of staff, and cleanliness of rooms would rate this hotel 5 out of 5 stars alone, however, bonus points are awarded to the concierge/staff of the hotel.  Each team member went above and beyond to make you feel like a valued guest.  Whether it was housekeeping, maintenance, or the front desk. In particular Bryan, Tony, and Scott were exceptionally professional and helpful.  

The rooms are spacious and the King size bed was actually a King Size bed by American standards and not NYC standards (Queen) 

With regards to location, you could not ask for a more convenient setting which places you only minutes from the heart of Times Square and within steps from the beautiful green space of Bryant Park. 

I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and anyone who asks for hotel suggestions in NYC.

title: Excellent Hotel. Excellent Location. Great Value.
text: Lovely hotel. Great central location for business or vacation (and in a prior life I lived and worked in Manhattan). Very friendly, attentive staff. I think very good value too. Room was very comfortable. Small detail, but loved the bolster on the bed for neck support. Will definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC, and highly recommended.

title: Best boutique hotel in NYC!
text:
My ‘Go To’ favorite hotel in New York!  Why?  

Boutique hotel with very helpful, professional  and friendly staff.

Excellent location directly across the street from Bryant Park and the NY City Library in Midtown. 

Beautiful, spacious Junior Suite with huge windows overlooking the park (my room was 607).  Huge shower and separate bath. Great hot water and water pressure.
By far best hotel room I’ve ever had in NYC. Of course, it was a junior suite.

Firm but comfortable bed.  Excellent A/C.

Spotlessly clean room.

Thanks to all the guys at the front desk who were so help as well as the housekeeping staff who do such a great job!  I look forward to seeing you again soon.

title: Conference Services are ON POINT!
text: Our company had a last minute meeting pop up and their team delivered. We were able to get all our catering & meeting space requests in to them with flawless execution by their team. The space was beautiful with views of the city. We definitely will work with their team in the future.

title: Great location, Plus discount was great
text:
I chose this hotel both because of its great location in Midtown (near all the key subway and bus lines) and because it had a great Tripadvisor Plus discount for my stay.

It's really in a perfect location for exploring the city.  We wandered up to Rockefeller Plaza by foot, hopped on the train to visit Chelsea and Brooklyn, hopped on the bus to visit the Met.

The showers are excellent.  The room itself was good, felt a little dated, but clean and comfortable.  There was a lot of thumping bass noise from something going on in the park each night, and a lot of noise in general coming up from the street and the park through much of the night (they may have been doing some sort of filming or setup for the weekend concerts in the park, adding to the noise).  The windows apparently don't keep out much of the noise, so we were kept awake by it more than expected.  (I think the hotel tried to address it by having a white noise generator available in our room, but I'd rather they upgraded the windows.)  The window blinds were also in poor shape and so we got a lot of light leaking in throughout the night.  The noise and the light made for poor sleep, unfortunately.  Our bed was surprisingly firm but we didn't have any problems with soreness from the firmness.  Each side of the bed (in the junior suite) had 2 pillows that felt like different levels of softness, which worked well for us.

The front desk staff was very kind and accommodating.

Traveling during COVID sucks, even as the city is starting to repoen.  There was no room service (they had complementary coffee and muffins in the morning) and they were only servicing the rooms every other day.  I don't hold either of those against the hotel; I'm just looking forward to COVID being fully over someday.

title: Impersonal and underwhelming, but oh, those high ceilings...
text: Been staying here for years to celebrate wedding anniversaries. Used to reserve via Tablet and get fabulous upgrades, but hotel doesn't belong to Tablet any longer so paid full-fare for the Jr. Suite we usually end up in.  Check-in was remarkably unremarkable...not particularly warm or welcoming front desk; very perfunctory and didn't improve when we came and went. No one opening the hotel door, so felt rather impersonal. Thankfully, Jr. Suite was on a high floor, with the usual wonderful high ceilings, and views. That's the positive. Not the hotel's fault, but VERY LOUD booming music echoed off the buildings around the park and killed any sort of romantic atmosphere until it finally ended around midnight (we heard sirens blipping around then which ended the party). In other words, if it is a lovely Fall/Spring/Summer night, be prepared that the street noise may be VERY audible even on a high floor. Furnishings seem a bit dated now...the leather accent pillows, for example were probably hip when they first appeared but now just seem kind of strange and certainly not something you would leave on the bed to lean against and relax. The mattress seemed to sag and pillows were flat and rather than sinking into them, were the opposite of comfortable. Rain shower style shower faucet on the other hand was great and Molton Brown toiletries appreciated.  Will we stay again for our next anniversary? Not so sure.

title: Pleasant Stay in Midtown
text: Had to come to NYC for business and found a great hotel located right across the street from Bryant Park. The room was very spacious and both John and Scott were very helpful at the front desk. I will definitely stay again at the Bryant Park Hotel next time I have to come back into the city

title: Home Away From Home
text: I have been wanting to stay at The Bryant Park Hotel Forever.  3 of our trips were cancelled during 2020 so I was so excited about finally being able to stay there.  The experience from start to finish was beyond our expectations. The hotel is beautiful and we were very comfortable in our room.  It was very spacious and the decor and feel of the room created a great environment.  The location is perfect - Bryant Park at your front door, wonderful restaurants surrounding the hotel, subway a quick walk away, stores (Walgreens etc) conveniently close.  Our favorite thing about The Bryant Park Hotel were the incredible employees though.  From the booking to the check out, they made every interaction fun and personable.  It was an instant connection with them.  Everyone went above and beyond to make our stay an experience - not just a few nights in a hotel.  They made us feel like we were a part of their family.  It really did feel like we were returning home at the end of each night.  Our daughter is a freshman at NYU so we will be spending a lot of time in the city visiting her and we know that we have definitely found our home away from home with The Bryant Park Hotel.  Thank You.

title: Great Location
text: I recently stated at the hotel with my girlfriend for the weekend. The room was so nice and the bed was so comfortable. The view- across from Bryant Park and the Ice skating rink was so amazing. I also loved the Japanese Restaurant that was on the first floor. I would recommend anyone visiting NYC to stay here.

title: Richie Rich Designer
text:
Over the years Myself and My Family from all over have stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel! I’ve hosted parties with Elle Magazine and Warner Bros. In the Penthouse Suite for New York Fashion Week.

I’ve also have hosted parties in the fabulous Celoné Bar downstairs super cool and the drinks are delicious and the staff is amazing!

Many exquisite times at Koi restaurant connected to the Hotel whether with friends or for business.... the menu is to die for!

The Bryant Park is my favorite go to in NYC! The rooms are so Chic and at the same time so welcoming and comfortable- amazing amenities as well as great housekeeping.
The door staff is so friendly and accommodating at any whim!

A very big perk, besides the glory of the actual Hotel is the location! Views of Bryant Park literally outside of your windows! Subway trains directly across the street so centrally located to go all over Manhattan and the other Boroughs!

title: Great Rooms, exciting locations and a cozy feeling
text: Already from the outside the hotel is impressive with its Gothic Art Deco style. Inside your are greeted by the exceptional friendly staff. You will have a warm and comfortable feeling throughout the premises. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are especially generous in size. You will find bathtubs bigger than in most hotels. The view is so "very New York" with lovely and lively Bryant Park right outside - during the winter you can watch people ice skating, sometimes in the falling snow. Very romantic. The neighborhood is as central as it can be with many Manhattan attractions nearby. I recommend staying in this hotel to everyone.

title: Biggest and best bathroom ever
text:
I love staying at the Bryant park hotel. It’s super central, it has a beautiful view at the park and the rooms are super clean and it has the biggest and most beautiful bathroom I’ve ever seen! The bathtub is huge!!!!
I travel so much for work and the Bryant park hotel is by far my favorite. The staff is also very sweet and supportive.
Also love going to Koi, great food !

title: Great Location - Decent Sized Room - A Bit Dated
