text: First visit - woman traveling alone - walked from Grand Central - directly across from Bryant Park - great location and an inexpensive rate.  Front desk is literally a desk located just inside the entrance. Restaurant to the right and cocktail lounge to the left. Elevators are dark and small and paneled in red pleather. Whole property is a bit dated - has seen better days. Queen sized room was a decent size for NYC. Sofa, table, side table. Big closet. During non-pandemic times, there seems to be an honor bar. No coffee maker, no microwave. No iron. Big bathroom with rain shower head. Furniture has seen better days. Worn. Comfortable bed. Good towels. Very quiet on a Wednesday night. Ask for the security key fob if you'll be out past 11pm.

title: 🚫 STOP‼️ RUN AWAY ‼️ Go to hotel next door ‼️ This hotel is a hell hole‼️
text: 4-star hotel Like a Cheap Motel. Like a Haunted Hotel in Horror movies. Not Worth It. Too Pricey for all the Inconvenience  and Abhorring experience. Go to The Knickerbocker or Park Terrace next door..

title: Manhattans best
text: We stayed here for a quick weekend getaway. We absolutely LOVED IT! We live locally and have stayed in several hotels and this hotel has totally won us over. When we walked in we were greeted by John C. He was so sweet and made us feel right at home. The room was extremely clean and they had complementary robes (not to keep) ear plugs, as well. The view of the park was beautiful as Bryant park is one of my favorite places. Also it’s central to everything. Bryant park has always been known to be a safe area. So if your not from New York abd worries about safety, this is the place. We also decided to have dinner at Koi restaurant right down stairs. If you need a reservation Definitely as for Yaya. She was so sweet and made sure we had a wonderful dinner. Probably the best weekend I’ve ever had in NYC.

title: Weekend Stay
text: Stayed for Valentines day weekend and had a wonderful time. Staff was friendly and helpful. Highly recommend booking a room with a view of Bryant Park. Water pressure in the shower was amazing. I will definitely be back in the near future.

title: not sure why it has four stars.
text: Service was generally good, but hotel room was small, and even with amidst covid-19 limitations/allowances seating situation in restaurant seemed far from safe) insanely little room looking onto a shaft and zero amenities. had to go look for coffee in the neighborhood for 40 minutes in the morning. hard to believe.

title: Wonderful!
text: Wonderful hotel! Amazing location and even better service. Danny at the front desk was so friendly and made me feel very welcome. The rooms are really clean, with comfortable beds and sleek bathrooms.

title: Great hotel, special location!
text: Every year we come to NYC and bring our skates to skate at the ice rink in Bryant park. We’ve always looked at the Bryant Park hotel and wondered what kind of a place it is to stay. This trip we decided to find out. The room was great, very neat and modern.  Because of covid, there wasn’t much service, but the staff was friendly and satisfied our every request. The elevators’ interiiors are red, suggesting this might be a motif elsewhere in the hotel. We would stay here again.

title: Heart breaking level of communication & service
text: Having saved for two years for a trip to New York and to be able to visit Bryant Park a special place for us, we where like so many other devastated to be unable to stay as closed  due to Covid.  We received no communication at all from hotel. We where due to stay at BPH in April and since then have been unable to get any response with regards to refund.  Many many emails ignored, phone calls ignored and not returned.   6 months on and still no communication

title: Sadly it is closing and converting to office space
text: It came out in the papers on 31 July 2020 that the hotel will be closing up.  The entire landmark building, including the Koi restaurant and the Ceylon lounge is being offered as “boutique” office space.

title: Missing My Home Away From Home
text: I am hoping this hotel reopens soon!! It is truly my favorite “home away from home”. Firstly, hoping everyone at the hotel is safe and healthy. The staff at the hotel is truly amazing with special mention to Darren Sumner. He always books my rooms for me and does such an excellent job. As a frequent visitor, I am always treated very special. I also would like to mention that room service and housekeeping are always above par and the pancakes at Koi are top notch. I hope Koi opens as well and am hoping things go back normal very soon!!!!

title: Excellent, would stay again in a heartbeat!
text:
Gorgeously appointed rooms, immaculate hotel, and truly caring staff that went above and beyond to make us feel welcome.  

Miguel and Scott, thanks for taking care of our reservation change of the wonderful upgrade to celebrate my husband’s birthday. We will return for sure.

title: Lovely stay!
text: Stayed here for 3 nights in a corner suite. Spacious, clean and beautiful views! Bathrooms are spacious with a great tub and beds were comfy! Only gripe was no coffee maker in the room 😏☕️ though there’s a few cafes on the same block (never was awake in time for the free coffee offered in the lobby from 6-8am)

title: Great location and fun stay!
text:
We stayed at The Bryant Park Hotel in October 2019.  We were in the city to see Craig Ferguson at the Times Square Theater (an easy walk from the hotel.)

The hotel is in a really convenient location for exploring Midtown.  Though there is a lot happening in this part of the city, the room was extremely quiet.  We live by the ocean so we were happy to not hear the city noises when we were trying to sleep.  The room was comfortable.  The bathroom was quite large-I wanted to bring it home with me!  I enjoyed the Molton Brown products, too.

There was a bit of a mixup with our check in so we ended up being upgraded.  The front desk agents were very nice-they lacked the New York edge of many city hotels which was quite refreshing. 

Thank you-we'll definitely stay here again!

title: una experencia unica
text: viajar a nueva york en plena temporada de frio es espectacular  , visite el bryant park sus precios muchos mejores en comparacion al rockefeller center , pero la diferencia es abismal , te venden un super candado para los lockers con lo cual tus pertenencias quedan seguras si vas en pareja o sola , no puedes tomar fotos mientas estas patinando , realmente una super expernecia , el costo $33 dlares con el alquiler de lockers , bien vale la pena

title: I’ll never stay anywhere else in NYC ❤️
text:
Let me just start by saying that I’ve been to the city multiple times and after staying with you guys, I’m blown away! My best friend and I celebrated our birthdays with you and it was memorable to say the least. From the complimentary surprise champagne, to the sweet treats and balloons and card left for us! The last minute upgrade to a view of the park was generous as well... Top notch service!

Each and every single staff member we encountered was joyful and considerate and making sure that we were taken care of every step of the way. Thank you for such a fantastic overnight getaway! We will definitely be back again and again!

title: Bryant Park in the winter
text: As we were eating at Gabriel Kreuther (2 Michelin stars) across Bryant Park, we booked into The Bryant Park Hotel. At first, the lobby looks a little plain jane, but they have a great dance club that opens around 11:30-ish in the basement. If  you're a guest, you don' have to wait in line  outside for it to open.  The staff is very polished and kind, the mattress is comfortable and the price was certainly right! Bryant Park its a winter wonderland with ice skating and all kinds of little kiosks and stores, as well as the fabulous New York Public Library, which is a total knock-out!

title: Friend's birthday
text: Staff were very helpful and professional. The rooms were really lovely, clean, comfortable and beyond my expectations. The location is perfect for a weekend in the city and I would highly recommend it.

title: Great stay
text: We spent last weekend at the Bryant Park Hotel as a delayed celebration of our 25th anniversary.  From the moment we walked in the hotel and staff made our stay special and we do sincerely appreciate it.  Special shout out to Danny who was at the desk when we checked in - great job. The hotel is in a fantastic spot.  We took the quick walk down 5th and went to the top of the Empire State Building at midnight on the night we arrived. Two blocks to Hamilton and Come From Away; it’s a great home base outside of Times Square for a Theater weekend.  Cross-town and 6th Ave subways are right outside the door. We would and will stay there again!

title: Outstanding hotel and service
text: We visited NYC for a broadway show and a weekend exploring the city in February. The Bryant Park Hotel is in a perfect location for walking to shows, great restaurants and all over the city. From the moment we arrived, everyone we dealt with at the hotel was friendly, service-oriented, professional, helpful, nice, fun. Our room wasn’t yet available and the front desk upgraded us to the Loft room which is simply spectacular in terms of space, layout and views. I will happily stay here on every visit to the city.

title: Birthday Weekend at Bryant Park Hotel
text: The Bryant Park Hotel Staff were extremely helpful from the moment we booked until the very moment we left. Sara, Job and everyone else working the weekend were amazingly professional and helpful. Birthday cakes were delivered to our room for my son and my birthdays. Beautiful and delicious addition to our stay!! The double bed suite overlooking Bryant Park was spacious, clean and very comfortable! The shower was so relaxing! I can’t say enough about this hotel. It’s location is perfect for walking distance to Times Square, shopping, eating, and not to mention ice skating. Coffee and pastries everywhere! This stay is a must and will stay again!!

title: Great staff and very economical for the amenities
text: This is a perfect place to stay for a quick business trip! Centrally located, affordable, clean, and the staff there are super helpful! Dennis, Matt, and Job are the best! The valet, check-in, and luggage storage process was so easy as well! Overall great place to stay

title: Perfect place to stay in NYC
text:
From the minute you arrive you are made to feel welcome. We were greeted by the smiles of Job & Sarah at the front desk. The Bryant Park Hotel was a wonderful choice for a weekend get away. The rooms are beautiful, love the beds,the view of the park and perhaps the best shower ever. The location is great for walking and close to Broadway, Public Library,& of course the park. Angel at The Celon Bar (a beautiful spot for cocktails & dancing) was a treat not only for his drinks but also his singing. We had breakfast at Koi and the food was delicious and Kelvin provided amazing service for our table of 7.A special thank you to Darren Sumner for his personal attention in putting this together for us.

Bryant Park Hotel super special!

Donna and Guillermo Chacon

title: Wonderful boutique hotel in chic Bryant Park
text: Such a lovely gem on a nice park. Pleasantly surprised at the room size I had. Was allowed an upgrade without asking. Rooms clean and well appointed. Turn down service offered.  I recommend this hotel if this is the part of NY you need to be in. Easy walk to quite a few attractions. Two bars/restaurants. Wish they opened earlier in the evening. Great breakfast options in the KOI restaurant. Coffee NOT available in the room, but coffee service is set up in the lobby at 6 am. (I would recommend 5 am coffee service). Will have to call for iron and ironing board. But, that isn't a big deal. Cool place..stay here!

title: Luxury Stay & Staff
text:
My husband and I lived in Manhattan for many years and have moved outside of the city although we work in the city we always make sure we get at least a weekend stay in every 2 months. We have been hotel hopping, trying out all the latest spots and haven’t found one we truly would keep going back to except for now, The Bryant Park Hotel. We booked a room for us and a room for friends last weekend just going by the look and online reviews for the hotel and we were all thrilled! The moment we arrived the staff couldn’t have been nicer. Everyone was polite, professional and welcoming! We valeted our car without the usual hassle that goes along with valeting in the city. Our suite was perfectly oversized, super clean and had a chic esthetic which we loved.
Later that night we went to Celon for some cocktails and dancing bc we were staying at the hotel we were escorted past the line right through to the beautiful boho designed lounge.
Our friends were equally happy with the Bryan Park hotel and all of us agreed this will be the place we stay from now on! Exceptional staff, design and comfort.

title: Excellent value right off 5th Ave
text:
I visit New York frequently for business and am tired of the chains with their dodgy carpets, blasting AC and strange odors. Then I found the Bryant Park Hotel. The room was huge and had high ceilings and two windows overlooking Bryant Park. No dodgy carpeting here, just wooden flooring. Despite the location, it was quiet - perhaps thanks to the white noise maker. Egyptian cotton sheets and towels, high end amenities, and a fine bath robe were just a few of the reasons why I'll be back.
Jonathan was super helpful too!

title: Favorite Place to stay for dinner, theater, and Celebrate Year of  the Nurse!
text: We have a favorite place in New York City to enjoy the theater , dinner and beautiful Bryant Park : The Bryant Park Hotel . We always receive  a cheerful greeting when we return and  we were pleasantly surprised with our early arrival and park view upgrade . Clean, quiet, stylish definitely a Top 10 Hotel ! We even brought Florence Nightingale (Flat Flo)  to celebrate The WHO Year of the Nurse! Thanks Bryant Park

title: Great all around
text:
When we arrived in our room, there was a bad odor. When I called the front desk, they responded immediately and resolved it by upgrading our room, even though we were able to trace the source of the smell and remove it. They couldn't have been more gracious. They also helped me to plan for a 75th Birthday by getting flowers and champagne etc in the room, and they even left a little gift.
The bed was possibly the best ever from any hotel we've ever stayed in, including Four Seasons etc. 
The only drawback to a good night's sleep was that the room darkening shades were not. There was plenty of ambient light that got through. The bathroom was large and the shower was glorious. The only drawback here is that for two people, there was not enough countertop space for toiletries.
I highly recommend this place, especially a room with a view of the park. Don't be surprise, though, by the music that drifts up from the park at night. I suggest a high floor.

title: Tolles Hotel/empfehlenswert
text:
Ich habe über Silvester 2 Nächte in dem Hotel verbracht. Bei Ankuft wurde ich sehr freundlich empfangen (Miguel: top!). Es gab ein upgrade, habe ein Zimmer in der 16. Etage mit Blick auf den Park bekommen. Ausstattung top, das Zimmer war sehr sauber, gross und lichtdurchflutet durch 3 riesige Fenster. Auch das Bad konnte sich sehen lassen. Einziger Nachteil: es war trotz geschlossenser Fenster recht laut, weil es sich um Einfachverglasung handelt, dafür gibt es Ohrenstöpsel. 
Frühstück gibt es rundum in einem der vielen Cafes, auch sonst ist das Hotel super zentral gelegen. 
Das gesamte Personal war extrem aufmerksam und sehr freundlich. Das Zimmer wurde 2 mal (!) am Tag gereinigt. 
Ich kann das Hotel sehr empfehlen!

title: Best place ever.
text: Was my very first time in New York. And this was the best place I’ve ever stayed at. Staff is super friendly, rooms are extremely clean and spacious. I definitely will be back and staying here again!!

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Absolutely fantastic experience. From the moment we arrived at the front door to the time of checkout every single person on the staff was courteous, professional and very friendly. The room was modern/chic, very comfortable and spotless. Also the in-house restaurant Koi was amazing. We will definitely being staying there again.

title: Now my favorite hotel in NYC
text:
I used to live in NYC and come here for work often from Boston. I use HotelTonight to find new places to stay and I was lucky enough to land a room at Bryant Park Hotel a few months ago -- I've since stayed here again, booking directly, and I can't say enough positive things about it.

The staff is so kind, friendly, and attentive. Checking out the first time, I told them how much I loved my room, so while it was booked the next time I stayed, they told me the one they gave me was almost the same -- I loved that they remembered!

The rooms are clean, modern, and some have great views over Bryant Park. The bathrooms are awesome as is the shower pressure -- if you travel often, you will know how unique this is.

I love the turndown service, where you come into the room where the sounds of waves is playing and everything feels so serene.

I plan on making this my regular spot to stay every time I come to NYC.

title: Great rooms and location
text: Spacious and pleasant rooms in a great location. Staff is always terrific. I stay here frequently as it is very central and I can easily walk north or south. Bathrooms have nice high ceilings, and rooms are modern and clean. Lobby is minimal, I don't really need more.

title: Beauty
text: Such a wonderful spot to visit. Lots of people around, but that's NYC! Everyone was so helpful and the hotel was very clean! Have to compliment the bartenders! They made great drinks and were so friendly!

title: Perfect place to stay!!
text: We loved staying at the Bryant park hotel!! ALL the staff was phenomenal and helpful! Sarah and Dennis were already helping us with activities even before we got to New York! We were celebrating my daughter’s sweet 16 and she felt special from the moment we stepped into the hotel! She even had a wonderful little surprise when we walked into the room! Not only was the staff amazing, but the room was clean and the location was perfect! Thank you for making this trip extra special!! We will definitely be back!!

title: great stay at the Bryant Park!
text: We had such a great stay at the Bryant Park.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating and the location cannot be beat. I upgraded to a suite for my husbands birthday which was great.  My only complaint-the water was shut down our last night there from 11:30p-5:30am-a little strange on a holiday weekend.

title: Solid hotel
text: Service was great and the hotel was very cool. Suite was a good size and nice but minimalist. Shower was wonderful. My main criticism is the windows were very dirty. I paid to upgrade to a suite and a nice view but the dirt on the window definitely detracted from  the view. I’m sure it’s hard to clean the windows often but definitely need to be cleaned more. The location was perfect. It’s so close to everything and Bryant park is just gorgeous. I’d stay there again but would love it if they could clean the windows.

title: Great hotel with all you need
text: This was my first time staying here, but certainly not the last. The room was great, the people were great, and the lounge was great. The bed was super comfortable, and the shower was awesome. There is no doubt I will come back.

title: New York Weekend
text: We live in Connecticut and visit our son, his wife and our wonderful granddaughter frequently.  Typically we stay at the hotel with the best deal.  This weekend and last we had a great experience at the Bryant Park Hotel.  The rooms and bathrooms are exceptionally large for New York. A park view is fantastic. They have free water, turndown service and a very friendly staff.  We will be back.

title: Consistently great
text: It’s lively when a place you enjoy appreciates you as well. We have been part of this family for about 8+years and from the start they have made us feel at home. From the doormen to housekeeping and the management staff have all been so personable and professional that we can’t ever think of staying anywhere else.

title: Awesome location and stay
text: we stayed at the Bryant park hotel while in New York for the New Year. Awesome stay and location. You can’t ask for a better location you are in walking distance  of Broadway, Time Squares, Grand Central and many more. If you are lucky enough choose a room overlooking Bryant Park awesome view of the winter wonderland. The hotel itself is lovely, nice and clean, good size rooms with a gorgeous bathroom. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to staying again. A big thank you for making our new year holiday extra special.

title: One of the best hotels I’ve stayed at in Manhattan
text: Every member of staff made this such a pleasant stay and everyone went the extra mile to make sure I was catered for; excellent location and proximity to main sites, clean and spacious rooms, great views of the city, extremely clean and overall a wonderful place!

title: Toujours au top
text: 8ème  séjour au Bryant Park Hôtel en plein cœur de Manhattan en décembre ( après un 7ème en mai- juin). Cet hôtel est pour moi l’idéal de l’hôtel à New York: au cœur de la Ville, en bordure du Bryant Park, un lieu de vie extraordinaire, que ce soit au printemps ou en été avec toutes ses animations, ou en décembre avec le village de Noël. L’accueil a l’hôtel est toujours aussi parfait, les chambres impeccables et le personnel d’une disponibilité totale bien que très décontracté pour un hôtel de ce niveau. Et le Koï, restaurant japonais dans l’hôtel est toujours aussi bon.... Un nouveau bar à été mis en place. Juste un petit peu bruyant quant à la musique ( mais c’est l’habitude dans tous les établissements.....). Sa position au cœur de Manhattan est vraiment idéale lorsque l’on aime marcher dans NYC. Tous les soirs je pouvais rentrer en marchant en sortant des clubs de jazz avec au maximum 30 mn de marche pour le Village Vanguard... Alors j’y retourne bientôt en 2020....

title: Perfect!
text: Location is superb. The junior suite probably need some small renovations but our was big compared to any other solution I experienced in NY, the bathroom is big as well with a shower and wide bathub overlooking the private terrace . The view was simply amazing. Thanks!!!

title: Great hotel, great location
text: As always the Bryant Park Hotel is the perfect NYC hotel.  It is a short walk from Penn Station, a short walk to Times Square and in the Winter it is right outside the Winter Wonderland at Bryant Park.  The hotel is great and helped us celebrate our 20th anniversary with Champagne and Chocolates.  Thanks for a great Stay!

title: Great Trip
text: Great location, great room size, awesome service and interesting view.  I would 100% go back and stay at this location.  The people were helpful and very polite.  The place was very clean and the service crew was quiet and accommodating.

title: Magnifico
text: Ubicación perfecta. Vistas estupendas al parque (las habitaciones que las tengan, claro). Muy buen trato del personal del hotel, a destacar por parte de don Miguel Enríquez, manager de recepción. Hemos pasado una semana magnífica.

title: Excellent Place to Stay
text: Stayed in the Bryant Park Hotel in the week before Christmas.  A great tome to be in NYC, and a great neighborhood for it.  easy stroll to Rockefeller Center.  Lots of kiosks and an ice skating rink right across the street in Bryant Park.  The great New York Public Library, for art and book people like me.  The Morgan Library.  easy access to uptown and Down.  The Hotel has an intimate lobby and an extremely friendly and helpful staff.  The room elegantly minimalist modern  New wooden floors.  Marble bath.  Spotless.  VERY comfortable bed.  Just first rate for me.

title: Best Hotel I have stayed at.
text: Took my husband to this Hotel for his 50tj birthday.   This was the only hotel he wanted to go to.  This place was fabulous from check in...to check out.   Rooms are comfortable and spacious.   Definitely going back for a weekend trip.

title: Top Notch Hotel!!!
text: From the minute we walked in the door, the employees here were fantastic. They checked us in, provided clear and concise communications about the room(s), and guided us to local hot spots for Xmas. Love this hotel and will be back!

title: Excellent place in the heart of New york
text:
The Bryant Park hotel is a luxury hotel and it is overlooking Bryant Park. The service is perfect and the prices are... almost reasonable. Perfect place.
The Koi restaurant who also provide breakfast (not to par with nearby places) is an excellent place to lunch or diner.

title: Great location and friendly service
text: Hard to beat the location of this hotel bordering Bryant Park. Had a good sized room, lots of space especially in Manhattan. Room had all we needed and the staff were friendly and helpful. Steps to Times Square as well. We would stay again.

title: December Visit
text:
I was looking for a hotel as close to Bryant Park as possible - and this hotel was perfect.   Great room with a good view of the park.   Literally across the street from the park and near Broadway, Times Square and tons of activities.

Hotel was very nice, and the people were lovely and very helpful.  

Highly recommend the hotel in December!

title: beautiful stay overlooking Bryant Park
text: I stayed at the Bryant Park Suite with windows overlooking Bryant Park.  Concierge desk was very attentive to extra requests we made, for a portable heater (room was ok for me but a little cold for an older family member who has medical condition).  Suite was spacious, beautiful, and beautifully furnished.  Location is excellent, as it is central part of town, easy to get to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, SoHo, Chelsea, Meatpacking,...

title: Great Place
text: I travel to NY a lot on business, but this was a pleasure trip with my 11 year old son and his buddy. We spent the pre-Christmas weekend here, and it was top notch. From the GM Darren down to the housekeeper, the whole staff was pleasant, attentive, responsive, and, most of all, treated my son and his friend as if they were adults (they are seasoned travelers).  The location and price were hard to beat, especially with the festival going on in the park outside our window. Walked everywhere. Oh, the free hot coffee at the bottom of the elevator bank every morning sure beats brewing it in your room and waking everyone up.

title: My favorite NY hotel.
text: The Bryant Park Hotel is my go-to hotel in NYC.  It's not a chain, it's a cool indie, in a great location, with super staff, perfectly sized comfortable rooms and very clean bedding.  But have breakfast at the Mayson Kaiser a few doors down, it's so good.  I've put up business guests there as well, and everyone loves it.

title: GREAT HOLIDAY LOCATION
text:
Every year we come to the BYRANT PARK HOTEL during the holidays.  We consider this to be the "HUB" of everything going on in MANHATTAN.  

The location is perfect.  GRAND CENTRAL is about 3-4 blocks away.  The B,D,F,M Subway is on the corner.  TIMES SQUARE is 4 blocks away.  Need I go on?

Across the street is the WINTER WONDERLAND in BRAYANT PARK.  An ice skating rink with holiday shops and food/drinks galore.  Again, across the street.

The hotel itself is in mint condition.  This is one of the cleanest places you will ever stay.  We have a favorite room we request every time.  JOHN CASTILLO, who is the man as far as I concerned, always takes care of our reservation and greets us consistently like a long lost friend when we come in.  He and his staff are very attentive to your needs at the hotel.

The bell staff and security are always friendly and ready to lend a hand.  The housekeeping department is top notch.  The evening turn down service is very nice.  And I take a lot of showers as I run the city for exercise and enjoyment.  It seems there is always new towel waiting for me when I come back.

title: Bryant Park Hotel doesn’t disappoint-Top notch in every category
text:
Once again, Bryant Park Hotel did not disappoint!  My husband and I have been staying there for six years and will stay at no other place in New York City!
This boutique hotel is top notch in every aspect. 

Entire staff is amazing—Sarah Midlin, Concierge manager, always goes the extra mile to accommodate and to make well informed suggestions before and during our visits.  She emailed me constantly with new ideas. 

John at the front desk was personable and accommodated our request for early check-in. 

There aren’t enough positive adjectives to describe Darren Sumner, Director of front and guest services.  He is the best of the best.  He sent cake and balloons to our room in honor of my birthday.  He addresses any issue or question in a timely matter.  He is beloved by his staff. 

Service is impeccable!  The hotel rooms are immaculate, modern and simplistic.  Great location!

We can’t wait to return to our home away from home!

title: I LOVED THIS PLACE!
text: I absolutely LOVED the Bryant Park Hotel. The staff was incredible. Especially Dennis and Miguel at the front desk. They were so accommodating, professional ands sweet. They upgraded us to a room with a view, and it was absolutely INCREDIBLE. The room was amazingly beautiful and very large for a NYC Hotel. I can't say good enough things about this place. Best location. Cool Decor and great staff. Didn't want to leave. Will definitely stay there again.

title: Want to give 3.5 stars; good hotel just not “very good”
text: This was a tough grade as there is so much to like about this hotel.  Service is excellent, staff is great, room was nice, the shower exemplary.  Location had its pluses and minuses.  Geographically, it offers great access to midtown, Chelsea, and Central Park south-all easily walkable.  However, its location above a busy 6th Avenue also has its downside, specifically with the noise.  If you are a light sleeper, simply do not stay at this hotel, especially if you have window view overlooking Bryant Park.  There seems to be a continuous cacophony of sound and this is why I ultimately chose the 3 over 4 rating as this is an important issue to me.  To their credit, they did have sound machines, but it wasn’t enough to drown out the noise.  If you can sleep through anything, I’d recommend this hotel.  Also, it’s possible that the rooms away from Bryant Park are better for light sleepers.  A couple of other nits: had a great view of the park that was simply ruined by how dirty the windows were.  Also, a small nit, there is no fan in the bathroom.  To summarize, a good hotel with the potential to be great but the issues at hand may not be easily solvable.

title: Wonderful
text: Fabulous location, charming hotel, I’ve stayed here before in one of the smaller rooms they are petite but very well-designed, we had one of those booked but the manager Miguel gave us an upgrade to a deluxe queen with a view, which was SUCH a treat, sheer luxury! The staff is so friendly and helpful and I also love that this hotel does not have carpeting in the rooms, very good for people with asthma or allergies.

title: Great stay
text: On top of the great location, the hotel put great care into making our stay as enjoyable as possible, providing us with extra accommodations, chocolates, and a small birthday present for my girlfriend that was left on the bed for her.  Definitely recommend.

title: Christmastime at Bryant Park
text: Colorful booths, concession stands, tables + chairs to take it all in and relax, a beautiful Christmas tree, and ice skating - Bryant Park is great in winter as in every season! Walk-around and enjoy the sights, Christmas shop at the booths, and then sit at one of the tables throughout the park and enjoy hot apple cider or a hot chocolate or hot coffee. It's fun to visit Bryant Park during the Christmas season.

title: I really wanted to love this hotel...
text: I've been wanting to stay at this property for a while. I stay in the city numerous times throughout the year and love this location. My plans changed last minute and I ended up having to book a hotel for the night, found a room here at a great price through a third party site and booked immediately....perfect! I'll start with the positives: excellent location, friendly staff, comfortable beds. Now the negatives. Apparently the owners were having a huge family reunion so I was told that all of the room types like mine overlooking the park were completely booked. Disappointing but not a big deal as I was only staying for one night. However, the cleanliness/state of the room I was given was unacceptable (and I was told that no other rooms were available.) I was laying in bed looking up at what I thought was a textured wall only to discover that it wasn't textured but completely covered with dust (see photos!) The floor was cracked and scratched, the sink was cracked, the faucets were gross, the light switch was broken, the robes were stiff and uncomfortable....the pictures really speak for themselves. The layout of my room was strange, with the small television really far from the bed in a corner which was hard was hard to view? Also, something else that other reviewers brought up about the front doors of the hotel. The doors are extremely heavy and about half the time there was no one there to help including when I was coming in/leaving with luggage. Overall, glad I that I got a discounted rate but maybe that's why I got the sub-par room?

title: Holiday Stay  2019
text: Awesome staff and service great location all-around wonderful experience!!  Right across from Bryant Park  right in the center of everything great sushi restaurant in the hotel. Room was big and clean with wonderful views

title: Pleased with our choice
text: We were a bit overwhelmed with choice for NYC hotels and everything was expensive for Christmas but really pleased with our choice. Lovely room - sizeable with small sitting area and ours looked to be one of the smallest (so the others must be massive!) - super comfortable bed and one of the best showers I have ever used! Would happily return. Only improvement I would suggest was in room coffee machine/kettle.

title: Very,very nice-attention to detail is needed
text: Excellent location. Very nice rooms (except the furniture in the suite should be more comfortable). Staff was friendly and welcoming. Room service was very quick and efficient. Concierge attempted to be helpful but ,at the end of the day, unable to assist on either of our two requests. One of her recommendations was terrible (the Benjamin Steak House).

title: Great location, Friendly Staff
text:
This is a very nice boutique hotel and is a great location, especially in the winter. The Winter Village at Bryant Park is on the same street, it is blocks from Rockefeller Center and Time Square, and centrally located to shopping and Christmas window displays. 

The front desk staff and doormen are extremely friendly and kind. 

The rooms are spacious and clean.

title: 5 Star Treatment
text:
Upon entering the hotel we were greeted by the bellmen then as we registered the front desk employees were nothing but professional and accommodating. 
Once we arrived in the room with our children the room was more then we expected. 
We were fortunate to speak with a wonderful director Mr. Sumner who was gracious and warm. He recommended that we take our children ice skating and shopping In Bryant park. 
Our children couldn’t have been more happier.
We had an amazing weekend.
Thank you 
The Beards

title: All Time NYC Favorite!
text:
Another great stay at the BP Hotel. Clean, comfortable, stylishly modern interior; superior staff from front desk to concierge to doorman to housekeeping.  Once again had a nice view of Bryant Park with its holiday shops and beautiful tree.   
Convenient to Times Square, theaters, Broadway; short walk to Rock Center or Macy's.  Just the nicest experience to stay here.  
Do check out the beautiful black and gold building's history - designed in art deco style by American architect , Raymond Hood. It was built in 1924 for the American Radiator Company.

title: Bryant Park Hotel
text: We spend four days in NYC every fall/winter.  Bryant Park hotel is our go to place! Great centrally located hotel!  Staff is great and attentive, close to theater, restaurants, and a nice walk up town or down town.  We highly recommend this hotel for your NYC stay!

title: Amazing rooms, great service, cool location.
text:
Have stayed here a few times now and I’ve got to say it’s a quirky place. 

It’s got this mishmash of unexpectedly brilliant, with weirdly disappointing. 

I’ll give you an example. The restaurant downstairs is Koi. A well known and well like Japanese place for the midtown crowd who aren’t worried about budget. It’s pretty pricey - but the food is good and service sharp. 

But early mornings - the same place is the ‘diner’ for the Bryant Park Hotel. And when I say ‘diner’ I mean it. Short order stuff at not great quality. Cold pastries and reasonable coffee. Given that there are a plethora of fancy French patisseries to the left and right of the Bryant Park Hotel, it’s mind boggling that they can’t do a Danish pastry with their continental breakfast. It’s even more mind boggling that guests don’t simply skip next door for better quality food at cheaper prices. Even weirder A SM despite what is says on the room service menu - there is no chef working between breakfast and supper. So only late night stuff is available during the day (club sandwiches etc). 

But that said - they have the most excellent sashimi and sushi on room service (after 6pm only I think) which I suspect is smuggled out from Koi. Recommend the cucumber salad and hamachi sashimi as absolutely top notch. 

Mini bar is adequate. No surprises. Everything you’d expect. Fridge big enough to fit a six pack from whole foods across the road too. 

See what I mean? Unexpected glimmers of brilliance next to unnecessary moments of disappointment. 

The rooms are the same. Truly fabulous space, airy, well lit, wooden floors with dual and triple aspect suites. Beautiful marble bathrooms with glorious soaking tubs. Bose stereos - the list goes on - but try and get the TV to work. The signal comes in and out on terrestrial channels and the whole google cast thing just doesn’t seem to be connected at all. The telephones occasionally work, but the actual service iand staff are impeccable. 

So IMHO, it’s one of those places that works best if you are simply looking for a spacious, reasonably priced midtown suite. And you’ve got a bit of time to work around the weak points. Get your food from wholefoods across the way (or the chipotle I discovered right next door). Breakfast in one of the excellent French cafes. If you’re going to spend any time in the hotel, be prepared to endlessly get your key recut (they seem to lose their authority at the merest whiff of an electronic device even near them - positively Luddite in their working proclivities!), and be prepared for things not to work occasionally. But then again - if you want The Four Seasons - you pay for the Four Season. And I’d say the hamachi and cucumber salad here is actually better than any room service the Four Season have ever given me. 

The bar downstairs is weirdly eclectic. Hip hop and OG stuff one night - then Moroccan style singing and 50 year old business men looking for naive company the next and fashion week launches the next. Bar staff all super cool and friendly though. 

The gym is much larger than most and has everything you could need from cardio to free weights to weight machines. 

So the whole thing is a bit of an adventure. And NYC is all about the adventure right? Given the alternatives for the price within a 10 block radius - this is the best place I’ve found. 

Recommended.

title: Cathy Gracey
text: Best hotel and kindest, most helpful staff.  Matthew, one of the bellhops, went above and beyond in everything he did.  The staff brought a cupcake and balloon to our room to celebrate our granddaughter’s birthday!!  Will be back!

title: Still the BEST in NYC; always our choice when visiting & business
text:
The Bryant Park Hotel has been our go-to hotel in NYC for a number of years.  Its location, very attentive staff, excellent rooms are all still at the top of excellence as far as we are concerned.  The location on the south side of Bryant Park on 40th Street between Fifth and Sixth avenue is perfect for connections to midtown, Grand Central, The Garden, Broadway, Fifth Avenue shopping, and of course the Metro/Subway system.
Note that this is a boutique hotel so you must do a bit of planning and reserve your room ahead of time.  But the smaller size of the Bryant Park works to your advantage with very dedicated and well trained staff and a smaller crowd pushing around the lobby.
As for rooms, highly recommend that you consider one of the upper rooms that has is a larger size with a perfect sitting area in the room, a wonderful bathroom with stunning shower and tub, and best of all, a sitting area outside just off your room where you can enjoy a breath-taking view of New York City.  Does not come any better than that!

title: Great spot.  Easy walk and convenient but not too close to Times Square
text: Room and bathroom were very spacious, surprising for a New York hotel.  Staff were particularly friendly and always helpful.  Exceeded our expectations.  Great value for the price.  We were pleasantly surprised.

title: Fantastic - top favorite!
text: Was in NYC for a couple of nights and another hotel was booked for me. It was a disappointing place and after one night I decided to move to The Bryant Park Hotel, where I had stayed two times before. To make a long story short: it was once more fantastic! You simply can’t go wrong with this place - it’s truly the best choice in the city. Room and bathroom: clean, comfortable and spacious! (for a fair price) Location: mid town, at Bryant Park, which is nearby everything. Staff: always kind and helpful (thank you Dennis, Aishley and Miguel at the front desk). Design and atmosphere of the hotel: modern and cool! And as an extra asset there is the very cool club in the basement. This hotel is by far my top favorite on Manhattan. Highly recommended!

title: Hands Down, One of the Best Hotels in NYC!
text: I've stayed in rooms that were $1000 more that weren't as nice as those in the Bryant Park Hotel! I couldn't be more impressed with my stay. From the wonderful staff and service, to the great restaurant (Koi) right off the lobby and the prime location across the street from Bryant Park.  Highly Recommended!

title: A Great Weekend
text: What a great weekend my wife and I spent at The Bryant Hotel. The hotel was very clean. Anything that you needed they brought to you. The staff was exceptionally nice. It's directly across the street from Bryant Park and a few minutes away from Times Square. We can't wait to go back again in the spring.

title: A great NYC hotel
text: This is the place to stay. From the moment you check in you know you are in for a great stay. There is a great restaurant in the hotel - and bar - the rooms are spacious and have great aspects. Awesome place to get cakes a few doors down at Lady M and other direction decent coffee at blue bottle coffee.

title: Amazing service, great location
text: Highly recommend this midtown gem. The service is attentive and professional. I would highly recommend.  Look forward to my next visit. In winter there is a European style market across the street. The rooms are a great size.

title: Excelente hotel, muy bien ubicado
text:
El hotel está situado frente al Bryant Park, muy bien ubicado, ya que se encuentra sobre la calle 40, entre las avenidas 5 y 6, y a pocas cuadras de la calle Broadway. 
El hotel es moderno. La habitación era amplia y el baño espacioso y cómodo.  Lo que debería mejorar es el tema de la iluminacion, ya que tiene poca luz. 
Cuenta con restaurant y un bar.
 El desayuno nos pareció un poco caro (entre 20 y 29 USD).

title: Continued excellence
text:
My wife and I routinely do theater weekends in NYC and years ago found the Bryant Park Hotel as our home in the city. We've had countless stays and each visit it better than the last. When walking in Saturday morning, John greeted us by name with a huge smile and handshake. You can tell he truly cares about guests. Every staff member was, as always, upbeat and friendly. Our room was immaculate as always, minimalist but still elegant. Seeing Miguel, who has gone out of his way to make us feel at home every time, Sunday evening as we were leaving was the icing on the cake. 

The addition of coffee and water in the elevator lobby is a nice touch!

Can't wait to return back home in a few months.

title: Great location, great staff, great hotel
text: I absolutely loved staying here. Single woman and always felt safe. all staff I encountered were friendly and lovely - from the doormen, front desk staff, room cleaning. The room was spacious and clean. Great view over Bryant park - lucked out with the room. Perfect location in mid town. I will definitely come back to stay here.

title: New York Luxury
text:
I travel constantly back and forth from LA to NY and am always looking for a great hotel to call home while I am in Manhattan. I recently tried The Bryant Park Hotel and overjoyed by my experience. Darren and his team were all extremely helpful and the hotel location and quality is of the highest caliber. 

I strongly recommend this hotel for business, family and luxury stays.

title: Love This Place
text: All rooms are great Have stayed here many times and will continue to do so Rooms and bathrooms are quite roomy especially for New York Very nicely decorated Extremely pleasant and helpful staff Love being in across the street from Bryant Park One of the few open spaces in this area There is always something going on there And you’re only a few blocks from the Time Square madness Can’t beat this! This is my “go-to” hotel :)

title: Great stay in NYC and The Bryant Park Hotel
text: Perfec' location, nice staff, clean room, and the newly opened nightclub in the basement was brilliant.  I also like the service at the Koi Resataurant, as a part of the hotel.  Good meals and nice breakfast.  I will recomend the hotel to all of you.

title: Super Customer Experience
text: Visited NYC for work- great location, modern rooms with all the amazing amenities, and staff who actually appreciate your business to ensure to have an awesome stay... and return! From doorman to front desk staff- it was a pleasure! NYC hospitality!

title: Awesome
text: Stay hereGreat until centrally located next to everything within walking distance of everything Macys sent a Part Time Square, Penn State and easy access to JFK great rooms quiet safe neighborhood I recommend it

title: Screening Room Usage
text: I work for a film company that constantly books the screening room in the hotel. We typically book with Emily, who is an absolute pleasure every time. We have never had an issue with the screening room and always have a great experience. We will keep booking!

title: Excellent hotel
text: Recently stayed here overnight while seeing a show in NYC and this is a great hotel. The rooms were updated and clean. The bed was extremely comfy. The staff was friendly and the location was perfect.

title: Don’t hesitate, just book this hotel
text: We have just come back from our first time visit to New York and staying at the Bryant Park hotel. The Hotel was perfect for us in so many ways, from the moment we arrived we were made to feel extremely welcome with special mention to Jasmine and John on reception who treated us like old friends, nothing was ever too much trouble for them or any of the staff we came across during our stay. Our room was lovely and we had a great view over the parks winter wonderland. The room facilities are first class, comfortable bed, large bathroom with separate shower plenty of usb sockets for charging up our phones, iPads etc. The location was perfect with all major sites in walking distance. Highly recommend this hotel

title: NYC Marathon Trip
text: Wow! This was the absolute perfect hotel for everything we wanted to do in NYC. We had two beautiful suites overlooking the park. The suites were spacious, comfortable, and beautiful! The location was fantastic, and we walked to three fabulous dinners. Our daughter ran her first marathon, and she did REALLY well. We think that her great night of sleep made all the difference. The team was amazing - friendly, professional, and helpful! We look forward to our next visit. We are “travel snobs”, and we recommend this hotel to the most discerning of travelers! :)

title: Great location, reasonable sized room, fab bathroom
text:
The location of this hotel is amazing - overlooking Bryant Park and not on noisy 5th or 6th Aves. The bedroom size was better than many I have stayed at in NYC in this price bracket.  the bed was a little firm for my liking but everything was clean.
The bathroom in my room had a separate bath and shower (luxury!) and there was plenty of space for my makeup with good lighting.
Two tiny niggles make this a 4 and not a 5: no coffee maker in the room - you have to wait until 6am to get a coffee from the foyer (served until 8am). Also the plug sockets are not well designed to put non-US plug adaptors in - they fall out of the wall and the two USBs by the bed are just not enough!

title: My Favorite NYC Hotel
text:
I go to NYC to visit my son and his family. For my last 3 visits, I have stayed at Bryant Park Hotel. I chose it for location in the beginning. It has a great location! Near Grand Central station, right across the street from fabulous Bryant Park, plenty of restaurants nearby. 

After my first visit, I knew I had found a home away from home. The staff members are respectful, friendly, professional, and kind. Any room you reserve, you will be satisfied. This last trip in October, 2019, I was fortunate to have a junior suite overlooking the Bryant Park skating rink and Winter Village. It even had a balcony with table and chairs to sit outside and enjoy the fall air. Huge bathroom with tiled shower plus bath tub, desk with lamp and chair, sofa, coffee table, two chairs, king sized super comfortable bed. Fluffy soft robes and bedroom slippers. Lovely bath products. Quiet rooms on all three visits.
Turn down service. Secure entry to elevators. 

There is a restaurant on your right as you enter, The Koi, and a nightclub on a lower level. So much fun to see young people coming in all dressed in a variety of costumes for the Halloween party in the club. 

But the top reason I stay here is THE STAFF. Sooooo nice and polite. I really cannot recommend a nicer place to stay in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Avoid if you like coffee in the morning
text: If you like to wake up early when in the US and have a cup of coffee, this hotel is not for you. No coffee served in the rooms and also not in the lobby until breakfast time. I was referred to go out on town and buy a coffee.

title: Wonderful stay for 7 days
text:
We had a wonderful full-week stay at the hotel. We stayed in a "Deluxe View" room and were entirely happy with it. Our corner room had a nice view of the park, plus a good view down 40th Street.

The room was well-appointed and well-maintained, with a quite-nice size for NYC. Great shower with good flow and good hot water. Never got into the tub, but it was inviting.

Location is really nice, with a couple of subway lines a half-block away, and several more a few blocks away in Times Square. (But this part of midtown doesn't have a "neighborhood" feel.)

The one amenity we missed was an in-room coffee maker. Lots of nicer hotels provide in-room Nespresso these days, and we could have benefitted from that. There are nice coffee houses just a few doors from the restaurant - including Blue Bottle Cafe we visited nearly every morning - but sometimes you'd like a nice cup without going out. Drip coffee 6-8am in the lobby was okay, but we like a good espresso.

But everything about the hotel was so nice. Polite and helpful staff. Great upkeep and location. Great view (from appropriate rooms.) Would go back.

title: NYC trip
text: Great hotel, great location & great staff! Very clean with comfortable bed and amazing shower. Got upgraded to a junior suite overlooking Bryant Park. Didn’t try hotel bar or restaurant but plenty of choices nearby. Will definitely stay here again.

title: My new hotel in NY
text: I have been know to fall in love with NYC hotels. Sometimes for their location, sometimes for their history and sometimes for the staff.  This one meets all the criteria. The doorman and valet as well as the concierge were so kind and attentive in a city I usually find quite reserved.  They were able to make a couple accommodations for us which I am sure was difficult in a city dealing with a huge marathon. Walking distance to Broadway, shopping g, a ton of restaurants and Time Square. The rooms were large and clean and to my delight NOT CARPETED.  For those of you who are freaked out by most hotel rooms as I am, I cannot explain what a joy it was to see no gross tacky carpeting in the hotel room. The bathroom was huge and the tub was big enough for two.  I cannot day enough how impressed I was by the hotel and I cannot wait to return.

title: Lovely spot in the center of it all
text:
My wife and I went to NYC for a weekend and stayed at this hotel.  Super friendly staff, clean and spacious rooms and super convenient location.  

We were able to comfortably walk to Central Park and Madison Square Garden and everywhere in between. 

I would definitely recommend this hotel and will plan on staying here during future visits to the Big Apple.

title: Incredible service from everyone!
text: I’d like to start with the bellman. He greeted us to the hotel as if we were Royalty. John was outstanding and able to lift our heavy bags with ease as he led us to check in with Miguel who is well polished in customer service. He welcomed us with a warmth we will never forget. The check-in was seamless and he even gave us a business card in case we needed anything. Another asset is Fabian who is the security by the elevator. He would notice us from the entrance and have an elevator waiting for us. Tell us the weather report and if ever we had to wait for an elevator he’d invite us to some Apple cider. He also introduced us to Dennis at the concierge desk who was the highlight of our stay. If ever we needed directions he’d know exactly where it was. Because of him we had an incredible trip. He told us about the Brooklyn promenade, we took a ride on the Staten Island ferry to get the best pictures of the Statue of Liberty, what time to avoid getting an Uber in the city due to rush hour. I can say we’ve been to NYC many times but never had such a great experience like this one. Me and my family will be back to NYC and will never stay anywhere else! Thank you, Bryant Park hotel team!

title: Great hotel - perfect location, very comfortable and friendly
text: We booked three rooms, for three nights, for a family event in September. Everything was perfect! The modern rooms were large and very comfortable, and the staff was super friendly and accommodating. The mid-town location, directly across from Bryant Park, was terrific and made for great walking tours. It had been years since we visited and stayed in the city, so we were very happy with our overall experience, primarily due to staying at The Bryant Park Hotel. We highly recommend staying here and look forward to visiting again soon!

title: Excelente Hotel. Adorei
text: Hotel Muito bem Localizado em frente ao Bryant Park. Atendimento excelente. Fazem tudo para agradar. Quarto amplo e confortável. Ajudam a tirar duvidas sobre a cidade. A localização central ajuda no deslocamento entre os principais pontos turísticos.

title: Great location
text:
My daughter and I booked a junior suite (room 909) which was very spacious with a large living room, a dining room table and a king size bed.  The views of Bryant Park and the city were quite nice.  The refrigerator was actually cold, a rare treat.  We appreciated the Molton Brown toiletries, bathrobes and the soft thick towels.  The only complaint was the outlets wouldn't keep a charger plugged in, kept falling out.
The front desk staff and the doormen were very cordial and aimed to please.
Would have liked a Keurig in the room instead of going downstairs for morning coffee.

title: Please don’t close the blinds
text: Hotel was perfect ..I booked a park view room and what a treat I got exactly that !! And it was worth every penny ...the staff were friendly and v helpful the area is perfect and easy to walk around - lots of food options too ..look no further book the Bryant Park !! I just loved it ...wooden floors ..shower and tub !! 5 windows looking at NY ...a little street noise with this view due to building the Park ice rink overnight !!

title: Looks are deceiving!
text:
On a previous visit to NY, we came across the downstairs bar at the Bryant Park, cool Moroccan vibe, so we decided to stay this time. Big mistake!  The room was spacious, the furniture is IKEA like, low and cheap! There are NO creature comforts, no coffee machine, no bottles of water. 
The bare minimum of hotels. I had to rig the outlets to hold the tiniest of plugs, all drop out from the outlet!  No doorman to help with luggage, no doorman to open their heavy door! We were in room 1407, filthy windows. If you are looking for a upper class quality hotel, this is not it!   I wanted to checkout the first night we arrived. I will continue to stay at the Langham hotel, down the street, much nicer alternative.

title: Fabulous Staff
text: We had stayed at the hotel a few times before, and this was another wonderful stay. The last time we were there, the Holiday Market and skating rink were being installed across the street, so it was quite noisy. This time, we were upgraded and had a room in the back of the hotel, much more quiet. When we had some light coming in at night from city lights because there was a space between the top of the shade and the window frame, a quick mention to front desk staff resulted in an immediate remedy by maintenance and housekeeping. Every comment to staff resulted in a terrific response. We have stayed in many hotels in NYC, and the Bryant Park Hotel has the best staff by far! We will be back.

title: Loved my stay here!
text:
Great, central location - very convenient to get around. I checked in early, the room was not yet available so I left my suitcase, came back at 3pm and got my key and bag immediately. The front door staff & bellmen were awesome during check-in. Once in my room, I requested a fridge and it was delivered in a few minutes. All interactions with the staff throughout my 4-day stay were really great - kudos for providing excellent service!

The room was nice, simple. Bathroom was spacious, modern and had a rain shower with great water pressure! I was on the 11th floor and heard no noise (traffic, sirens) whatsoever. This may have been the best sleep I've ever had in a hotel. I enjoyed my stay here and would definitely come back.

title: Hotel con excelente ubicación y personal muy amable
text: Mi esposo y yo visitamos NY a finales del mes de octubre y nos hospedamos en este hotel. El personal de recepción es muy amable y servicial. Nos asignaron habitación pronto, a pesar de que llegamos temprano. Las habitaciones son de tipo minimalista y muy limpias. El baño es amplio y el agua de la regadera salía bien. El único pero que tuvimos fue que se salía el agua cuando nos bañábamos y en el piso se hacía el charco. En general es muy buen hotel, con excelente ubicación para desplazarse en Manhattan. Lo recomiendo y por supuesto que regresaríamos.

title: Outstanding hospitality and service
text: I am thankful for Miguel and Job at the desk. They treated my family and I with outstanding hospitality and service. My wife became ill and we were put up in a beautiful room! I mean this place is spotless and modern. The guys got me in through Hotel Tonight in literally 5 minutes. It makes me want to visit again soon. I love New York!

title: Modern, but a bit noisy on the lower floor
text:
I enjoyed my stay at the hotel because it the location is unbeatable, the decor is modern and clean, and the price was great. I'll certainly return. 

The room was spacious and recently remodeled. I loved every detail. The only downside is that I was on floor 7 facing Bryant Park and it was noisy at night. However, this can be remedied by earplugs (provided by the hotel) or getting a higher floor. I enjoyed the view so the sound did not bother me too much. 

The bathroom is great! 

Wonderful check-in experience, Manuel, was professional and attentive. Got free chocolates due to being a Hotels.com gold level member. 

Will definitely be back!

title: Very nice all around.
text: Stayed for the first time this past weekend in order to attend The NY Times Food Festival at Bryant Park. Everything was perfect. Everyone is super nice and helpful. The check in was a breeze. The rooms are decent in size and the bathroom is huge and very clean. The bed was super comfortable. Easy check out too. Would stay here again. Great midtown location near all subways. Very quiet too.

title: Great Customer Service!
text: We had a lovely staycation here last weekend - Job at the front desk was super helpful in printing out some tickets for a show we were seeing, everyone was friendly, and the room was in a good location and really lovely. Thanks for a great stay!

title: fine place to spend the night in midtown
text:
have enjoyed coming here for years.
its a business stay for me.
so my criteria are:
room is always clean
bed is always comfortable.
quality sheets and towels.
quiet  - no bar, no parties,
staff always friendly.
and recently they added complimentary coffee in the lobby.
perfect place to stay.

title: Shazzie & Wayne’s American Adventure
text:
We arrived the Bryant Park Hotel just prior to the Labour Day Public Holiday 
The staff are very friendly & accommodating 
Our initial room a step up from standard however  like many New York rooms was very small not even enough room for our cases
The breakfast area fortunately had both inside seating & alfresco, this was needed as seating & food was at a premium because the hotel was fully booked 
Also due to the hotel being full the flow on affect was the lifts were very slow 
We had to travel to Chicago for 2 days & the hotel allowed us to store our bags in their holding area which was good 
Upon our return the Labour Day Holiday was over we upgraded our new room to a suite- fantastic could actually get to our cases without climbing over things 
With less guests the breakfast & lifts were under less stress & functioned well 
The location of the hotel is perfect 
I would recommend room upgrade & not to book in holiday times & you will have a great time

title: Birthday Weekend Trip
text: I had a really wonderful experience at the Bryant Park Hotel. Immediately when we walked into the room, my boyfriend said "this is how a hotel room should look!" When I checked in, I worked with Ashley and I only briefly mentioned we were there for my boyfriends birthday, she then took the liberty to upgrade our room, provide champange and even sent up a personalized card. Upon checking out, I realized I left something in the room- and before I could call, security at the hotel called me and made it a seamless process to pick up. I never normally take time to write a review, however my experience at the BP hotel was so exceptional I really wanted to share.

title: Perfect stay for midtown NY
text: "perfect" is the right word here. Excellent staff, spacious room ( we had the deluxe queen room), perfectly clean and the best location one can imagine in midtown. Nesspresso machine and capsules in the room are a great advantage, and so is the purified cold water - both free of charge. Breakfast is very nuce in NYC terms, and if you chhose not to take it there are a few options withibn less than 2 minutes walk. We had a room on the third floor facing the street and by the elevator, and we had absolutely no noise!

title: Made us feel welcomed!
text:
I booked two nights at this hotel a week and a half before our stay when my mom and I decided to take a quick weekend getaway girls trip to NYC. We wanted to stay in the midtown Manhattan area, and this hotel had great reviews. Since we booked it on TripAdvisor, we were able to secure an excellent rate. Upon arrival around ~11 AM, we did not expect to be able to check in, but just drop our bags so that we could come back later to check in. We were pleasantly surprised that they had a room available for us at that time. Ashley surprised us with an offer to upgrade to the board room suite with a view! We were elated. She also provided my mom with a small NYC gift tas it was my mom’s first trip to New York. She also provided us with a goodie bag of really nice chocolates as well. 

The room was wonderful! We had no issues with cleanliness at all. The bathroom was huge and beautiful. And maybe most important to me was the water pressure. It was very strong! The bath products were also great! I have long, thick hair and most hotel shampoos and conditioners are just crap. These were more like using high-end brands. The bathroom was huge, and we actually had a second bathroom at the entrance of the hotel room as well. This made getting ready very easy. We stayed on a Friday and Saturday night, and did not have any issues with loudness coming from Celon or the street.

Another nice touch was that there is always water and cups available next to the elevators. The hotel also has water bottles for you as well.

If I were to stay in midtown Manhattan again, I would absolutely stay at the Bryant Park Hotel! It’s so central to many places we wanted to go that we were able to walk most places. Thanks again for the great hospitality!

title: Perfect location and great rooms
text: Stayed in December for 3 nights, upgraded to a Bryant Park facing room which was amazing and a lovely surprise! Bryant Park is perfectly located for everywhere, tube stop at the end of the street, bus stops around Bryant Park and walking distance to Times Square, Madison Square Garden and shops! the rooms are spacious and we had a huge bath and great shower! Bed was comfy and rooms are clean! Would definitely stay again! Loved it!

title: Bryant Park Hotel
text: My husband and I have just returned from our second stay at the Bryant Park Hotel having stayed for 10 nights last year. We were not disappointed all the staff from check in at reception ,concierge, security staff and housekeepers they were all extremely friendly efficient and professional. The room was spotlessly clean and the turn down service excellent along with the Moulton Brown toiletries. We were always greeted with a friendly smile from all the security staff when we left and returned to the hotel. The Koi restaurant was as good as last year and  a must for any visitor. The view of the park was amazing and this is certainly the only hotel we will stay in when visiting New York. Thank you Bryant Park for another super holiday.

title: The Best in New York
text: I have now stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel a few times. I have stayed in many other properties in Manhattan but Bryant Park is simply the best. Why? From the moment you are greeted by super friendly staff in a nice but casual atmosphere. The rooms are very pleasant with wooden floors and of course the view of the Park is amazing. If you need help Bryant Park Hotel has without a doubt the best and nice concierge. Sarah can help you with anything and is so sweet. Don't forget the best asian restaurant Koi is in the hotel as well. My go to in New York. Thanks guys :-)

title: My place in NY
text: We arrived before midday and our room was awaiting. Great view of Bryant Park. Room super comfortable and big (difficult to find in NYC). People very friendly and helpful. Unbelievable restaurant Koi and barman from Peru. The location is excellet, walking distance from Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue, many theatres, Central and Penn Station and across de Tube that takes you everywhere else. Excellent to get the tube to see the US Open. We will come back!!

title: Another wonderful stay
text: This was our fourth Labor Day stay at the Bryant Park Hotel. That’s the main message!  Wonderful setting. We eat, read, people watch in the Park from 6:30 am to 10:00 pm. Nearby Whole Foods and other fast casual restaurants, lots of eat-in-the-park choices. Comfortable, stylish rooms. Wonderful staff! People who are helpful and caring (aside from doing their job). Bellman Jonathan and front desk John, especially so. See you next Labor Day!

title: Great stay at the BP
text:
I had a wonderful stay at the Bryant Park Hotel. My room was large, light , and quiet . It had all the things one needs in a hotel room.
The staff was so friendly and they have a security guard at the elevator so you feel very safe. Everyone was very helpful with directions, cabs and recommendations.
The location is perfect across from Bryant Park which has lots going on during the summer. The hotel is on the same street as many good coffee cafes ,pastry shops and restaurants.it is also across from the NY Public Library and stored on Fifth Ave.
All in all a great stay in one of my fav cities.

title: Amazing experience!!
text:
First time in New York, and I have to say that the staff at the Bryant Park Hotel are hands down the best in the business. I was checked in by John upon arrival.  Having driven quite a distance my 7 year old had to use the facilities and even though we were extremely early for check in, John accommodated my son and I without hesitation he had us booked in a room and ready to go within minutes even though we were almost three and a half hours early. The room was very large, very clean and we had a beautiful view of Bryant Park. I was very nervous about driving and parking in the city so we opted for valet parking, which again was very seamless and so very convenient. I don't of course know all the staff members names, but every single one of the was courteous, kind and so helpful. Ashley checked us out and was very sweet and explained my bill in detail had my car packed and ready to go within minutes of checking out. So thank you very much again to all of you collectively!! We will be back and absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone we know travelling to New York city.

Thank You,
Karmen and Joseph

title: Can’t say enough
text: Third time in NYC and I couldn’t have picked a better hotel. It’s clean, the staff is so friendly. The location is perfect, you can walk anywhere. The park is beautiful and a great place to eat your breakfast. Lots of restaurants, pubs and bars in the area. Lots to do. Most importantly, the area is safe.

title: Ottima struttura
text:
Merita 5 stelle questo bell’albergo in Bryant Park.
Centrale e comodo alla Metro, ha stanze arredate in maniera minimale ed essenziale, un bagno ampio e ottimamente fornito.
La stanza era pulitissima e curata due volte al giorno.
Se devo trovare un difetto suggerirei una migliore insonorizzazione dai rumori esterni ma anche interni (porta della camera).
Ottimo ristorante al piano terra.
Direi che quando tornerò a NY non ho dubbi su quale albergo scegliere.

title: Phantastin Place near Bryant Park
text: The Hotel is clean and all the People working there where friendly. Our room was bigger than Most of others we stayed in before and  had a huge bathroom. The best was the place, it is on Bryant Park, this is a little paradies in New York

title: Absolutely amazing!
text:
Our experience with this hotel has been one we never experienced before. I checked in with my 16y old daughter to celebrate her sweet sixteen. Yazmin Hernandez, Ashley, Jonathan and the rest of the team, made our stay into something beyond imagination. We got an upgrade to the breathtaking junior sweet, the room was filled with balloons, cake and a lovely personal card. We just couldn’t stop jumping of joy with tears in our eyes of so much heartfelt effort that was put into making our stay and the special occasion absolutely unforgettable. 
Thank you all once again! We will be back for sure. We felt like royalty.

title: Beautiful location, great service
text: Service was over and beyond. Waking up everyday to beautiful Bryant Park is a real treat. You’ve got great coffee next door at Blue bottle, and excellent drinks in the hotel at Celon. Thanks team for a great stay.

title: Amazing!
text: Stayed for my birthday weekend, and had the best time! Ashley and Emily were both so helpful with anything I needed. Everything was beautiful and the service was impeccable! Beautiful room and view! I will definitely be back!!

title: First Class Hotel Great Staff & Location
text: We stayed here for 4 nights. Warmly welcomed by Matthew then Ashley we were very impressed with our rooms which overlooked the park. Location could not be better for Broadway Times Sq and 5th Avenue..Maria looked after us and our roomes very well. Nothing was too much trouble for any and every member of staff. Would highly recommend and would returning a heartbeat!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Stayed here two nights for business because my usual midtown place was booked up, and I am very happy I did.  Reception staff was amazing - very genuine and clearly well trained.  I got a Jr suite overlooking the park for a great price and it was great.  I’ll be back for sure.  Nice place and highly recommended.

title: A great stay!
text: I enjoyed 4 great nights in a Deluxe Park View room at the beginning of August. The room was spacious and super clean. The bed was really comfortable, too which you don't always find in hotels. The bathroom was huge and I loved that there was ample counter space. The decor and hardwood floors made it feel like I had my own little NY apartment which really added to the stay. All of the staff I encountered were super friendly and professional. The hotel is in a great location and the park across the street is awesome. I would recommend Bryant Park Hotel to a friend and I will be back very soon.

title: Above and beyond
text: I love this place -- the only thing better would be if I could bring my dog.  On my latest stay, I mentioned that I was having problems with one of the outlets by the bed....it wouldn't hold my laptop brick....by the time I got back that afternoon, I had a powerstrip and a lovely gift....I so appreciate it....it was completely above and beyond.

title: As much as I'd like to keep this gem to myself...
text: A lifelong NY-er (who recently left), I'm hard to impress. But this has become my go-to home-away-from-home when I visit the city. The bed, the bathroom, the proximity to the park, the sushi...I could go on and on and on. The front desk team -- Miguel and Dennis -- are truly amazing. I can't imagine staying anywhere else. If I could give it six stars, I would!

title: another great stay
text: We had another great stay at the Bryant Park Hotel. My wife and I stayed in late July to visit my son and his wife and their new baby. Bryant Park Hotel let us check in early so we didn't have to keep our luggage with us. The room as expected was really nice and the people extremely helpful. Great hotel that is very convenient to almost everything. We plan on many trips back to NYC and plan on staying at the Bryant Park Hotel.

title: Truly lovely hotel in great location
text:
I have been to New York as a tourist and business traveller from London several times, and this is the only hotel in the city I have liked.  It’s a really lovely hotel.  It’s at the upper end of mid-range in pricing, and worth every cent (or penny).  The rooms are spacious, well appointed and well maintained.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  
It’s in an architectural landmark building overlooking the compact Bryant Park - a short walk from Times Square, from the Broadway theatres, from Fifth Avenue, from the Rockefeller Center and from the Empire State Building.  Bus and subway (metro) links across the city are excellent.  There are lots of cafes nearby, but surprisingly few decent restaurants in the neighbourhood (although a short bus ride takes you to any of the city’s many eateries).
The only minor drawback is that, if you are travelling as a family, there is no real lounge area in the hotel - there is a cocktail bar but those under 21 are not admitted, and there is also a sophisticated and pricey Japanese restaurant.
This minor quibble apart, it’s a truly excellent hotel.  I’d definitely come again.  Highly recommended.

title: Great Anniversary Stay
text: We celebrated our anniversary at the Bryant Park Hotel, which not only gave us a free bottle of sparkling wine but also kindly upgraded us to a corner room with a great view of the park and the surrounding area.  The hotel is close to Hudson Yards, the High Line, and Central Park.  The staff couldn't have been nicer and the free coffee in the morning was much appreciated.

title: Sightseeing/Shopping
text: The staff at this hotel is top notch.  I was pampered and treated with great respect and care.  The location is perfect for access to all the sightseeing tours as well as great shopping and dining opportunities.  I’m definitely booking this hotel in my return trip.

title: The Bryant Park Hotel Continues to Get Better
text:
My wife and I recently got to stay at the Bryant Park Hotel.  It had been a couple of  years since we were in New York and we were glad that the Hotel continues to provide top notch customer service, looks great, has added amenities, and is so central to everything. 

As we were getting out of our Lyft, Matthew greeted us and welcomed us back to the Hotel.  He took us into Yasmin at the front desk, who cheerfully introduced herself, welcomed us back, gave us bottles of water and told us about the changes at the Hotel since our last stay two years ago, which included a new morning coffee and muffin service and a complete overhaul of their bar venue.  The customer service is top notch and we always feel like the most important guest in the Hotel when we stay there.  Yasmin provided us with a complementary upgrade as well.

Javier helped get our bags up to the room, again told us about the morning coffee service and made sure we were comfortably settled in our room before he left.  The room was huge and overlooked Bryant Park. The bathroom had a soaking tub and a separate glass enclosed shower, premium toiletries, fluffy towels and robes -- a spa like experience in our room. In the morning we took advantage of the coffee and muffins to jumpstart our day before heading to Maison Keyser for pastries and Blue bottle for coffee -- both just steps from the hotel, that we then enjoyed in Bryant Park.  Later that day Chiran, the doorman, made sure we took an umbrella because of the threat of rain.
