It was another outstanding experience at the Bryant Park Hotel.  Darren, the manager, can be proud of his outstanding staff.  We look forward to coming back soon.

title: Still my favorite...
text:
I’ve been coming to BPH for over 4 years now and it’s starting to feel like home.  It’s always nice when Darren and his staff welcome me as one of their own and do the same for all their guests.   The location is so perfect in the summer when the Bryant Park ambience creeps into your room and whispers to you to come out and experience New York City.  Music, people, 5th Avenue, time square—all within a block.  Just can’t beat it.  

Look forward to my next stay.

title: Great location, great staff, and fabulous bath!
text: I was in NYC for 5 days on business and added a couple of days for a little pleasure. My client recommended the Bryant Park Hotel and it was a terrific recommendation. The hotel is across the street from Bryant Park (perfect place for sitting while reading a book and drinking a glass of wine. The room I had (#1005) was simple with no view (which was fine with me) but it was very clean and the bed was so comfortable! But the bathroom was the big winner! Roomy, great lighting (women really appreciate that!), lots of counter space for toiletries, terrific shower with excellent water pressure and a spa-size tub perfect for a relaxing bubble bath after a long day. The desk staff was always personable and helpful no matter what time of day/evening. It will be my new preferred hotel when I need to be in midtown in NYC.

title: Birthday Weekend Celebration!
text: This is my husband and my 3rd stay.  We go back to Bryant everytime we want to celebrate an occasion.  Our visit this weekend was over and beyond. The team that works at this hotel was more than accommodating.  My husband was handicapped this trip due to a work injury on the job, broken knee.  The staff couldn't do enough to make sure we had enough ice for the knee swelling and attended to anything we needed.  A definite go to hotel if you want a great location, great view of the park.  We look forward to our 4th stay for our next special occasion.

title: Easy, Comfy place to stay for a Trip to NYC
text:
Great location for seeing all the sights, but not as hectic staying in Times Square...you can actually relax in Bryant Park! I visited for business but would recommend this place to anyone visiting NYC especially if it's your first time or you're there for sightseeing.

The staff are very nice, too, and the bar downstairs looked pretty cool.

title: BEST TRIP EVER!!!
text: All I have to say is WOW! Booked a room for my parents 30th year anniversary and Miguel and Job upgraded our room free of charge! I have never received better service! Highly recommended staying here!

title: Posh Place, Feels like Family
text: We were in NYC for wedding dress shopping with friends and family. We were upgraded to a junior suite. (We had stayed in a junior suite previously at Bryant Park Hotel--and knew how fabulous it could be.) From the moment we walked in we felt like were among friends who were trying to show us a good time in the heart of Manhattan. We were provided early check in and late check out at no additional fee. The entire building is posh and modern so it feels like stepping into the extraordinary. The beds, bathrooms, even the elevators are fabulous. Also, steps from Time Square, the NY Public Library, and the shops on 5th Ave. Just the perfect destination.

title: Great Experience with Amazing Views
text: I had a lovely experience at the Bryant Park Hotel. We opted for a Deluxe View Room and it was SO WORTH IT. The Views are incredible, you can see all of Bryant Park without the sounds and the commotion. The room was immaculately clean with plenty of storage, two bath robes and a huge bathroom (probably the largest bathroom I've seen in most NYC hotels. Best of yet, this room came with a soaking tub which was absolutely perfect. As I was celebrating my anniversary, the Bryant Park surprised us with Champagne, Balloons and chocolates with is always nice. I have absolutely no complaints about the hotel, just pure perfection!

title: Room with a view!
text:
I stay at the Bryant Park Hotel at every opportunity, and they never fail to deliver a superb experience - with warm and helpful people, beautifully appointed rooms, comfortable beds, and first rate amenities. (Truth be told: I took all the Molton Brown stuff home with me...) But this trip was the best trip ever: I had an extra spacious room on the 11th floor, with a fabulous view of Bryant Park.

Now, there was a big storm coming in last night, when I was due to fly home, and all our flights were cancelled mid-day. My colleagues were upset that they'd likely have to stay overnight. Me, I was looking forward to it! Alas, our corporate travel office reminded me of the Amtrak option, so I wasn't able to extend my stay. But I would have... in a heartbeat.

title: Great stay ! Excellent room, very nice staff.
text: My daughter and I had a corner room with two double beds. The room had 6 windows, it was fantastic. Very clean, a nice couch/table area, big bathroom with a bathtub, a shower..Great location, very nice and friendly staff. Highly recommendable.

title: Fabulous!
text:
We loved this hotel! We were able to check in early, and efficiently. Very friendly and helpful staff. We received bottles of water upon check in. Room was large, bathroom was large. Lovely decor!
We will definitely stay here again!

title: Summer in NYC 2019
text:
We booked a junior suite overlooking the park, it was a great room. They got us in early which we were thankful for after traveling by car, plane and train. There is construction taking place with scaffolding but luckily it didn’t obstruct our views. 

Friday nights the club in the basement seems to attract a lot of young kids who wait in line outside to enter. Kind of annoying to have to deal with in all honesty. It’s nice that you need to show keycard to get access to the elevators. 

We left early Saturday morning and arrived back after noon to find the room had not been made up yet. Called to housekeeping and was assured it would be handled soon. We left again and returned around 5, still not made up. We had to call to get fresh towels so we could get cleaned up for the evening. They sent towels and apologized but I have to admit, I was really really disappointed. We had used towels, dishes, garbage in a great room and for the cost I paid, it really tainted my view. 

On our way out to dinner Saturday night I stopped by the desk and requested a late check out to make up for the inconvenience. I wasn’t trying to be a jerk, but I felt like the management could have offered something to make up for the miscue. We got an extra hour before we had to leave on Sunday. It was a hollow victory but I guess it was something! 

The location and the view were what made the stay. The fact we had hard wood floors instead of carpeting and a walk in shower was what convinced me to upgrade to the pricier junior suite. It was worth it, and would have been perfect in every other way were it not for the housekeeping issue. 

I would wholeheartedly recommend. Just be prepared to pay boutique hotel pricing.

title: Fantastic!
text: Wonderful hotel in a very good position. But what made our stay extra special? The staff. Nothing was too much trouble, the concierge even made us lunch and Broadway reservations. Superb. Everything actually exceeded our expectations and we look forward to returning for our next visit. Super cocktail bar too!

title: Class act
text:
We are currently still staying at this hotel and it's probably one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in. The location is perfect, and only 1 minute walk to the Subway. Bryant Park is great to be around and the hotel is located right on 5th avenue so it's perfect for exploring.

I have to praise the hotel for their excellent service. I mentioned during check in that it was my partners birthday and our first trip to New York and they upgraded our room and put a balloon and cake in there as a surprise for us. That was really unexpected but incredibly nice and it's touches like this that separate good hotels from great hotels. 

We can't praise this hotel highly enough and when we return to New York in future, this will be our only hotel choice!

title: Excellent Birthday Stay
text:
Let me just say the our stay from the minute we pulled up in our car until we checked out was absolutely amazing. When we checked in we were greeted by Miguel Enriquez the Front Office Mgr. who actually checked us in. He was welcoming and inviting from the first word. We were lucky enough to get upgraded to a penthouse suite which ws a nice surprise as we were celebrating my wife's birthday. The entire staff was helpful and pleasant at every interaction and would recommend this property to everyone. We will definitely make The Bryant Park Hotel our go to hotel every time we stay in the city. Miguel and staff THANK YOU!!!!  You made a one night stay extremely pleasant and memorable.

Bart

title: Nice stay in Manhattan
text: It was a very nice stay in the center of Manhattan,near ther Bryant Park,a vibrant place with a  lot of events during the evenings,with nice terraces,good air and nice people to meet.The hotel itself is expensive but the location is one of the best for New York.You have between 6 to 8 am a complimentary coffee and muffin only breakfast,water in the lobby,very clean rooms and very good services.I,ll be back

title: ロケーション、サービスともに良いホテル
text:
ブライアントパーク目の前の立地ということで、周辺になんでも揃っていて地下鉄やバスへのアクセスも良く、効率よく動くことができました。ホテルの従業員のみなさんのホスピタリティも良かったです。バスルーム付きの部屋を予約していたので（水圧、清潔さもバッチリ）旅の疲れも癒せて快適にすごせました。
ただ、週末の夜間はホテルのバーがクラブのように使われているのか、ロビーに宿泊者以外の若者の出入りが多く、少しセキュリティに不安を感じました。

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: I've had the opportunity to stay in various hotels in Manhattan and this is by far the best one. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. I have always been checked in and got a room in timely manner. The location is fantastic being in within walking distance of Grand Central, Port Authority, and Penn Station if you are traveling into the city. Maybe 15-20 minute walk to Central Park as well. There are plenty of great restaurant and bars close by. Also, at night Bryant Park is lit up and during the summer there are shows, and during winter it turns into a skating rink. The rooms are very modern, probably the mos spacious compared to other hotels, and have great views of the park. I've always had a fantastic experience when staying at BPH.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed here for one Saturday night at the end of July. The staff was incredibly welcoming the moment we stepped inside. Miguel checked us in and informed us that we had been given a complimentary upgrade to a park-view room, which was a lovely surprise. The room itself was on the small side (typical for NYC) but with a huge bathroom, cold AC, a very comfortable queen-size bed, and an impressively stocked minibar. And of course a great view.

There are shades on the windows instead of black-out curtains, so the room doesn't get completely dark, and given the location you can expect outside noise. The complimentary earplugs were a nice perk, as I forgot to pack some, and there's an eye mask for purchase on the minibar if the light is a bother.

It's of course worth noting the location is amazing, being in the heart of Midtown, across from a great park, and close to plenty of things to do nearby and public transportation options to get around the city.

title: Great Hotel, Great Experience
text: The Bryant Park Hotel is a luxury hotel with reasonable rates at a great location overlooking Bryant Park. The staff was courteous,knowledgeable, and responsive. The rooms are clean, comfortable and stylish.We have stayed here two years in a row and we will certainly be back back next year.

title: LOVE, LOVE this hotel!!
text: Where to begin?!? Came to NY on a work trip, and quickly fell in love with this awesome hotel and it’s wonderful staff!! The hotel is super comfortable & clean. It’s also super walkable! And the best part is their phenomenal staff!! Ashley & Miguel made check in fun and easy, Sara their concierge went above and beyond to help me out with things I needed to take care of in pdx, and everyone else I’ve met has been wonderful too!! Thank you for making my stay so wonderful and easy!! I highly recommend this hotel... just save me a room, because I’ll be back soon!!

title: Perfect Midtown Getaway
text: My wife and I travelled to NY for just a few days to see a play and explore Manhattan.  We chose the hotel because it was near the Hudson theater and directly across from Bryant park.  We were thrilled to be in such a wonderful location and it didn't disappoint in any way.  The view of the park was wonderful from our room and my wife really appreciated the sitting bench by the window.  The staff was great, the restaurant was delicious, the rooms were modern and spacious.  It was a great time and I'll definitely stay here again next time I come out this way.

title: Excellent midtown hotel
text: It's not easy finding an appealing hotel to stay in midtown Manhattan. In future, I won't look further than the Bryant Park. The only disappointment we had was that we only stayed for one night. The staff were friendly, we were upgraded to a Bryant Park suite which was huge, modern, clean and welcoming. The location above Bryant Park itself is a perfect contrast to nearby Times Square and the Rockefeller Center. We didn't have time to try the restaurant or cocktail bar but if they matched the room I am sure they are excellent. Enjoy!

title: Great location, nice room, fantastic bathroom
text: I just returned from a one-night weekend stay at this hotel. Bed was super-comfortable (very firm mattress) and room was clean and decently sized by NYC standards. Bathroom is enormous and the tub is big enough to fit two people. Separate tub and shower! They provide robes and slippers. Front desk staff are very accommodating also. My only complaints about this hotel are that they have no coffee machine in the room (though there is free coffee in the downstairs elevator hallway between 6-8 AM), the elevators have a weird red light and make you feel like you are going to a disco, and there is no lobby to speak of. So, for instance, if you want to check out of your room and then hang out in the lobby for an hour before catching your train, or meet up with friends...this is not the hotel for that, though there is a lounge/restaurant that is open sometimes. But Bryant Park is just across the street and it's lovely, and in good weather you can certainly sit there. I was quite happy with the hotel overall and I'd return just for the bathtub.

title: Favourite hotel by far
text:
We have been to NYC around 10 times and this by far is the best hotel we have experienced in NYC. Every member of staff were friendly and professional at all times. We got upgraded and were given 2 cocktails vouchers, wine and chocolates. The cocktails were really nice and we would of stayed longer but had reservations for a baseball game. 
The location was excellent with the orange line subway stop at the end of the block. 
We stayed in several cities around USA this trip and this was our favourite hotel. 
Would recommend and would stay there again. Thank you guys.

title: Location is perfect , but I don’t like dark elevator
text:
Stayed for 7 days at this hotel. Walking distance to TS, Grand Central station , Koreatown , etc. 

Hotel hold USD 300 deposit on my credit card which was returned during check out time . 

Room size was okay for 2 people , bright with  minimalist furniture.
Got a room in front of elevator, but no noise came into my room .

Room was cleaned everyday , in the morning and in the afternoon . 

Hotel lobby was small but efficient, there were security guard stayed near elevator most of the time, to check your key card. 

However ,  inside elevator was very dark, barely to see . 

Bell boy service was fast. Door man was attentive and helpful.

title: Best Hotel and Location in NYC!
text:
The Bryant Park Hotel is a great place to stay when you are in NYC. The location is ideal as Bryant Park has so many wonderful things going on as well as just a nice place to grab a snack and hang out.
The hotel is so welcoming from the doormen to the check in staff to the housekeeping. They are very accommodating and helpful. We have been to NYC many times and have stayed in many hotels and the Bryant Park Hotel is by far our favorite.
The rooms are relatively spacious and very clean. The bathrooms are a nice size and asking for extra towels was never a problem. I’d like to mention names specifically, but I can’t remember a specific name. It doesn’t matter though because there wasn’t one person who worked there that wasn’t kind and nice. 
Stay there next time you need a place in NYC. You won’t regret it!

title: Couldn't Do Better
text:
Great location, immaculate updated rooms, modern roomy bathroom, comfy bed, friendly service and fair prices. The Bryant Park Hotel got it right!
It was especially enjoyable to have a drink across the street at the lovely Bryant Park to visit with friends and to people watch.  Could walk to most places and/or close to transportation. 
Very helpful, knowledgeable concierge!

title: Perfect Location, Welcoming Staff
text: Our first time stay was fantastic, we were upgraded to a room with a park view that was beautiful and spacious. The room was lovely, and the soaking tub, small couch, and white noise machine were all very nice touches. The staff went the extra mile to be welcoming and accommodating. On top of that, you can't beat the location, so convenient and a great view of Bryant Park. We will certainly look to stay there on our next visit!

title: Always Great
text: Customer service is key and this hotel gets it right! We’ve always had wonderful rooms and the proximity as well as views of Bryant Park are one of a kind. The rooms are big, clean and perfect for families and couples. The perfect family hotel or business hotel given proximity to all things. With front desk folks like Darren and everyone in between your needs will always be put first! A must stay hotel!

title: Best classic mid level hotel in midtown
text: When in midtown i never stay anywhere else because i have no time for surprises or inconsistencies in my hotel. BPH is right on every time. Its a boutique and classic hotel with character and the park in front is a mid town oasis. Walk to shows and the avenues and eateries with easy on off tp the holland tunnel. Just love the consistencies and professionalism of this small but well cared for hotel. Drive up drop off the keys and pick up and leave with easy valet.

title: Excellent Location!!!
text:
We stayed here for five nights and found the location to be very convienent if you are going to be going uptown and downtown. I don't usually like to stay so close to Times 
Square but we had events uptown, a broadway show, and love going to the east and west villages. There is a subway station at the end of the block and Bryant Park is across the street. We had a one bedroom suite and it was super spacious, especially for NY!!! Javier, along with the rest of the staff were all helpful, friendly, and professional. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location, average stay
text:
For the price, I expected more. The staff was aloof, not very friendly. Maybe if the desk wasn’t parallel to the hallway, there would be more interaction with guests coming and leaving the hotel. I asked for water many times and felt like staff was inconvenienced on several occasions. 

The bed wasn’t very comfortable, pillows were average. The bathroom in suite was very nice, loved the soaker tub.

title: Top Hotel in bester Lage
text: Absolutes Top Hotel in bester Lage in Manhattan. Durch die direkte Parktlage sehr ruhig und und eine Oase in der hektischen Stadt. Zimmer für New York überdimensional und sauber. Wir hatten Parkblick und ein großes Badezimmer. Personal sehe hilfsbereit, gratis Kaffee für Frühaufsteher.

title: Location location
text:
We had our first booking cancelled the day we were due to stay because of an issue with our credit card as we had moved house. No phone call just an email from hotel. We re booked after we got this sorted via a third party as advised by the hotel. A phone call might have been more appropriate than an email. 

We had originally requested a nice room due to this being our 10th wedding anniversary and my birthday. On arrival I have to be honest I was disappointed with our room. We overlooked a wall and roof which contained the air con unit. I complained about this not because of the view but the noise. Hotel were proactive in contacting us about  this but had "no other rooms" to move us too. Not sure how true this was as there were plenty of rooms still available to book online. The air con made a constant hum but we choose to stay in the room. 
The rooms are adequate, simply decorated with a good bathroom.
The hotel has friendly staff especially the door men. The location is amazing with the fab Bryant Park on your door. There is always lots to do at the park. Subway line was at the end of the rood.
Would I stay here again yes simply due to the location nothing more! 
Might be because we have stayed in 4* in dubai etc and expected more from this hotel. The rooms just lack personality or finishing. The hotel lift being so dark is just plain weird- I don't get any connected theme to the rest of the hotel decor. Finally, there is not enough comfortable bar space (downstairs at weekends is just 🙉🙈) not really anywhere to relax with a cocktail.

title: Enjoyable visit in beautiful Bryant Park
text: The staff were incredibly friendly form the moment we arrived. Our room was clean, bed was comfortable. Loved this hotel and you can't beat the location! We didn't try the restaurant attached but have heard good things. I definitely recommend staying here.

title: Good hotel
text:
Stayed in a suite here for 6 nights.

I liked that they had wooden floors. The cleaner also did a very good job in general to keep the suite clean.

The service was friendly and a bit more laid back, some people might not like that. The hotel staff were young in general, in their 30s-40s. 

The elevator was a bit too dark for my own taste  - it had red dim lights.

The suite was very clean, but the furnitures were all from faux-leather/plastic, which I didnt like that much, but surely were very easy to clean. TVs were large, but the sound not that good.

The shower was big and had very nice water pressure, but there was some wall paint coming off next to the door... They should not have wall paint in direct contact with shower water in the first place, might get issues later. (just a tip for the hotel)

The view was very nice, BUT I was actually upset the windows were so dirty. I even attached a picture of it.

The gym was small and compact, but they really should buy new yoga-mats, they were in absolutely gross condition, even though they are very cheap, to buy new ones.

I was forced to sign an agreement not to order catering/delivery to the room because they wanted us to use the hotels restaurant for private dining. I have to say that the restaurant was VERY BAD. I have not EVER paid for more overpriced food in my entire life (pictures attached). Avoid this at all cost!

The location was very good for us, bryant park had nice events almost daily.

I would visit the hotel again, not just the restaurant. I think the room value was fine.

title: Outstanding, just as expected
text: From valet to checkout and all in between it was 5Star as expected for an amazing price.   Thanks to the staff for always making us feel welcomed, even during The Manhattan Blackout 2019. (thanks for having power)

title: CAN I LIVE HERE?
text:
I LOVED IT HERE! Any time I stay in NY I am going to make sure I stay here. First off, the service is great. The front desk helped me with all of my questions, and also helped to make my boyfriends birthday so special :)

The room itself was spotless, roomy, and had an amazing view of Bryant Park. The bed was comfortable, all the products I needed were in the bathroom, and there was a tub AND shower separately.

When I walked outside, I was central/walking distance to everything- the park, shopping, the NY pubic library.... 

All in all, if I could give an 11 out of 10 to this hotel, I would. Everything was perfect and I WILLLLL be back for sure!!

title: Tolles Hotel in super Lage
text: Wir sind vom Hotel restlos begeistert. Das Hotel liegt direkt am Bryant Park, viele Sehenswürdigkeiten sind gut zu Fuß erreichbar. Der Höhepunkt: wir erhielten ein Upgrade auf eine Junior-Suite im 20. Stock. Mit Terrasse und Blick zum Park! Nicht zu toppen. Die Zimmer sind groß und sachlich modern eingerichtet, mit Parkettboden. Bad war auch groß und hell, mit Wanne und Dusche. Alles sehr sauber, Gereinigt wurde 2x am Tag. Das Personal war immer sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Danke Miguel. Kostenloses WLAN war immer ausreichend schnell. Frühstück haben wir immer im Park oder den umliegenden Cafés geholt, da war mehr Abwechslung. Kleines Manko: durch die Fenster ist die Geräuschkulisse von draußen doch zu hören. Trotzdem würden wir jederzeit wieder hier übernachten.

title: Best shower in the world
text:
We loved our stay at The Bryant hotel
We stayed for 6 nights in a junior suite up on the 10th floor
The room is  very large with plenty of room for luggage and space for relaxing
Double windows have views of the park
The power shower is superb and there's also a tub in the very spacious bathroom. Molton Brown products are complementary and there are robes and slippers for added comfort.
Each morning there was complimentary coffee and cakes in the foyer which was greatly appreciated. There's a mini bar but no coffee machine in the room
The room was really well serviced every day by a very attentive house keeping team
Service at the front desk is friendly and welcoming
We loved the location and spent many mornings enjoying breakfast  in the park
Highly recommended

title: Business/Personal
text: The staff is excellent at making guests feel special and welcome. I’m now watching how one of the staff is tossing a balloon in the lobby with a small child. The level of attention to guest needs is way beyond what is expected. It is a pleasure to encounter this level of service.

title: 4th July Stay
text:
Recently stayed at this Hotel, what an amazing place. The rooms are standard size and comfortable the bathrooms are very spacious. The hotel was very clean and the location is 10/10.
Cannot fault our stay at the The Bryant Park Hotel. We stayed on the 8th floor with a park view (highly recommended) 
The staff throughout the Hotel were fantastic

title: Great location on the Park
text:
I stayed at Bryant Park Hotel only for one night during a business trip. It is a very nice hotel, the room was big, clean and comfortable. Great service and staff, and beautiful view on the Park. 
Hope I will stay again for more nights.

title: Nice location on the Park
text: Bryant Park Hotel is in a perfect midtown location for sightseeing: Broadway is walking distance, shops on 5th Ave and the public library are nearby, and relaxing Bryant Park is directly across the street.  It’s definitely more about location in NYC as you’re just back at the hotel to sleep.  I will caution that the pics on Bryant Park Hotel’s website make the finishes, etc look a bit sleeker than they are, as the rooms are a bit worn out.  Molton Brown products are always a nice touch.  Beware that there’s a club in the lobby that can create a bit of noise and lines of people at night.

title: Another Great Stay
text: We've stayed before, and will stay again.  Each time we visit, we get great service and great accommodations.  Love it here.  The rooms are clean and bright and the staff is always will to assist with anything and everything!

title: Right choice
text: A very nice hotel facing Bryant Park, at walking distance from Time Square and from several metro stations. The property is clean, service excellent, room spacious. We had great time overall! Soundproof could be improved. Noise from the outside air conditioning vents could be a problem for someone who has difficulties to sleep.

title: Staycation
text: I was turning 50 and at the last minute decided to spend it in the city. I emailed and Darren called and took care of me.  The front desk (I wish I remembered his name) was so friendly and courteous. The room was beautiful with a great view of Bryant Park. The bathroom was spacious with a separate tub and shower(love that). The bed was cozy, the robes plush. Free wifi! Near the trains and buses.  And I was treated to a surprise gift, balloon and card for my day. I(and my daughter) were treated like queens! Will definitely come back and stay longer! You will regret staying at the Bryant Park Hotel!

title: Bryant Park Hotel is New York
text:
This was my 3rd stay at the hotel and as always it was great. The location is fantastic you walk out of the hotel right into Bryant Park, Times Square is right around the corner. And there is almost always something to do right in Bryant Park.
The staff is great and always helpful with sight seeing and cool things to do. And the restaurant attached "koi" is top notch.
Unless something changes I will always stay at the Bryant Park Hotel when visiting the city.

title: All-around awesomeness!
text:
We loved everything about this hotel. The location is perfect. You are literally at Bryant Park. It is perfect. The moment we stepped inside we were greeted by several staff members, all of whom were super sweet and helpful. We were offered cold bottles of water (it was SUPER hot out). Our room wasn't ready so we were offered an even nicer one with an amazing view. Yes, please! The room was HUGE and everything was on point. What I did not expect was turndown service. We came back from an evening walk to have our ice bucket filled, blinds down, etc. It was a lovely touch. Plus, complimentary coffee and muffins for early risers. Yes, please! Our daughter was treated like royalty and we will definitely look here for our next Broadway sojourn (Broadway is a quick walk from here).

Thanks to the staff!!

title: Great location
text: I will definitely be back. Everyone at the hotel was so friendly and accommodating. We were greeted with bottles of water and stayed in a Jr Suite. The room and staff were both great. There was plenty of space, the shower had good water pressure, and there’s a huge garden tub. The towels are plush and the bed is super comfortable. The hotel is in a great location and walking distance to many places. The hotel was really clean and we had no issues. After checking out the front desk even offered to hold our bags if we weren’t leaving right away. Great service! I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay.

title: Funky place
text: This is an interesting place. I stay here when I visit nyc on business. I stay here because it’s central, not to big, quite quiet and is a funky sort of place. The rooms are large and tasteful and some have good views of Bryant park.

title: Excellent location
text: Bryant Park hotel is a lovely centrally located hotel in midtown. Time square just a few minutes walk, grocery stores and restaurants. The best prize is Bryant Park just across the street. My son loved playing in the park everyday after being out all day. PerThe room was very basic no frills, on the smaller side but the bathroom was a good size. The staff were very hospitable,  helpful and always had smiles on there faces. Overall we had a nice stay at the hotel and recommend perhaps a suite for a bigger room if traveling with family.

title: Neat and straightforward, very friendly staff
text: This is a European-style hotel -- everything you need but no frills, at least in the queen bed room I had.  The bathroom was huge, a nice change for NYC.  What really stood out for me was the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff.  I checked in fairly late in the evening to a friendly greeting, the restaurant staff were prompt and warm, and the bellperson who took my bag for storage during my meeting asked without my mentioning it whether I would need a taxi for the airport later in the day (I did, and it was there right on time).  Great for business travel (the onsite restaurant wouldn't be my first choice with kiddos, but there are of course tons of other options just steps away).  Will stay again!

title: Hate to share it
text: Amazing location, modern rooms, friendly staff.  Love the Bryant Park!  Hate to let the secret out...have returned here again and again, wonderful place to stay in New York, so convenient for the theater and midtown.

title: Really Love This Hotel
text: One of the nicest places we have stayed in NYC. Room was perfect and well-appointed - had tub and shower. Wished we were staying longer. Staff could not be friendlier or more helpful. Terrific location. Reasonable parking arrangement with nearby garage.

title: Excellent location in NYC
text:
We stayed at The Bryant Park Hotel recently, and were very pleased.
Every time we passed by this hotel in our previous visits we thought that we should stay there sometime. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

We were not disappointed as the rooms are spacious and well appointed even though the deco is quite minimalist.
They have nice marble bathrooms and the water pressure is powerful.

The location is quite central without being in the heart of the action like Times Square (though it is only a few blocks away).

The hotel is facing beautiful Bryant Park which is a peaceful haven in that busy city where one can use the numerous tables available to enjoy breakfast, lunch or simply a cup of coffee.

The New York Public Library is located at the east extremity of the park and is well worth a visit. It is housed in a beautiful Beaux-Arts style building and the have free guided tours.

title: I adore this hotel!
text:
Well it had been 10 years since my last visit to New York so I booked into this hotel in May for 5 nights as a pre-birthday treat, upgrading to a view of Bryant Park. Just stunning! You will struggle to find a great hotel with such a view in New York. The bedroom was minimalist which I do like. It was very light due to the big windows and this pleased us. We had a flat screen TV and everything needed for our stay. The room is small but big enough for our needs and it’s presentation was top. The bed is very comfortable. It can be a bit noisy at night but if you have been out in the City all day you won’t need the ear plugs that the hotel provides free. I slept fantastically.

The bathroom had both a shower and a bath. I do prefer the shower to be separate so another tic there. 
Great Molton Brown goodies for those who wished to pamper themselves and the bathroom appealed to the eye. 

The mini bar had everything you could wish for. 

I loved the red light of both the lift and the entrance. Gave a ‘mood’ to the lobby, making it more exotic rather than plain like others.

The check- in staff were excellent as were the lovely men who wished me good day as I left the hotel. Top marks to one and all! The cleaners too, with a personal touch calling card, they kept our room spotless. 

Location. What can I say? This hotel has the best location in New York. Bryant Park across the road with its restaurant and evening activities. A few minutes to Times Square, 5th Avenue right on our doorstep, a short walk to Macy’s and the subways nearby took you to wherever you wanted to go.

I never got a chance to try the sumptuous looking cocktail bar or the koi restaurant as I walked so much I’d get back to the hotel exhausted and be asleep by 10! Next time though!

I can’t recommend this hotel enough. Do upgrade to a room with a park view. It’s stunning and well worth it. Next time I think I’ll stay longer and enjoy the hotel’s bar and restaurant. I can’t wait to revisit next year!

title: 5*, 10/10, fantastic!
text:
Would 100% recommend this hotel. From the moment we arrived and were greeted by Job on reception who helped us with our check in and informed us of our complimentary upgrade, to the moment we checked out and were helped by Jonathan who called us a taxi, waited with us and helped us with our bags into the taxi, we were made to feel very welcome by every member of staff we met. As soon as we walked through the front doors we were greeted every time and a lift called for us (which came pretty instantly) we stayed on the 12th Floor and had amazing views of the park, library and 6th Avenue. Yes the hotel is a little on the pricy side but the location and the service is worth it. Situated on 40th Street we were a 5 minute walk away from Times Square, there was a subway entrance just at the end of the street, and perfect location to go in any direction to all the districts of Manhattan. 
Room was bright, airy, clean and modern. Bathroom was huge! Having read other hotel reviews online we were expecting the room to be small and cramped but this was far from it. 
As you would expect in all areas if NY, traffic runs late into the night and starts early morning so you have to expect you will hear some ground noise but you soon get used to it. However, the walls between rooms in the hotel are paper thin and you do hear a lot of the other rooms doors banging and expect to hear every word of the conversation taking place in the room next door! Luckily for most of our stay we had quiet and respectful neighbours apart from one night – we came back to the hotel around 1am and found a queue all the way down the street leading to our hotel! There is a bar and club (Ceylon Bar) in the lower level of the hotel. We were ushered through the queue by hotel staff (as we were staying guests) which made many people in the queue looking at us like we were VIPs! Whilst we didn’t hear any noise at all from the bar and club, for that night our ‘neighbours’ (I believe of only that night) had been to the club and at around 3am came back to their room stopping by other rooms on the way knocking on the doors pretending to be “NYPD” – however the noise soon subsided with some of partygoers deciding to leave the room to go back down to the party. We didn’t hear them again. The hotel and surrounding pavements the next morning were spotless – not something you always expect once a club / bar has been evidently very busy! 
Upon checkout we asked to leave our bags at reception (as our flights weren’t until much later in the day) Our bags were safely ‘checked in’ and given a security tag and stored away from us until we returned. 
Overall, I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel and will absolutely stay here again when we return. Thankyou Bryant Park Hotel and all your staff for the service and hospitality we were offered which really helped make our stay enjoyable.

title: Amazing stay in the heart of NYC !
text: Excellent location in Manhattan and lovely view on Bryant Park! First class service and friendly staff. Very confortable room and bed. Coffee for free in the morning. That was the fourth time in 5 years I came in this hotel and I still enjoyed it!  Be sure I will be back next year !

title: Sharp and Sophisticated
text:
This is a small hotel well situated that has a 5 star approach.  The staff is friendly and warm, the rooms are well appointed, the service is good (evening turndown with shades drawn for you, and the
hotel has what you need whether it is for business or a NYC getaway.

title: Excellent location
text: The hotel is located right across from Bryant Park. The subway is on the corner so transportation around the city is a breeze. It is walking distance to Times Square and the theatre district. The hotel itself was welcoming. The room and bathroom were a nice size. The Molten Brown toiletries were excellent. My only complaint is that the elevator is very dark. I was uncomfortable if I was alone and it would open up on another floor for other passengers. Otherwise a perfect weekend.

title: WONDERFUL STAY
text: We stayed at the Bryant Park hotel last weekend and it was wonderful.  We had a fabulous patio and enjoyed all of the amenities.  The service was great.  Location is a huge plus.  We will definitely be back!

title: Another Great Stay at the Bryant Park Hotel
text:
I have been staying at the Bryant Hotel for the last 10 years. Service is always impeccable. The staff are friendly, professional and go out of their way to help. 

The hotel is in a fabulous location, opposite Bryant Park. It's a great place to sit and relax before and after work

title: The Suite Life
text:
New York City has tons of landmark hotels, but we love Bryant Park Hotel's proximity to midtown and the NY Public Library. It's a convenient 10-15 minute walk to the theater/Times Square/Penn Station/Grand Central and shopping without dealing with masses of people. The price point is a nice return on luxury and comfort.

We were upgraded to the Bryant Park Suite with a view of Bryant Park and NY Public Library which was a treat.  The Suite includes a dining area, a living/sitting area, a large closet, a bedroom with bathroom. 

The bed was super comfortable, toiletries were the luxurious Molton Brown, pretty black bathrobes/slippers, and separate shower/tub. It was bliss to soak in the tub after a day at the museum. The design is modern very NY chic, but a warning the elevators are a little bit dark.   The hotel is perfect for grown-up crowd and couples, versus the younger party set.

There are various coffee/restaurants/bars in the vicinity so we did not check out either of their inhouse options.  There are multiple subway lines within 5-8 minute walk. 

Our room faced 40th street, so we did hear brief noise past midnight, but they do place a noise cancelling machine in your room.  It was not terrible and I quickly dozed off. 

The staff was gracious and very friendly while assisting us. My husband ordered flowers and they placed them in the room as a surprise.  This is our second stay and given the size of the hotel, I always feel they're always adequately staffed - doormen to help with taxis, bellhop to help store bags, concierge and front desk reception.  It's nice to feel catered and supported. 

The Bryant Park continues to be as charming and perfect as the first time we visited. We always look forward to our next stay~

title: Excellent location, excellent hotel
text: We really loved our stay at the Bryant Park Hotel. It was a FABULOUS location, and the staff was very friendly. The ONLY annoyance was that our outlets in our room didn't work (the ones in the bathroom did, however!). When we told the staff they said they'd fix it ASAP.  We will definitely be back!

title: Love the Bryant Park
text: I have been staying here for many years and it just gets better with age. They have made some small improvements that have made the stay even better. Free coffee and muffins in the mornings, new charging stations and always the great beds and showers! The location is perfect. Far enough from times square to avoid the crowds but close enough to walk to the theatres. Thank you as always, Darren, for making our stay memorable.

title: Weekend Getaway
text:
This was our first time staying at the Bryant Park Hotel and we will stay there every time we visit the City from now on. We were always greeted by friendly employees offering assistance. And, they were quick to help. They were sincerely interested in making sure we had a comfortable stay.
The location is unbeatable and quiet.

title: Fantastic Anniversary Hotel
text: My wife and I stayed here for our 5 year anniversary.  The staff were polite and friendly.  While we stayed there, we never had to wait to get help at the front desk.  We got a balcony room on the 19th floor and it was WONDERFUL.  It's by far the largest room I've stayed in in New York and the balcony view of Bryant Park was spectacular.  Even ignoring the balcony, we had a lot of windows and plenty of space.  As easily seen on a map, the location is great too.  It's right across the road from the very pretty and fun Bryant Park.

title: Thank you!
text: I had a really comfortable stay at the Bryant hotel which was for only a couple days as I traveled for Business! Johnathon the Doorman was the main reason why I enjoyed my stay so thoroughly! He truly met my every need with out me even asking anything. I appreciate his efforts greatly and would love to come back to stay and to see Johnathon! Thank you so much x

title: Best kept secret in nyc
text:
My husband turned 50 and the only place he wanted to celebrate was at  The Bryant Park Hotel!   I surprised him
with a two night stay.   You will be treated well from the moment you walk through the door.  All staff went above and beyond.. even surprising my husband with a mini birthday gift pack.  They offer valet parking at a decent rate.  Let’s talk about the room... it’s spacious....very clean.  Bed was a king and was super comfortable.  The room we stayed in had a soaking tub which was heavenly after walking in nyc  all day. They offered high end toiletries and big fluffy towels.  It overlooked the park which was pretty cool.  It was conveniently located and close to subways as we prefer to go uptown.   It was a bit of an indulgence, but it is well worth it.  Planning on going back to celebrate our 30th anniversary in 5 years!

title: My funky New York hotel
text: I have stayed at Bryant Park hotel many times and I call it my funky New York hotel. It just works for me and my family. Bryant park is almost like a private garden of the hotel except of course at lunch time when the park is very busy. The service is excellent and the staff extremely attentive. The rooms are large and clean and well appointment with a style that is both modern and comfortable and certainly not avant-garde. We were upgraded to a fantastic suite which was just perfect and provided the perfect icing on a very nice cake.

title: A friendly, welcoming excellently located facility.
text: Received a warm welcome at the reception desk and was upgraded to a suite without asking and offered a bottle of prosecco or chocolates.  Every one of the employees with whom we had contact was friendly and offered assistance.  We had a problem with the room temperature since they had converted to AC but it was cool.  They promptly brought up a space heater which solved the problem.

title: Amazing
text: Staying here after my hotel messed up my reservation. Wonderful stay. Everyone you come across is very service focused. Room was fantastic- large for NYC. Absolutely and without question the very best bathroom I’ve ever had; water pressure remarkable for NYC..... will most certainly return! Thanks Bryant Park x

title: Excellent hotel in NYC
text:
家内と6泊しました。比較的小さいホテルですが、場所も広さもサービスも素晴らしい！
おススメします。
英語を話す必要がありますが、下手な英語にも親切に対応してくれました。比較的長く滞在しましたが、とても快適に安心して過ごせました。

I have stayed several hotels in NYC, and I chose this hotel this time, because of its location and roominess. 
My expectations were very much fulfilled, but its quality of services far more exceeded my expectations.
The devoted efforts made by all the staff, at the concierge desk, at the front desk and at the door to satisfy the guests’  needs are so impressive.
I definitely recommend this hotel to all!

title: Perfect weekend!!!
text: Our stay at the Bryant Park Hotel was absolute perfection!  The friendliness and attentiveness of the staff is nothing short of amazing!  John and Yazmin went out of their way to make sure everything about our stay was special while we were celebrating our 30th anniversary.  Thank you all and can’t wait for the next opportunity to stay here again!

title: Overpriced
text:
The plusses:  fantastic location .  Trains, Broadway, gorgeous Bryant Park, 5th Avenue nearby. Excellent helpful staff.  Large bathroom. 

The negatives:  nothing really special about the hotel itself.  Our bedroom was quite small , the elevators were so dark you can’t see when in them, no nice place to hang out for breakfast or just lounging.  A couple benches near the elevator but no lobby seating.

title: Amazing Stay Best Hotel in NYC
text: When we go to New York we always stay at The Bryant Park Hotel even though there are many other hotels in NYC. Can’t imagine staying at any other hotel in NYC.  Every time we visit The Bryant Park Hotel Darren and his staff always make us feel welcome.  All of the staff went above and beyond to make our stay very enjoyable and memorable.  The hotel is in an excellent location in Midtown.  It is close to many major attractions. Located across the street from Bryant Park is an added bonus. Rooms are spacious and housekeeping does an excellent job. Can’t wait to return again!!!  Would definitely recommend The Bryant Park Hotel when visiting NYC!!

title: Amazing  Stay...just one night but memorable
text:
A last minute booking brought us here.
As soon as we pulled up outside the hotel we were met by Job from the front desk who helped with "valeting" the car and checking us in. Reception was full of friendly faces. Job made sure our one night experience was memorable.

Our bellman Chiran, from Nepal was delightful as he took us to our room with our luggage.

The location was perfect, overlooking Bryant Park and close to Times Square. 

All in all what makes the hotel a place to go back to (at least our second visit) and recommend it to our friends and post a five star review on TA is the staff and their passion to make you happy.  

We would give them all a big hug but these days that might be misconstrued !

title: Everything you need!
text: We loved this hotel!  A perfect location. Friendly helpful staff, comfortable room and bed.  Lovely turndown service. And even on the 4th floor it was so quiet! Great neighborhood and easy to get everywhere else we wanted to go.

title: Amazing Mother's Day weekend!
text: If you want to have a truly remarkable stay in New York City, check out the Bryant Park Hotel.  Our room had a gorgeous view of the park and was exceptionally clean.  The staff is polite, professional, and very attentive to detail.  I loved that they had coffee downstairs every morning by 6 a.m.  Room service was prompt and the breakfasts we enjoyed were excellent.  We will definitely stay there again!

title: Simply the best
text: We have been returning to Bryant Park Hotel over many years now.. We love the location and the customer service is top notch from everyone. Rooms are always spotless, very sleek, stylish  and modern in this historic building.  Special thank you to Darren Summer who always takes such a good care of us. Will be back again next year!

title: Upscale hotel and great location
text: This is my second visit to The Bryant Park Hotel within a few months and it has quickly become my new fave. The front desk staff are super accommodating, the rooms are nicely furnished, bathrooms are modern and well thought out. You can't beat having Bryant Park out your window and front door for dining, sitting and people watching. The hotel is central to all modes of transportation too. This is a winner in my book!

title: IL MIO PREFERITO IN NYC !
text:
Location che ho visitato e recensito più volte ( vedere dettagli nelle mie precedenti ) 
Difficile trovare una posizione migliore in città  ...poiché é sito nel cuore di MidTown in un angolo a dir poco strategico ( tra la 5th e la 6th con affaccio sull'omonimo parco con le fermate delle metro arancione sulla 42th e con la comoda linea purple della metrò che taglia Manhattan in modo trasversale ).
Albergo di livello in stile retrò , con prezzi medio alti.
Il plus di sicuro é la posizione ed in generale la struttura che però ...dall'ultima ristrutturazione( se non erro nel 2000) comincia a dimostrare i segni del tempo : 
- Termostato troppo antiquato ( vedi foto ) analogico con scarsa capacità di regolazione , ( comunque climatizzazione silenziosa ) 
- alcuni arredi e rivestimenti dimostrano i segni del tempo , 
- porte camera poco isolanti dai rumori sui corridoii , idem per le finestre che hanno vetri e serramenti non male ma  sicuramente oggi c’è di meglio ( in termini di isolamento acustico e termico ) 
- impianto audio valido ma datato , 
- servizio in generale meno accudente e più algido rispetto al passato.
- manca bollitore o macchina caffè ( non possibile averle neppure su richiesta ) 
Ottimi rimangono sempre :
- i bagni ( come rivestimenti , rubinetti ed accessori ) che sono più ampi della media locale . Acqua calda , ci vuole un poco ma poi regolatori termostatici funzionano molto bene. Ottimi i prodotti da bagno ( Molton Brown )  
- impianto tv ok , wireless super ( 70 mega in down load , ben 140 in up load ) 
- pulizia impeccabile ( fattore non scontato tra le scelte di alberghi indigeni ) 
Attenzione alla scelta della camera : consiglio piani alti con vista fronte parco , attenzione camere sul retro sono infime ( come vista ) ed i rumori sono maggiori colpa anche dei climatizzatori esterni.
Consiglio , sempre una bella esperienza con la migliore posizione per visitare la città.
ENJOY !

title: Great hotel in great location
text: Seamless service from the moment we walked in the door.  Room was bigger than expected and had a great view of Bryant Park.  Spacious bedroom and bathroom, all very tastefully equipped.  Great visit - wish we could have stayed longer!

title: Great hotel, great service, great location
text: Very friendly and big rooms by Manhattan standards. Good water pressure. Huge bathtubs. Fantastic location near just about everything. Would happily stay here again. My only complaint is that the rooms lack blackout curtains.

title: Fantastische plek, iconisch hotel, communicatie helaas erg slecht
text:
We hebben een geweldig verblijf gehad, mooie, rustige kamer, centraal gelegen.
Helaas is nu, na 2,5 week en diverse mails, nog steeds de reservering op onze creditcard voor de borg niet vrijgegeven. Er wordt niet gereageerd. Onbegrijpelijk voor zo’n tophotel.

title: Great, relaxing stay in NYC
text: I was soooo pleasantly surprised by this hotel.  Full disclosure -- we are Tablet Plus members so we booked on that program meaning we got a nice upgrade on check in.  First of all the front desk and bell staff at this hotel are super welcoming, friendly and helpful.  They handed us a bottle of water on arrival (and departure) and were extremely pleasant to deal with (not the norm in NYC especially.)  They upgraded us to the most amazing suite that had a full dining table which was awesome as we had to spend our mornings working.  We were worried about being in a room so small that only one of us would have a desk (my husband and I work together).  The only downside is that we faced Bryant Park and there seems to be work going on all the time -- drilling, scaffolding going up or down -- at all hours of the night and day.  They do give you ear plugs so we just wore those at night and it was less an issue.  Pretty near to perfect stay -- great location but really the staff made our stay so enjoyable.  A real gem in NYC.  Oh!  And it's in the old American Standard building which is such a joy to sit and look at from Bryant Park...

title: What a pleasure
text:
From the check-in process, quick reservation work by the concierge, attentive waiters and sushi bar chefs, the service at this property was exquisite.  The rooms are well appointed and generous with upscale amenities like nice shampoo, creams, etc.; slippers at the bedside; a comfy robe; great lighting
and a gorgeous view of Bryant Park on W. 40th between 5th & 6th.  I would happily stay there again.

title: Great Location and Wonderful Staff
text:
My friend and I both enjoyed our time here and will definitely stay at this hotel again!  The room was spacious and clean.  Staff was incredibly helpful and friendly.

Location of the hotel is another highlight.

title: AMAZING EXPERIENCE 10/10
text: I came to the Bryant Park Hotel back in January to celebrate my birthday and I booked their Bryant Park Suite and it was a minimalist's dream come true! a decadent, luxurious room that had a living room two bathrooms and a very big center room. The amenities both in my room and within the hotel were wonderful. The hotel also has a restaurant KOI right alongside of it if you want to stay in with amazing, state of the art Asian cuisine. Lastly, the hotel has a great nightlife where the bar also doubles as a ambient lounge/club scene after 12. I also had the hotel's breakfast through room service on the night of my departure and it was absolutely delicious and full of a variety of options for those big on breakfast, highly recommend. My favorite part was definitely the beautiful view from my hotel room that landscaped all of Bryant Park and most of Midtown  Manhattan. The Bryant Hotel is a must, it was truly a pleasure staying there and look forward to staying again!

title: Great location, great hotel
text: Stayed 3 nights for a wedding anniversary trip to NYC. The hotel is in a great location, really close to transport, easy to walk anywhere midtown and up to Central Park, really close to Times Square without being too close. We were booked in a Deluxe View room and were surprised how big it was for an NY hotel. Sadly the room sprang a water leak after a few hours, but the staff were really helpful and had us moved within 10 minutes of reporting it - even better, to a Junior Suite! The bar downstairs was really nice, great for pre-dinner drinks, and so many restaurants nearby to eat in. All the staff we encountered were really friendly and helpful and made the whole stay welcoming and easy. Would definitely recommend for a visit.

title: Great stay, Helpful staff
text:
Our third stay at this hotel —The location of the hotel is perfect; Rockefeller Centre, Times Square, 5th Avenue shopping and many other attractions - all in easy walking distance. All the staff were friendly but Matthew was the standout staff member. I had a long wait (40 min!) to be picked up by a family member and Matthew kept me company whilst still continuing to do his job - greeting & getting cabs in the rain for other guests and whatever else needed his attention.  Also the restaurant next door, Koi,  has an amazing Miso Cod dish. 

The only thing I don’t understand is, Why are the lifts SO DARK?!?!

title: Friendly service in a great location!
text:
This was our second weekend stay, with two adjacent rooms (junior suite and deluxe view queen) facing Bryant Park. These rooms are very spacious, with large bathrooms (a rarity in NYC). The view over the park is lovely, with lots of interesting city life and activity (the good kind!) to watch while you’re idling. 

In addition to the mainstream travelers who occupy the rooms, the Bryant Park draws a young and trendy crowd to a jam-packed nightclub downstairs on weekends. Fortunately the sound doesn’t carry—we were on the ninth floor and unaware of the music. 40th Street is lightly traveled, which also helps. 

The staff has been unfailingly helpful and cheerful—which makes us want to return!

title: great customer service
text: My husband and I loved our stay at the Bryant Park hotel. We appreciated the professionalism and warmth of everyone on the staff. Special thanks to the doorman Devan. We were a bit stressed upon arrival (our first visit to the big city) but Devan made us feel right at home. He was so helpful, and a delight to meet! Superb service!

title: Great Hotel with perfect people
text: My family and I stayed for easter week. I have stayed in this Hotel every time I in NYC for over 10 years. I always return here. The rooms are great, very nice minimalistic style. Always very clean with such attention to detail. This really is a very nice hotel. The only thing they could improve (I think) is renew the bathrooms, which are not bad but could use a few improvements. But this year, what makes me write a review is the superb service. The people were really helpful, it is evident how passionate they are for their work. They accommodate my family in every way they could. Special thanks go to Jasmin at front desk and a super thank you to Sarah Mindlin at Consierge Desk. Sarah was awesome. I will continue to return here.

title: great stay at Bryant Park hotel
text: We had a great stay at the Bryant Park hotel. The manager was very friendly and upgraded our room for us. Jonathan was a delight and great help with our bags. The hotel staff were all friendly and the location of the hotel is excellent for just about everything. We are looking forward to staying there again when we return to NYC.

title: Perfect luxury in the heart of Manhattan
text: So central, lovely rooms, the staff were great, especially the concierge who helped with advice on 'things to do'. We didn't avail of breakfast as there were so many amazing restaurants nearby so I can't give feedback on that. We did look at eating in 'Koi' the Japanese eatery in the Bryant Park Hotel but it was very pricey for us.

title: Feedback
text: Stayed at Bryant Park Hotel from 30 Apr till 04 May: from Ashley who handled check-in so cheerfully to the friendliness and helpfulness of every single staff ... this isn't a hotel, it's a home away from home! Thank you for an excellent experience, you guys are awesome! Siraj Joseph, Singapore

title: New york, New York
text: We really enjoyed the Bryant Park hotel. We nomally stay at another Hotel in New York but it was booked out so we ended up at this Hotel and now we will always stay here. So convientally located right next to Bryant Park (which was great during the cooler months as they had the Ice Skating rink open and all the associated stalls was great after a busy day to just go and relax and roam around the stalls. The staff were friendly and the apartment itself was roomy with a great view of the Empire State building. Love it and would recommend to anyone to stay here.

title: Work NYC stopover
text: I Stayed at the Bryant Park hotel at the end of a work trip to the US. The staff were amazing, friendly, helpful & nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is great, fabulous location, light spacious rooms & great views across the park. I would highly recommend the Bryant Park Hotel

title: Quiet, friendly, convenient location
text: Third time staying here over many years. There are many other hotels at lower prices, and have bigger rooms for the same price. But for the combination of service, relative tranquility of being next to Bryant Park, walking distance to the Theatre District, being so central, it’s unbeatable.

title: Perfect Manhattan Location
text:
We had a wonderful anniversary weekend at the Bryant Park Hotel. Despite rain and wind, the Park was beautiful with spring flowers blooming. This is a great location!
Easy walk to subways and the theaters. 

I don't remember every name but spoke with Dennis T and Sara a few times. The manager kindly upgraded us for our anniversary. The room was very comfortable and we loved the view of skyline and the park. 

We tried both the bar and the restaurant and liked them both. As a former travel agent, I am very particular about hotels but this was a wonderful small hotel in a great location in Manhattan! I highly recommend it and would stay again!

title: Lived up to its reputation again. I highly recommend for business or pleasure.
text:
I stayed here for one night in August 2018 for business. It was my second stay. On arrival I was informed that I had been upgraded from a superior room to a deluxe room with a view over Bryant Park. Not a bad way to start the stay! I was by myself. The room has a very large marble bathroom with an awesome walk in shower with powerful water pressure. Also has a tub to soak in if you want. The bed was queen sized and very comfortable. When I asked for more toiletries or an iron and ironing board it was brought very quickly. 

The location is pretty hard to beat if you are in NYC for business or pleasure. You can get into Times Square or Central Park very easily. No problem getting a cab on jumping on the subway. If you have business in mid-town you are all set. 

Overall the hotel spaces and room was spotless. They obviously take cleaning seriously and the hotel cleaners must do a good job. 

Dennis at the front desk was very helpful and all the staff were polite and eager to please. Special thanks to Dennis Sumner, Director of Front Office & Guest Services for making it such a great stay.

title: Beware the punishment! Management cannot take criticism...
text:
We are staying at this hotel for 3 nights. And already by second day, twice our room was not made up till late afternoon (after 4pm). 
I go to the lobby and have to wait so I ask at the reception how many staff they have to service the rooms and how many rooms are serviced by each. My opinion is they have not enough staff and that the staff are more than over worked if they are still servicing the rooms on the 4th floor by 4pm. 
As I cannot access my room, I ask the staff at the lobby if I can have a glass of water to take my medicine... guess what, they said they have no water. “Sorry ma’am, no more water”, and that was the manager... John! He got upset by my comment and decided to punish me by not offering me water, not even tap water. The lobby has no glass of water for a client to take their medicine. Wow. 
Seriously, whether they have rooms facing the park, good restaurants, or a great location, with this kind of attitude and service all that is not worth it.
How shameful. 
The only redeeming second star is for the young staff called Devon who himself went out of his way to get me a glass of water from the staff room. 
Let’s hope if you decide to stay here, you will not need anything from the reception when John is around. And if you do, don’t give your opinion on any thing that is not running well in their hotel... you may be punished!

title: Loved it
text:
Bryant Park hotel is a fabulous building and of course overlooks Bryant Park, which is a super location.
Our room was large and comfortable.  The bed was very comfortable and I loved the big bath it was sublime. After a day out was great to relax in the room, the only amenity I would add, maybe a coffee maker.
The staff were lovely and helpful.

title: Great hotel and everything within walking distance
text:
•	We enjoyed a junior suite during our stay and had a beautiful view on Bryant Park (you can also ask for a room with a view on the backyard)
•	Very convenient location and very central, everything was within walking distance. The hotel is close to many attractions and restaurants (Empire State building is 10 min away ; MOMA 15 min ; Times Square 10 min ; etc.)
•	Very comfortable bedding
•	Only downside : they should install blackout blinds or curtains because the sun comes in very early in the morning. Be careful if you need a dark bedroom when sleeping

title: Excellent hotel in a great location
text:
Everything about the Bryant Park hotel was flawless from booking all the way through to checkout. The staff were friendly, efficient and professional. The large room was spotless, comfortable and quiet. Location is near most tourist locations in Manhattan and the park outside the front is a great place to relax with a good choice of coffees and snacks.
I will definitely stay there again.

title: Personal Touch in the City
text: I booked a room for one night for my partners birthday.  Early check in was seamless and easy.  We were given an upgraded room (without asking or mentioning anything) with a beautiful view of Bryant Park.  Everything was perfect.  On check out the following day, we stored our bags for the entire day.  When we came back to catch a cab for our trip home, we were assisted by a wonderful doorman, from Nepal, who treated us as if we were regular, first class customers.  It might be a bit more expensive than a chain hotel but in our view, is well worth the cost!  The restaurant, Koi, serves great Japanese fusion food and the downstairs bar provides a lovely Moroccan environment for an after or pre-dinner cocktail.

title: Perfect location, excellent service, good value
text: From the time we checked in the experience was outstanding. Staff were so very helpful. We booked a slightly larger room to accomodate work needs. Very roomy and comfortable compared to most NY hotels and also well insulated from the NY street noise. I couldn't fault anything about the hotel.

title: Location incredibile, ma rapporto qualità prezzo fuori posto
text: Niente da dire, la location è da 10 e lode. prezzo, però, non in linea con il prodotto offerto. quel tipo di struttura deve offrire un’insonorizzazione impeccabile, che qui non si trova. peccato... avrebbe potuto fare concorrenza ai più blasonati concorrenti

title: Superior experience, perfect location
text:
We spent a long holiday weekend at the Bryant Park hotel and it was perfect for our family of 3 to relax and enjoy the city. We reserved a suite and secured a roll away bed for our child. The suite was spacious and well appointed with modern decor, high ceilings, and a wood floor (no nasty hotel carpeting here!). The bathroom was enormous with a fantastic shower, separate tub, luxury bath products and the best water pressure in the shower. Most surprisingly of all, the room was quiet!  We were never disturbed by other guests.  The staff is truly wonderful. We let them know we were celebrating a birthday and when we checked in we found a balloon, card and sweet treat for the birthday girl. 

Don’t be scared off by the night club in the hotel. It was not a problem at all. Did not have a chance to try the restaurant. 

New York City lodging is notoriously overpriced and undersized. We felt that the suite, though a splurge for is, was actually a great value considering all that was included. The location is excellent especially for broadway shows. 

We love the Bryant Park Hotel and will definitely be back for future visits.

title: Perfect NYC spot
text: My sisters and I booked two rooms to celebrate our mom's 80th birthday. We are all from the NYC area, but wanted to do something special. The Bryant Park Hotel was perfect in numerous ways. We had two rooms - one with two double beds and one with a queen. The queen room had spectacular park views (both rooms had high ceilings and oversized windows). The other was large for a NYC hotel room and had a little seating area that was a perfect space for us all to sit for a long while as we looked at the photo book we'd brought along. It also served as a comfortable place for breakfast. (There are numerous perfect places on the block for breakfast/brunch, as well as the park, but we chose to bring in.) Both rooms had enormous bathrooms that were well stocked. The rooms were spotlessly clean and minimalist in decor, which we appreciated. The beds were very comfortable and it was quiet at night.The staff couldn't have been more lovely. Friendly and attentive. Locationwise, it's ideal. Bryant Park is a gem, you are a short walk from the theater district and centrally located (easy subway access) for anywhere in the city.

title: Home from home
text:
This is the 7th time my wife and I have stayed at the Bryant Park hotel, it’s an amazing hotel in an amazing location and we wouldn’t stay anywhere else whilst in the city. What makes this hotel so brilliant is the staff. They can’t do enough to help you.

It was my wife’s 40th birthday whilst we were staying so I emailed the hotel in advance to let them know, I had booked a suite and requested a terrace room. We checked in and WOW!!, we had a massive terrace with direct views across to the fabulous Bryant Park! The hotel staff also brought a cake, a personalised birthday card and balloons for my wife.

Since the last time we stayed here the Cellar bar has been revamped to the Celon lounge, we spent our last night in here and had an amazing time, our waitress was fantastic!!, unfortunately my wife and I had one too many cocktails and can’t remember her name :) 

I can’t rate this hotel highly enough and we’re already planning our next trip to NYC for our daughters 18th birthday and we definitely will be staying at the Bryant Park hotel.

Thanks everyone for an amazing stay x

title: Wonderful
text:
This was my third time staying at the Bryant Park Hotel. Each time I’ve been with my pre-teen daughter. We had previously stayed in a junior suite but this time I decided to spend a bit more and got a Bryant Park Suite. I have to say, having two rooms was nice just to give each of us a bit of space when we were relaxing in-between excursions. The suite was very spacious, and included a dining table we used quite a bit. 
The beds in the hotel are way more comfortable than they look, as are the chairs and couches. The bathrooms are great and the products provided are top notch. We ordered room service one night when we got back from a play and even though it was close to when room service ends (11 pm, which is a bit early) the cooked food was freshly prepared and hot and the sushi was delicious. The tv does not have a ton of channels but, when the WiFi was working (it is indeed spotty at times), the ability to steam content from apps like Netflix on our iPad was great. 
This was the lowest floor we had stayed on (8) and the noise level outside was distinctively higher than on the upper floors, especially given the work being done on the street. Request a higher floor if you have a chance (we were there Easter weekend, when it was very busy, and I didn’t notice it until we were settled so I didn’t complain or ask to be moved. Luckily for us ComEd took most of the weekend off.) 
As other reviewers note, even though the hotel itself is nice enough to merit a glowing review, the staff really puts this hotel over the top. To a person they are incredibly friendly and accommodating. A special shout out to Charon (whose name I probably just misspelled) who is a doorman there and was just the nicest most helpful person ever. He was brand new (third day) to the hotel but clearly fit right in with the rest of the tremendous staff. The Bryant Park Hotel is truly a lovely oasis in the middle of NYC.

title: Work trip made easy!
text:
Location:The hotel is right behind the Bryant Park carousel and I enjoyed walking through the park to my office each morning.  The hotel is also just a few steps from the subway and it was easy to hail a cab out front as well.   Its walking distance to Rock Center, Radio City, Times Square and many other touristy attractions. It was all in all, a very convenient location. 

Perks:  The hotel provided free "to go" (or to bring to your room while you get ready) coffee and muffins in the (small) lobby from 6-8 a.m. and that was a nice surprise.  I didn't eat the muffins, but the other guests did seem to want many of them.  The coffee was strong and there was real cream provided.  

Also, the elevators are dark with red overhead lights and the walls were covered in red leather with some thumping electronica playing.  It was strange and intriguing.  It made me feel like i was somewhere cool - even when I was heading out with a toddler.

Upgrades and Special Things: I had booked a suite for the week and weekend since my husband and son would be joining at the end of the week even though the primary purpose of my trip was for work.   When i mentioned this to Ashley at the front desk, she upgraded my room to ensure that I had a daybed in the suite area that my son could use.  

When I was unable to access the hotel room wifi (which unfortunately happens quite often due to my employer's security settings on my laptop), the front desk sent up the tech guy and he was able to allow me to use another network at the hotel, which worked perfectly.  I have had this issue at many other hotels and no one has been able to fix this issue except for the BPH.    

I will definitely stay here again!

title: Perfect!
text:
The Bryant Park Hotel makes hospitality at its finest. Stayed there to celebrate my wife's birthday and they didn't measure efforts to make the staying great. They have upgraded my room, leave a kind gift to my wife and were always available to meet any needs we have. They have the room cleaned twice a day. The room is very spacious (I got a junior suite), clean and well decorated. God amenities in the bathroom. Nice, clean and comfortable bed. 
All of this together with a wonderful location (walking distance to must-see attractions and lots of subway stations) make this place a no-brainer choice!

title: Celebrated Birthday
text:
Room is awesome, views of Bryant Park are spectacular. Every employee encounter was friendly, courteous and helpful. Valet parking was prompt, amount of time to get car was just as they said.
Be careful of KOI restaurant, grossly over priced for amount and quality of food.

title: Situation parfaite!
text:
Très beau séjour dans cet hôtel dans une chambre avec terrasse. Situation parfaite! À 2 pas du métro, en face du joli Bryant Park offrant le wifi et rempli de chaises et petites tables où vous pouvez vous installer pour faire une pause, mais aussi de Times Square, de la Central Train Station et de Central Park. Notre chambre était spacieuse, confortable, très propre (le nettoyage est fait l’après-midi) et bien équipée. Pareil pour la salle de douche (top!) où il ne manquait rien.
Seuls bémols (séjour du 14 au 20/4/19 dans la chambre 1401): porte fenêtre donnant sur la terrasse malheureusement mal isolée (beaucoup de bruit des systèmes de ventilation à l’arrière et chambre très froide par mauvais temps), pas assez de luminaires, ventilation de la chambre permanente (salle de bain très froide) et penderie toute petite. MAIS bien sûr tout dépend de la durée de votre séjour!! Profiter d’une terrasse par beau temps n’est pas négligeable après une longue journée de marche et visites!Je n’hésiterai pas à retourner dans cet hôtel mais dans une chambre côté parc ;-)

title: Awesome hotel, great service
text: Such a great team working here. We had a red eye that landed early in the morning, Nikki was nice enough to check us in early. We also rented the beautiful screening downstairs for a special screening of our documentary and Avery was awesome and took such good care of us. Rooms are awesome, location is great, service is the best. Thank you guys! Thank you to Nikki, Nicky, Devon, Kevin and Avery for taking such great care of us!!

title: Best Check-in experience ever!
text:
I never write reviews as you can see by my profile. But after a pretty crappy flight the service by Miguel and Job at reception immediately put my wife and I at ease. 

They tried to get us a better room and we have a great view of the park now!

We had a quick drink at the Celon lounge just down from the lobby and are ready for our NYC mini vacation. Thank you!

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
text: From the moment I was greeted stepping out of my taxi to getting to my clean, comfortable room, I felt very taken care of at the Bryant Park Hotel. After a long day of travel, Miguel Enriquez, the Front Office Manager, asked he how my travels were. I am used to that while checking into a hotel, but was surprised that he really listened and made me feel well taken care of. He introduced me to everyone, told me they were all here to make the rest of the trip great. True hospitality! I have never felt so welcomed. The room is really comfortable, well appointed, with a fabulous bed, comfy pillows, and cozy comforter. This is also a fantastic location, just across the street from the awesome Bryant Park!
