I hated to leave the room to go to work, but enjoyed the neighborhood at the end of the day!

title: Trendy Boutique Hotel in Midtown
text: As a former resident of NYC, I wanted to try out the Bryant Park Hotel during a weekend visit. I had read excellent reviews. With a convenient midtown location & superior service, the hotel offers good value. Happily, I had a room on a high floor with a view of the park; it was small but modern. From check-in through checkout I was impressed with the care & concern of the staff. All requests were immediately met.  I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Nice Hotel -- some weird things
text:
This is a beautiful little hotel, with nice rooms on one of the nicest parks in the city -- Bryant Park (at the main library).  We stayed there for a play and a visit to the city.  Now for the weird things:

You get in the elevator, and it's very dark, and all they have are two small red lights.  As our friends said -- we could develop photos in this elevator.  

Second weird thing -- there are few staff on duty.  Don't get me wrong -- they are very pleasant -- but sometimes invisible.

The rooms were great.

But whenever I called the main desk, I never got an answer.

Is this place OK?

Keep in mind -- I'd go back thee -- I like the location, and I love the view -- but you have to be willing to put up with a lot!

title: Not up to usual standards!
text:
We stay here about once a year for 4-5 days.  The location, staff, and unusual layout of the rooms are great.   On this trip, the lock on the door stopped working for the last day.  Security needed to let us  into our room because they couldn’t program the keys.

We had very poor wireless wifi service throughout our stay.  We remember some issues fromthe previous stay, but it was not as bad as this time.  The company that apparently provides the service and handles customer service tried to resolve the problem,  but they were unable to.  We had no problems with either of our ipads,as soon as we connected to a wireless wifi network elsewhere.

We still like this hotel, but this stay was disappointing.

title: Wonderful hotel in a great location
text:
We spent three nights at the Bryant Park Hotel to celebrate my birthday and could not have asked for a better hotel. The hotel is located in a perfect location. It is right across from Bryant park which offers a great place to sit and enjoy a coffee or a drink in the afternoon. The hotel is also right across from the library and an easy 10 min walk to Broadway and Times Square and roughly 15 mins to Central Park. It is also easy to access the subway system from the hotel and is only a 15 min walk from Penn Station. There are a ton of great restaurants near by and Joe's pizza is a 2 min walk. 
The hotel itself was very clean and the rooms are very spacious. Check in and out was smooth and easy. We were also greeted with a very nice surprise in our room, with a balloon and a delicious raspberry tart to celebrate my birthday. A wonderful added surprise to start off the weekend. 
Staff at the hotel is very friendly and they go out of their way to ensure you have everything you need. 
Pros: spacious clean rooms. Great water pressure in the shower and lovely bath products. Friendly and helpful staff. Perfect location. 
Few things to note: the rooms don't have a coffee maker but they do offer complimentary coffee from 6-8 am. The rooms also don't have an iron and ironing board. 
Overall, we were very happy with our stay. We look forward to returning and recommending this hotel to our friends and family.

title: 정말 괜찮은 호텔
text: (뉴욕기준) 방크기도 나쁘지않고, 서비스도 좋은 편입니다. 무엇보다 브라이언트 파크에 위치해있어서 인지, 많이 복잡하지 않고 조용해서 좋았어요. 어디든 이동이 편한 위치여서 편리했습니다. 다만, 룸으로 뭘 부탁드리면 시간이좀 걸리더라구요. 그게 약간 불편했지만 전체적으로 좋은 경험이었습니다.

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel. Great location for many sights. Close to several restaurants and shops. Beautiful park across the street. Very clean and hotel staff very accommodating. They upgraded our room at check in which was such a nice surprise

title: Blown away, as always!
text:
I’m running out of accolades for this exceptional hotel. The management, staff, and restaurant (Koi) is second to none. The Director of Front Office and Guest Services, Darren Sumner, took care of a last minute (family emergency) reservation for me; Ashley, at the front desk, provided an exceptional check-in experience - facilitating an exceptional room; and Yazmin (Concierge and Entertainment Planner), what can I say? She is such a delight, and always treats me as if I’m family. 
I was in town for a family member’s memorial service, and both Darren and Yazmin read my emotions, and went to the trouble of sending me fruit and wine, respectively, upon my return from a long, trying day. Gestures such as these are what sets this hotel apart from any other - the staff and management are proactive, not reactive - rare qualities in the ever-competitive world of hospitality.

title: Great service
text:
Beautiful hotel !
Devin the bellman was amazing and did a great job for the event we had there. 
Ciara the sales manager also did an outstanding 
Job for us and we look forward to a co to hong relationship with them.

title: Perfect location, Quiet and Spacious Suite
text: We spent four nights at the Bryant Park Hotel and loved every minute of our visit.  The hotel is perfectly located near multiple subway stations, a brand new Whole Foods and the beautiful Bryan Park.  We were surprisingly upgraded to a junior suite which was a huge room with king bed, sofa, dining table, big closets and a bathroom with both a tub and walk-in shower.  What a treat! The hotel was extremely quiet which is not always the case in NYC. We didn't eat at the in-house restaurants but both looked wonderful. The staff was helpful and professional.  We will stay there again!

title: Excellent location - spotless rooms
text:
We are a couple from the UK who visited NYC to celebrate a birthday. We have wanted to visit for ages and spent a lot of time choosing our hotel as we wanted it to be special. The location couldn’t be better, really close to the subway and Times Square a short 5 minute walk away. Check in was quick and the staff were friendly.
The hotel staff had left a birthday card, small cake (delicious!) and balloon in our room for my wife’s birthday which was a nice touch. 
The room was light and airy, super clean and spacious, I imagine very much so by Manhattan standards. Housekeeping was excellent - visited twice a day and really pleasant. 
Complementary coffee was available in the lobby in the mornings but not in the rooms which is pretty standard in the US. We didn’t dine in the hotel restaurant so can’t comment although there were always plenty of people in there. 
There are loads of superb diners and coffee shops in the area for authentic and superb NY breakfasts. Particularly liked Andrew’s Coffee Shop which is near Macy’s - again a short stroll away. 
Overall an enjoyable experience!

title: Stylish property with helpful, friendly staff
text: I've stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel before, and I'll happily stay again. It's an attractive, modern hotel with a club vibe in the lobby and elevators - and the rooms are well appointed, spacious (for New York!), comfortable and QUIET. Amenities from Molton Brown are the icing on the cake, and the cherry on top is the attentive staff: personable, eager to help, always warm and kind.

title: No one comes close...
text:
There's nothing better than coming to NYC in the spring.  The city wakes up from its winter slumber and comes alive.  And when I return to the city, BPH is the only place I can think of that gives me everything I want in my stay--unmatched hospitality from the wonderful staff, unparalleled location overlooking Bryant Park, and beautiful / modernized architecture that compliments the New York City's vibrant atmosphere.  There's just no equal.  

Special thanks to Darren Sumner and his entire staff--they always remember my name, always treat me like one of their own, and never fail to do everything with a smile on their faces.  It makes such a difference.  See you soon.

title: Off the chartsgreat service in a fine hotel and great location
text:
A couple of weeks, before my wife and I were scheduled to spend 2 nights at the Bryant Park Hotel, someone called to inform me that the room type we had reserved would be unavailable because of ... well, I don’t remember why.  The reason I don’t remember why is that the guy who called me, Darren Sumner, was so professional, pleasant and attentive that he turned a potentially disappointing situation into a positive interaction. In most situations like this my nature would be to get irritated, cancel my reservation and stay somewhere else. Within about 45 seconds on the phone with Mr. Sumner I was recommitted to staying at the Bryant Park.

Mr. Sumner said that he would accommodate us with an early check in if our room wasn't booked the night before.  I made myself a note to check with the hotel the day before our arrival to see if we would be abvle to check in early.. Before I had a chance to call, Mr. Sumner sent me an email, confirming our early arrival and asking if there was anything he could do for us before we got there.

That was only the beginning our our experience in your hotel.  I wish I had made a note of everyone’s name, because ever BPH employee with whom we interacted was the perfect combination of engaging, personal and professional. The last person we saw, Matt, was a doorman, I believe. As he loaded our luggage, I told him, “I have stayed in nicer hotels in NY, but I have never stayed in one with nicer people.”

Here is some additional information:
The hotel is adjacent to Bryant Park and the New York Public Library. I would request a room overlooking 40th Street. Those overlook the park.We initially booked one of their four suites with balconies overlooking the park, but those were the rooms "taken out of commission" before our arrival because of construction on that side of the building.

We had a suite, so I can't comment on the size of their standard rooms.  I'm guessing that they are like most NY hotel rooms: small. Our ceilings were surprisingly tall, however - a rarity in any hotel. (Again, maybe this was because it was a suite.)

Housekeeping doesn't decide when to clean your room.  There is a note in the room that instructs you to call the front desk when you are ready for your room to be cleaned.  Nice touch.

The hallways on the floors are narrow and somewhat dimly lit. No big deal.  The elevators are tiny. 

The place was clean.

But the reason I will be staying there again is because of the service and people.

title: attention to detail
text: Very friendly staff.  Scott at the front desk took care to make sure our needs  were exceeded, with grander accommodations than expected.  The rooms were clean and spacious and The Hotel is in a great location!

title: Fantastic overnight in Midtown!
text:
The Bryant Park hotel is a great location for a stay in NYC. My husband and I turned thirty this year and did an overnight away from our toddler to celebrate. The location of the hotel is close to public transportation and to many area attractions, so it's super convenient. The staff was wonderful! They were helpful pre-arrival when I called with questions about parking and luggage storage. When we arrived early Saturday morning (9am) planning to drop our luggage off until checkin but they were able to accomodate us and get us into our room that early, which was awesome! 

The room was great - we were on the 11th floor. The room was comfortable and clean and spacious for the city - especially the bathroom, which was huge with a lovely rainfall shower and a big soaking tub. 

Checkout was quick and painless the next morning. Overall a great stay and we'd definitely recommend it to any travelers in the area!

title: My New 'Go 2' in NYC
text:
I've never stayed in this part of NYC before this past St Patrick's Day, and now I cant imagine staying anywhere else. This is the ideal hub in the middle of a wonderful little ecosystem of pubs, parks, and attractions. Lets talk about the staff, I believe that after the initial thrill of a great location wears off, the staff is what makes; or breaks a place. The staff at Bryant Park is fantastic, they're the main reason I'm returning for another stay. The Concierge and especially Hotel Manager Scott Cohen made our stay an exceptional one. Everyone we interacted with was wonderful, the folks at the door, security inside; and the staff at Koi.
Outside you've got Bryant Park, the carousel, and just steps away from the Hotel is The New York Public Library. Also very near the Hotel are some wonderful bars and gastro-pubs, the Concierge at Bryant Park recommended a particularly good one for lunch when we checked in. If you're looking to stay in NYC, look no further than the Bryant Park Hotel.

title: Amazing hotel in NYC
text: We stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel over Christmas and New Year in December. We was blown away by the location, very central and lots of attractions within walking distance. It was both mine and my partners first time to New York. Booked through Expedia and requested a room with a view if it was possible. Well... when we walked into the room our view was of the Empire State Building!! It was wonderful and could be seen from the bath and our bed, which was lovely and I felt our request had been really considered! The room was also bigger than I had expected it to be! Reception were very happy to help with booking broadway shows, route planning and choices of restaurants. I was very impressed and won’t hesitate to book again next time we visit!

title: 10 out of 10
text: We had an amazing stay at Bryant Park Hotel last weekend celebrating my wifes birthday. Never met a friendlier and more help full staff! The room was great and the view over the park and the skyscrapers around Times sq. is astonishing! And of course location, location, location (!) one block away from Times Square.

title: Terrific location, staff and service - my favorite NYC hotel
text: This is a terrific hotel, whose upbeat and knowledgeable staff have a can-do attitude.  The location is ideal, with a lovely park just across the street and theatre, shopping, Grand Central etc. within easy walking distance and a subway stop on the corner.  The rooms and amenities are very nice.

title: Bryant Park Hotel - Love it!
text: Absolutely fabulous! My favorite hotel to stay in NY. Across from Bryant Park so in the center of the city but nice, open space in front of you. Walk 5 blocks to the heart of Times Square so you're close but not too close. Subway right on the corner if you want it. Rooms are fab - wood floors, high ceilings, large bathrooms. Staff is amazing. Highly recommend.

title: 6 day business trip
text: One of the best hotels I have stayed in in NYC. Great location on Bryant Park.  Scott, the front desk manager changed the room since this was a long 6 day stay, so I got beautiful views in a large room on the 21st floor. Never needed to wait for the elevator. The staff are exceptional. If you have the budget, this is 100% guarantee of enjoyment place.

title: Cosa c’è di meglio?
text:
La location è veramente strategica a Midtown. Vista spettacolare sul parco, suite super confortevole arredata con gusto in stile moderno e in più una cortesia senza pari. Ad un prezzo niente male per NYC.
Grazie a Miguel per un’accoglienza veramente top class!

title: Favorite place to stay in NYC
text: NYC can be overwhelming at times - especially Midtown - and the Bryant Park Hotel is an oasis.  The rooms are spotless.  The location is excellent. And the service is top notch, across the board.  Miguel and Job at reception were amazing - I felt welcomed like a home away from home. Thank you!

title: Loved the Bryant Park Hotel
text: I knew i wanted to stay in a central location in midtown and picked the Bryant Park Hotel from all the wonderful google reviews. I highly recommend this hotel!! Our room faced the carousel in Bryant Park and the room was HUGE! I expected a box in NYC but instead we got two full beds, a couch, coffee table and desk. Tons of closet space and a huge bathroom with robes and slippers. The staff could not have been more pleasant and accommodating. I loved the security guard checking for a room key before we entered the elevator to go to our room. this hotel was amazing and well worth the money, i  highly recommend. and the sushi restaurant next door was amazing as well!

title: Amazing staff!
text: Not only is the Bryant Park hotel a beautiful property with a great location, the staff are exceptional. The moment we arrived, Miguel and Job welcomed warmly. They upgraded our room to one with more space and a beautiful terrace. Every morning the staff at the front desk provided helpful transportation tips and restaurant recommendations. Everyone was so helpful and welcoming.  We have been completely spoiled and can't imagine staying anywhere else when we visit New York!

title: great park view and service
text:
This is a lovely boutique hotel right across from Bryant park.The Lobby is not big , 
but the rooms are big by New York standards. the bathrooms are a nice size with nice bath products. Coffee was available in the lobby at 7 am. I
loved the location especially in the warmer months ..The park is nice with food kiosks
and lots of seating to have a picnic .Whole foods is nearby. My  adult children had a great room with a view of the park and plan to return in Jjune.

title: Great Service
text: Both Job and Devin were fabulously friendly, welcoming and helpful getting into town after a busy day of travel.  They quickly for me settled into a gorgeous room and helped me navigate the area ahead of my meetings! Thank you.

title: The Bryant Hotel in spring
text:
My wife and me just stayed at the Bryant Hotel this March, and it was one of the best stays--if not the best--we have ever had in Manhattan. Because of the hotel's central location on West 40th Street, just south of Bryant Park, we found it easy to set out in every direction, seeing plays, eating at fine restaurants, and visiting the Whitney Museum to see the Andy Warhol exhibit. Also, since the Bryant is situated just behind the New York Public Library, we toured that historic edifice, which she had never visited. We planned to see the Lion King and My Fair Lady, to eat at Patsy's and Gallagher's, and walk to other shopping areas and restaurants. We did them all. 
The staff at the Bryant is courteous and the rooms are spacious and reasonably priced. There was a workout facility on our floor and we used it every day. We would return there in a minute!

title: Glad to have finally stayed in this hotel.
text:
We have always wanted to try this hotel  because of its history. It is a very beautiful Art Deco building and is one of my favorite structures in NYC. We had a 3 night stay here and we were very pleased with the hotel. The classic feel is definitely there but they were able to add modern touches in the minimalist design of the rooms. The only thing we did not like is the color of the carpet as it made the room looked dark. We booked a king room in the inner side of the hotel. No view; however, even though we had the smallest room it is still very spacious for NYC standards. The bathroom is also a good size with a large tub. We were surprised that there is a turn down service at night. Our room was serviced promptly each day and staff is wonderful. Location can’t be beat and the subway is just a few steps away. 

We enjoyed the experience. For us, this property is 4.5 and is one the best classic hotels  that we have ever stayed at in NYC.

title: Sam and Ran
text:
Very good hotel .. rooms and bathrooms are clean 
Location is super fabulous 
The price and quality is much better compared to other nearby hotels
The staff was very nice at reception and during our stay

title: Bryant Park Hotel
text: We stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel and it was great! The rooms were very nice and the staff was very nice, helpful and professional. Sarah, In housekeeping was great and our room was spotless every day when we got back from sightseeing. I would definitely recommend Bryant Park for a stay in New York. The area was very pretty, with the park being right in front of the hotel.

title: Excellent service and location
text: I mixed business and pleasure by having my daughters join me at the end of my stay.  The staff is very friendly and helpful. Brian and Miguel are always looking forward for having a nice room with the necessary accommodations (ie. two beds of needed) and the nicest view.  They helped bring up to my room shopping bags we dropped and also with late check-out.  The KOI restaurant and the Bar at their hotel are excellent, and is also very well located.  Always enjoy my stay here, thank you all!

title: Practically perfect in every way
text: Stayed twice this month - an overnight and a three night stay....each time things were smooth sailing...quiet rooms...gorgeous bathrooms....comfy bed...fluffy robes and helpful staff...doesn’t get much better.

title: New favorite hotel
text: The staff was very friendly when I checked in. I didn’t get to check out the club but it sounded like a lot of fun. My room was quiet and clean with a great view of the park. The bathroom has a separate showe and tub which was amazing.

title: Awesome Hotel - Even Better Staff
text: The Bryant Hotel is a tremendous find.  Great restaurant, beautiful rooms and phenomenal location.  Miguel and Dennis at the front desk are absolutely the best - their welcome made me feel like I was coming home!

title: Lovely Hotel with Friendly Staff in a Great Location
text: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel. Sorry New Yorkers - I am not a big fan of this city’s crowds and chaos. But this hotel helps immensely. Super friendly staff, calming atmosphere and great views of the cityscape and park. Highly recommend staying here for either business or leisure.

title: Great hotel with perfect location
text: Its been more than a year since I last visited the Bryant Park Hotel and it still is as great as ever.  Dennis at the front desk was such a pleasure to talk too after a long day of travels. He made the check-in so easy and personable.  The location is a wow!  Bryant Park is such a beautiful area with the carosel and library.  Only two blocks from Times Square and couple steps to everything.  My room is perfect for what I need to for two days of business meetings.  Quaint and minimalist, great wifi, lots of closet space and a GORGEOUS bathroom with marble, a soaking tub and shower and great amenities.  One of the best minibars I've seen in a while, I love the umbrella in the closet as well as the take away bag should you need one for all your NYC purchases.  Dining at Koi tonight and will write a review tomorrow! Value is great when compared the Courtyard just down the street being the same price.

title: Excellent Value x Excellent Location
text:
Traveled to the city for a weekend of catching up with college friends.  The rates for the Bryant Park were only slightly more than some value chains nearby so I decided to spend a little extra. It was well worth the extra money.

The check in was quick and easy, I was offered a bottle of water and was quickly sent on my way up to my room.  All weekend long, all of the staff was extremely friendly and went out of their way to see if I needed anything.  

Location was fantastic, easy walk (4 blocks) from Grand Central.  You have good access to multiple subway lines on both the east and west sides of Manhattan.  You are also directly on Bryant Park which makes for rare sense of neighborhood within the city.  Really good variety of coffee/food options within a short walk in any direction.  

The room was plenty big with a queen-size bed and two small couches (more decorative than practical.)  I am someone who like a very firm pillow and is constantly disappointed at hotel pillows, not at Bryant Park, the pillows were fantastic.  There were outlets available next to the bed, which is not the case at some hotels.   

The bathroom was large with a glassed-in shower.  In my experience, those shower doors tend to leak all over the floor, but not this time. The water pressure in the shower was the best I've ever experienced, no exaggeration.  

Lastly, I've stayed at several hotels in NYC where the elevators are slow or work poorly.  The elevators here were fast and efficient.  In regards to noise, I stayed over St. Patrick's Day weekend and never heard a thing.  

Depending on your budget, the Bryant Park Hotel offers great value and the opportunity to experience a luxury hotel-lite experience at less than luxury prices.

title: Great hotel and awesome location
text: This was our 2nd time staying at the hotel and they always impresss.  The room was nice and we had a great view of Bryant Park.  We love that it’s in a awesome location and we can jump on the subway without a problem!  Staff was very accommodating.

title: Still great
text: It’s been two or so years since my first review so thought I should post an update. After trying many hotels around the city, back in 2017 we discovered the Bryant Park Hotel and felt at home. Fast forward to today and something like 10 stays later and suffice it to say it’s still our home in the city. The staff, the rooms, the locations - you can’t beat it. It’s not large so the ejevstirwait is minimal, the rooms are bright so you know it’s clean, and the team will go out of the way to help. Miguel is a star and has helped me many times booking (I just book my next trip while staying there). On our trip this past weekend we got to talk more with Devon and he was every bit as professional and kind as everyone else. We’ll see you in two months, BPH!

title: 5 Star
text: Great hotel. I met my friends for a very fun weekend. The entire staff was fantastic. The young man at the door (devan?) was very funny and helped with directions also Miguel at the front desk was very professional. The restraunt koi was very good. My only complaint would be the fact that there was construction that woke me up early in the morning, so i would recommend getting a room not facing the street.

title: Awesome location, lots of noise !
text:
I recently stayed 3 nights in the Bryant Park Hotel. The location is amazing right in midtown and so close to
all the main tourist attractions. The staff were super friendly and helpful. My room was big (much bigger than others in NYC) but I was on the fifth floor at the front and it was really noisy. I had constant traffic, renovations in the park and a couple in the floor above me. It was so loud that even with ear buds I couldn’t sleep soundly.

I loved this hotel but it has really put me off staying here again. I would definitely ask to be on the higher up floors.

title: Loved this place
text: Great location, easy access to subway, TS, midtown, etc. Great room, very sleek, clean and modern with an awesome bathroom. Staff very professional and nice, looked like there were great restaurant options on site too. I hope to stay here again when it's not so cold and Bryant Park is a more attractive place.

title: feb 2019
text: From the time you arrive you are welcomed.  The front desk staff is always on their A game.  They remember your name and the housekeeping staff are first class.  Always friendly and informative, this is the place to be in New York.

title: Hôtel chic
text:
Magnifique façade de l’hotel situé au centre de Manhattan. La chambre est lumineuse avec une grande salle de bain. Le personnel chargé du ménage et les portiers sont sympathiques et bienveillant tandis que les receptionnstes plutôt indifferént aux clients.
Le restaurant le Koi est fabuleux il faut absolument le découvrir !!!

title: Lovetotrav3
text: The Bryant Park Hotel has the most outstanding service!  The attention to detail, friendliness and outgoing personalities of the staff were five star. I felt like a star upon arrival. I was greeted by Devin who opened the door and took my bags. He directed me to the counter where Job set me up with my room.  These young men made me feel like a super-guest. I loved every minute of my stay and I will be back!

title: Not What It Was
text:
I have stayed here many times though not for a few years. While it is still a great location with nice rooms, the service has definitely gone downhill. Supplies in the room were not replenished, room service had to be called an hour after we ordered coffee and none appeared, and there are no longer doormen opening and closing the outside doors.
It may seem petty but these are the details that take a hotel from being ok to excellent. I am afraid the Bryant Park no longer falls into the latter category.

title: Very helpful and nice!!
text:
Devin was very hospitable as we walked in the doors and helpful!!

Job at the desk was the same!!

Very nice place to stay.  I would recommend this hotel to any one of my friends.  Our view was spectacular!!

title: Heart of NYC
text: This is my second time staying with the BPH. Highlights, got an upgrade when they found out it was a birthday weekend! Th ease of check in and helpful advice from the front desk made us feel that they genuinely cared about our experience. Always smiling, upbeat attitudes, willingness to help answer questions. That just tops of the cleanliness, sharp decor, size of bathroom and convenience of location. They even offer valet parking as an option if you are driving in. Loved it from start to finish. Thanks again for a beautiful stay! I returned back with a friend to visit Celon Lounge which is right downstairs in the hotel and that was also a great experience as well! Great Cocktails, great music, beautiful decor! Overall, BPH has won us over.

title: February in NYC - Great Hotel at Fabulous Off-Season Prices
text: Super-convenient location, ultra-friendly and helpful staff, clean, modern, with high-end bars and restaurants on premises. Easy to love this place and definitely always want to return. Highly recommend.

title: Not a true upgrade
text: I always stay in this hotel when I am in New York. It is well located. However, last night experience was not great at all. The reception said that she upgrade me to a junior suite.It is room 504. It is oppositie to a 24-hour gym. The whole night there is a bee noise. So I think that it may be the airconditioner. Therefor eI turned it off but the nosie was continued. Finallt fndd out that it is  due to the boiler outside my window. The shower head was broken. I was not tall. The shower head is the same height of me and is close to the wall. Extremely difficult to have a good shower. The gym door banging starting from 5am. Not nice.

title: Bryant Park
text:
Beautiful and spacious room in an excellent location! We got a surprise free upgrade on our room and the staff was very courteous
 There was a small error with our valet parking and they didn't charge. Only reason not to give 5 stars was the lack of coffee machine in the room.

title: Nice Surprise
text: My husband and I were meeting friends in NYC who were staying at the Bryant Park Hotel. I was concerned the hotel was too trendy for us. We are rather sedate and the idea of a nightclub put me off a bit. But the location was excellent and the price was right - well, it was where are friends were so that is where we were going to be too. When we arrived it was a later on a Friday night, there was a line at the door to get into the restaurant. Everyone was quite young and hip.  I felt a little out of place but the check-in went very smoothly. I really appreciated the bottles of water after traveling. The very dark elevators with red lights threw me again but I was happy I kept an open mind. We had a queen deluxe room. It was surprisingly quiet, bright and clean. It was a good size room by Manhattan standards. There was a large tub with a separate shower. Nice Milton Brown amenities. The bed was comfortable. This time we had traveled light so the small closet and nightstand/dresser sufficed. There was turndown service nightly which is always nice. We ordered room service for breakfast and once for dinner. Room service was 30 minutes or less each time. Very professional waitstaff and a follow up call to make sure everything okay. They promptly picked up our trays. The excellent bran muffin was served warm the way I requested it. I especially appreciate attention to details like that. MJ at the front desk helped me with our checkout. She was friendly, warm and efficient. In fact, overall all the staff was quite courteous and they set a great tone to our stay. There are many choices in NYC and we would put this at the top of our list for our next trip.

title: Great Location
text: perfect location for anything you want to do in the theater/times square locations.  Staff was very friendly and the check in process was pretty fast especially for a holiday weekend.  Our room was on the 7th floor overlooking the park and was plenty big enough for 2 travelers.  We had a room with 2 beds, which were very comfortable.  The only 2 downsides...none of the plugs in the room worked to charge our phones except the ones in the bathroom.  The sockets were really loose, so the chargers wouldn't stay plugged in.  When we called maintenance, he came to the room and said although the plugs work, the moulding around the sockets was too bulky.  If you already know about the issue, I would think you would find a way to take care of it?!  The other issue was the heat.  You can't control the temperature from your room.  It was extremely hot in our room, and the only way to "fix" it per the maintenance man was to have them turn down the boiler in the basement  They did, and although it was still warmer than we like, it was much better the second night than it was the first night.  Even though these issues were annoying, it wouldn't deter me from staying here again.

title: Good hotel in a good location
text:
Stayed for 3 nights in this hotel, lots of positives which include one of the fastest check in and check outs ever, which was appreciated, good sized rooms, comfy bed, lovely molten brown bath products and a great location.

Less positive was the slow service at breakfast and no gluten free bread, the outside noise I could hear from the room wasn’t flash and the main hotel bar (although served good drinks) was underground and really dark.

Overall, would definitely stay again but would ask for a higher room not overlooking the park.

title: Lugar fabuloso
text: Fuimos por tres noches, y he de decir que el hotel es fabuloso, desde que llegas hasta que uno se va, no hay un solo aspecto negativo que decir. Todo el personal amable y eficiente ,tanto recepcionistas como personal que se encuentra en los ascensores. Hotel situado en un lugar perfecto, sin todo el bullicio de times square pero a 2 minutos andando de allí. Parada de metro al ladoz, lugares icónicos de NY a pequeños paseos. Sin duda un gran sitio para volver a hospedarse

title: Nice business stay
text:
Very convenient location. My room had a great view on Bryant Park
The hotel only has a few rooms per floor, which makes it smaller and more personal than your typical large hotel. Staff is welcoming and helpful.
Furniture is simple and functional, somewhat minimalist. Bathroom was clean, large and with lots of light coming through 2 windows, but not new. 
The Koi restaurant can deliver meals to your room and is very good, although not cheap.

title: Best Location in NYC
text: Perfect location for walking to your Broadway show, coffee in the park, stroll uptown...  The staff is efficient and pleasant, the hotel is fun with a modern feel.  The Bryant Park is a hotel we return to time and time again.

title: Fantastic Staff in Perfect Location
text: Been staying at the BPH for years. The staff changes, as to be expected, but the service remains extraordinary. Accommodating, friendly, attentive. Miguel, John, Yasmine, and Matthew deserve specific recognition. Thanks as always.

title: Hotel perfecto
text:
Elegí este hotel por su ubicación (en el mismísimo Bryant Park) y porque encontré una buena oferta. 

La experiencia fue perfecta. La habitación era enorme, la cama comodísima y con un montón de amenities disponibles.

El baño también gigante y con una enorme ducha. Todo muy nuevo y moderno. Un detalle que me encantó es que te dejan un albornoz y zapatillas.

Lo único que me decepcionó es que la habitación no tuviera vistas al parque. Imagino que es sería porque cogimos la oferta.

title: Superb location with stark, but well-designed rooms
text: An enjoyable spot with excellent staff presents an excellent crash pad for your NYC visit.  The location is hard to beat, with Bryant Park right across the street with it's food options and local events.

title: Love, Love, Love this Hotel. My NYC Favorite!!
text:
Thank you so much for another fabulous stay!! We stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel for my birthday for 2 nights based on previous stays at the hotel that were very memorable. Staff were extremely friendly on arrival. I have Expedia Gold Status and we were upgraded to a room with a view of the the park on the 4th floor. It was spacious, with a separate sitting area, large windows and and an expansive bathroom. I love that there is plenty of room for luggage and to hang clothing. There were chocolates, a card and a balloon left for my birthday which was a lovely touch. The location can not be beat!! Across from Whole Foods and Juice Press, Blue Bottle Coffee is just next to the hotel and the subway stop is on the corner. 

Thanks again!!

title: Localização imbatível
text: Passei uma semana neste hotel em Setembro/2017. Estava tudo ótimo, a localização é excelente, dá pra chegar em várias atrações a pé (Central park, 5a. Avenida, Rockefeller Center, Times Square). Fácil acesso às linhas de metrô no próprio Bryant Park e também na Times Square. Quartos de bom tamanho e a limpeza é ótima. Não peguei o café da manhã, mas tem uma padaria/café excelente na mesma quadra.

title: Great location but hotel needs attention
text:
Check-in was ok and I was quickly in my room.
On entering my room it was obvious it had not been cleaned, there was ketchup down one curtain, the rug in the room was filthy, the desk was greasy and had obviously been used as an eating area.
I had to go back to reception and complain as they couldn't be bothered to answer the phone, when I returned from the office later that day the room had been cleaned but it wasn't great.
Next morning I ended up having to shower with no hot water, I mentioned this to reception and they said they would look into it. That evening when returning to the room there was still no water.
An engineer arrived an hour later and was in the bathroom for about 30 mins, turns out I needed to run the bath taps and the shower taps to get hot water in the sink. To get hot water in the shower I had to run the taps in the bath!
This is a 5* hotel, really!
Expectations certainly aren't met at this hotel and not even one single apology whilst I was there, this is not a hotel I'll go back to. Shame as it is really convenient for my office.

title: Love this place
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Bryant Park Hotel during a 2-day trip to NYC. Attentive staff and clean, comfortable and good size rooms. Hotel is in a Terrific location. We’ll be back next year.

title: Midtown Excellence at a Fair Price
text: Wonderful smallish hotel on the south side of Bryant Park, just off 5th Avenue.  Nice rooms, staff is exceptional -- courteous, friendly, knowledgable.  Only recommended improvement:  Provide coffee in the lobby in the morning, or at least make take-away coffee an option in the attached restaurant.

title: Il TOP nel cuore di New York
text: Siamo stati al The Bryant Hotel la settimana di Natale per il nostro viaggio di nozze. L'albergo gode di una posizione strategica nel cuore di NY e nello storico parco proprio di fronte all'albergo vi era un mercatino natalizio e una pista di pattinaggio....davvero caratteristici! Il personale dell'albergo è stato a dir poco gentile, impeccabile nell'accoglienza e attento ad ogni nostra esigenza. Non appena hanno saputo che eravamo in viaggio di nozze, al nostro rientro ci hanno fatto trovare un'ottima bottiglia di Prosecco e dei palloncini a forma di sposi (è stato un gesto molto apprezzato). Vi era molta sicurezza all'interno, poichè essendoci un lounge bar "Célon" e un ristorante "Koi" (giapponese, Asian straaaaaaaaaaaaaaa buono, ve lo consiglio!!) vi era sempre un gentilissimo impiegato dinanzi le porte degli ascensori che si assicurava degli ospiti dell'albergo...oltre ovviamente agli altri presenti nella hall. Per quanto riguarda la pulizia della stanza...beh ragazzi difficilmente troverete una stanza e un bagno (enorme, con una doccia in marmo di carrara...bellismo) così ben puliti, i nostri complimenti a YUMI la ragazza che si occupava della nostra camera. E' stato un soggiorno fantasico e il "The Bryant Park" è proprio il top ...  ci hanno fatto sentire a casa!

title: Fabulous hotel and location
text: We stayed at the Bryant Park hotel for three nights in January and absolutely loved it - the staff really went out of their way to make it a memorable stay. Upon arrival we were welcomed with a  personalised surprise in our upgraded room to mark our celebration, we also had a partial view of the park and a huge room with amazing bathroom. The huge bathtub was most welcome after long days out exploring in cold temperatures! The location cannot be beaten - it is so convenient for everywhere that we rarely got a cab or used the subway. Thank you for a great stay!

title: Excellent location and service
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights visiting our NYC office and was upgraded to a suite. 

Lovely welcome gift of fruit on arrival. 

The room was spacious, clean and well laid-out. Views over Bryant Park were excellent. 

Good array of soaps etc and shower was fantastic. 

Very good service level at front desk as I would expect. 

Breakfast wasn’t great value & my advice would be to eat out.

title: Great Location!
text: We were there for college visits.  Central location.  Beautiful park across the street.  The rooms are small but comfortable and the bathroom was awesome!  Woul love to come back sometime when we can stay a little longer.

title: idéal pour visiter NY
text:
Hotel trés sympa . la chambre était belle. La vue sur le parc et les immeubles de Manhattan juste magnifique , surtout la nuit. 
une petite attention , chocolats , gâteaux ... chaque jour . 
personnel trés gentil 
et  hôtel idéalement situé en plein centre de Manhattan

title: Nice Hotel and very friendly staff
text: The hotel is nice and the staff are very friendly. The rooms are clean and well laid out. Have stayed here twice on my visits to NY. There is a lovely Moroccan themed bar in the basement of the hotel which is a lovely place to have a drink Monday to Thursday. Friday however... It is packed with young uni students and the bar turns into a nightclub of sorts. I did not hear any music or noise when I was in my room. (apart from NY traffic, which is normal). Being NY privacy from the window is limited ... unless your room is facing the park.

title: Anniversary Weekend
text:
My wife & I have stayed at Bryant Park Hotel now several years for our anniversary. What a wonderful place and what a great experience.
When we arrive, the staff is always great, and full of surprises. Once again, a room with a great view of the Park, a bottle of champagne, and this year beautiful flowers for my wife. I cannot say enough about the service, 2nd to none !
Wonderful room, impeccably clean, and a perfect location. 
Thank you !!

title: Our favorite hotel period!
text: It is difficult to describe adequately the amazing time we had at this hotel. Starting from the spectacular room, the outstanding front desk management and service (thank you Miguel and Dennis T.,) the exceptional concierge Sara, the excellent restaurant Koi, and attention to every detail throughout our stay.   We have been there three times for my birthday now, and there is nowhere else I could imagine celebrating!

title: A Gem of a Place to Stay
text: The Bryant Park Hotel is perfectly located in the mid-town area. Walking distance to the theater district and good shopping.  The hotel staff are wonderful - friendly, yet very professional.  I was pleasantly surprise of the size of the room and bathroom. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Bryant Park Hotel comes thru again
text: We once again can't say enough good things about this staff and hotel.  When we called the front desk with a TV issue, they were right on it.(couldn't get one of the channels for the playoffs). Wewill continue to stay there on our visits to NYC.

title: Second to None!
text: As a travel photographer, I have stayed at many fine, and not so fine, hotels. In June of 2018, I was in town (my hometown, by the way) because my work was being exhibited at Robin Rice Gallery in the west village. It was important to me that my trip got off to a good start, so I was confident that my request for a park view at Bryant Park Hotel would be honored. As it turned out, and to my dismay, I was initially given a deluxe queen room without a view. Sensing my disappointment, the reservations specialist, Yazmin, quickly jumped into action and offered me a Junior Suite, on a high floor, with a panoramic view of Bryant Park - all for a very reasonable monetary upgrade. On top of that, when I returned from my exhibition the following day, Yazmin had left a present for me in my room - along with a congratulatory note! Her quick thinking turned what could have been a disappointing experience into one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had - and I've stayed at hundreds of properties. Couple this with impeccable service, and incredible sushi restaurant, and a great location, the Bryant Park Hotel ranks, in my opinion, as the best in the US - and I have stayed at the George V in Paris, The Park Hotel in Tokyo, and Gritti Palace in Venice.

title: One Year Anniversary
text: I haven't been to this hotel in just about a year. I got an email asking for a review and if its any indication of how well this establishment is run, I decided to take 5 minutes of my time and oblige that email. It was my wife's (fiance at the time) birthday so we were headed into the city to see a show and take in the sights.  Called up the Bryant Park hotel at the last minute and they could not have been more helpful from start to finish.  Found us a great room with a killer view. The room was beautiful and the bed was comfortable.The front desk directed us to some fantastic eats, introduced us to their brand new lounge/bar/club area (not entirely sure which it was, things were a little hazy by the time we made it back to that location).  Each person from the doorman to the room service to the gentleman who operated the elevators were both professional and charismatic. If we're ever looking to spend a special night in the city, I can't imagine anywhere else providing the same or better level or service. Highly recommend

title: New York Trip
text: Exceptional location and wonderful service. Am a repeat customer and this property does not disappoint. Loved the spacious room and the additional thoughtful touches surely make the stay even more enjoyable. Not sure why you guys did away with the fruit in the gym, was an excellent snack after a workout.
